Then we have the fact that war is pretty much starting to look inevitable as actions by those in power are felt in the world of Blackthorn.If brutally frank I really did not enjoy the constant back and forth between Caitlin and Kane. Yes I know Kane has his reasons for his evasion but it just felt way to much angst for me and at times I just wanted to bang their heads together! Fear not though as characters from previous books appear here which really opens up the bigger picture and answers are forthcoming. The story isn't quite over though but (hopefully) Caitlin and Kane might just walk away with trust between them. One thing that struck me was just how different this story by a fellow Brit read. Words are used that never seem to appear in bog standard paranormal which made a refreshing change as yes I wear knickers and not the dreaded panties! I mean yuk children are taught doggy not dog to make it seem more cuddly and less threatening , so since when did an item of intimate apparel become scary? Ok rant over but the joy of seeing such words as "mardy" used cannot be downplayed. A good addition to this series but it will leave you wanting more!I was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

Well we are back with the Fae in the Cold Iron series and I'm just loving how each book is completely different to the last. Yes this world and the story within of a wall separating the Queen and her court from humans keeps building but each book does kind of work as a standalone . This book does the impossible though and actually takes a villain and turns him into a hero!Finn has constantly made mistakes recently and taking on his old enemy has left both his home and the Fae he protects broken. His son has deserted him but he has a cunning plan involving the Penitent to get him back as without him the Fianna are terribly vulnerable. Now if he could just find time to persuade the human Ann Phillips into his bed then life would be joyous indeed!Ann doesn't trust the head of the local Irish mob but when a student of hers appears to be in trouble and abused she knows just where to look for help. Finn opens Ann's eyes to his world of fair folk but it's a dangerous place. Finn sets in motion a plan to help the child but before he has time to act the boy is kidnapped by a vicious Druid. What happens next plunges them all into danger as long dead secrets are revealed and the most vile and untrustworthy just might turn out to be allies or will they?Another good story with drama, tension and a plot with a tantalising ending. These Fae are not cute or sweet but cruel and dangerous and none more so than Finn and yet the author shows him in a whole new light in this book . He is honourable , brave and struggling to protect those he sees as his . Letting go of anger and revenge to embrace new beginnings is never easy but as the conflicts change focus he steps up. Ann is a huge surprise to all including herself! To say more would ruin the surprise but I can say she's strong, has morals and a genuine desire to save others. If honest I wasn't totally convinced by their almost instant love but could believe that two people who had closed off their hearts could somehow learn to trust each other. It's not an erotic story full of raunchy scenes but there are intimate moments between the couple.This author seems to enjoy redeeming her characters and I'm curious what will happen to the Prince Consort as every good paranormal story needs a bad guy to boo and hiss at. I suspect the Penitent might be up next but whoever it is I know I will be eagerly downloading it. This series showing Fae in the modern world and those who help humanise them is very entertaining . Although this seemed lacking in the romance department it was still a book that had me up late reading it and I guess there's no better recommendation than that!I was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

I remember when I first realised a dragon lived above Santuary and just how curious about his place in the Dark hunters world I was. Then nothing really seemed to come of that snippet until recently the author seems to be revisiting her roots . I know a lot of readers will be surprised by the story featuring Maxis and possibly just a teensy bit disappointed because there are several characters waiting in the wings and readers have been clamouring for their stories. What Ms Kenyon has done here though is tie this book up to a much older series featuring the Lords of Avalon and if you thought the strife between the Arcadians and Katagaria was already complicated prepare to have your head spinning around!No one makes their characters suffer more than this author. This couple are a perfect example of the pain and suffering those in this fascinating world face. Most definitely star crossed lovers because they are two opposite sides of a very messy coin. One born human and capable of shifting into dragon form and the other hatched from an egg with the ability to shift into a human body. Ironically it's the dragon born (Katagaria) who seem far more humane in this story but mistakes have been made on both sides . As this story begins it's up to Seraphina to convince the mate she let down ( try nearly got killed!) that he should help her rescue her missing twins. Max is honourable and so very protective of his offspring but hides dark secrets and when the truth comes out it looks like all out war is about to descend!I love this authors ability to surprise and entertain me. Her characters are never one dimensional and I'm addicted to the sharp dialogue. It's such a very complicated world though and I had to take a minute to remind myself just who was who. Oh I'm fine with the regular contingent at Sanctuary and of course our much loved Dark Hunters but just sometimes all the various demons, gallu and pantheons have me pausing to remember when I last read about them. In this book we see the workings of the Amazons in the were hunter world as well to add to the ever expanding story arc . I seem to think that I prefer the older books in this series but just can't stop reading them as I keep hoping for more Nick, Savitar or Jaden but then the author must follow her muse but I really hope it leads her back to those incredibly passionate Dark Hunters soon. I'm really glad my library stocks this series

This review is for the second book in the Steampunk Chronicles and definitely works very well as a standalone. The steampunk genre is quite familiar to this reader with it's very different timeline for historical events and crazy use of machinery . This author however has her own unique take with Frankenstructs having recently been declared human. Now these incredible beings are composed of cloned body parts but each can think for themselves and has free will but for far to long have been used as slaves and treated abominably . Unfortunately they are still feared and hated by some but as this story shows these incredible Frankenstructs are more than capable of feeling!Captain Kaysana is on a mission to try and stop the plague that's quickly sweeping the land. A plague that brings sex driven flesh eating zombies and unfortunately not even her own Airship is safe. Escaping with Sten a Frankenstruct she feels she has no choice than to continue but the lust is affecting them and keeping a clear head seems nigh on impossible. Sten treats Kaysana like no man before and try as she might to ignore what he offers Kaysana is far from immune . Sten had been intruiged by the fiesty Captain before but now he has her right where he wants her and it's on her knees , at his mercy but his goal is only her pleasure and complete and total capitulation!I think if new to this genre than this is an easy book to follow as it's not bogged down by too much machinery and inventions. There's been a war brewing but this story fixates on the plague that is rapidly escalating. If truthful I was a bit in the dark about some aspects of it's origin but could easily see that like some modern viruses this was a pandemic that could bring terror to the world. The lust generated by this plague quickly escalates bringing violence and death but as the story progresses our intrepid couple reach the epicentre but their journey is far from mundane. Expect an alpha male to take control and show his woman just how kinky she can really be!Ok first of all characters and Kaysana has an awful lot of backbone but she's driven by past events in her life. Kaysana has no reason to love Frankenstructs and tries so hard to deny her attraction to Sten but frankly that's a lost cause!  Sten is perhaps too controlling for some readers and their initial physical interaction might seem anything but consensual . That being said it's clear Sten has strong feelings towards Kaysana and truly desires to bring her only the sweetest release but boy does he get creative! Some readers might be shocked by just how Sten proceeds but it's a story that unashamedly proclaims it's BDSM elements so just go with the flow. As for supporting characters well Emily stole the show and I'd love to read more about her and it would be remiss of me not go mention a certain wolf Cadrach who you could say helps save the day !Read this book with an open mind and enjoy the passion and romance. This is without a doubt a love story that just happens to be kinky and quite explicit at times. If honest there isn't a huge amount of world building but I suspect that might be addressed in the next book. I finished this and unfortunately I'm a little hazy about the origins and intent behind the plague. There is a pivotal scene but I still feel I'm left with questions but to say more would give spoilers . I would recommend this book to these who don't mind erotic scenes but do want a solid story . This was an adventure with a happy ending and that's my favourite type of book!I was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

Ok so I admit that most of the sci fi romance I read tends to feature hunky aliens but this author has taken two humans as her lead characters and given her readers quite a creditable story with a hero who is both protective and totally badass! In a world that has been invaded by aliens that sort of resemble  prehistoric creatures but are completely lucid and aware of their brutality we meet the survivors fighting to reclaim their land. Hardly any of humanity survived the initial attacks but those who do band together to destroy their enemy and take back their planet. At a secret military base Hell Squad is one of the teams that regularly put themselves in the firing line. Their leader is Marcus, hardened by war, loyal to a fault and totally smitten by former party girl turned communications specialist Elle. Marcus doesn't see how he could ever be worthy of her and tries to hide his feelings but as the war hots up Elle will be integral to defeating the monsters that now roam the Earth.This is the first book in this series but there's enough information to make it flow very well. Yes we have vicious blood thirsty aliens but the author pits them against the best that humanity can offer. Step forward the courageous men and women working at Blue Mountain military base . It was fun reading how the tough Marcus felt about Elle and at times his thoughts and words were almost poetical which made me smile. Yes he definitely has the woman up on a pedestal but there's a lot more to Elle than just her looks. Elle is braver than Marcus realises, far more stubborn too and a genuine caring person who feels as strongly about him as he does her! Luckily a mission throws them together and when sparks ignite boy does that pair start a fire! Yes well written sexy scenes appear but they are sensual and just felt integral to this story. I really enjoyed the believable dialogue and loved the teasing and banter amongst Hell Squad. Romance action and well written what more do you need?Four and a half from me

This book contains two stories by authors that I have previously read. They are both completely different and view the legend of werewolves in a totally different way. The first by Ms Douglas surprised me as although it's most definitely a ménage tale it felt sweet and romantic . Yes there are numerous sex scenes but the author kept them fresh and different and the characters are the sort that had me cheering for them. No real danger if honest but a little angst that the author quickly disposed of.The second story has much more depth with far more of a mythological background involving the origins of werewolves. I really wanted to like these characters but just couldn't get my head around a supposedly strong alpha female being so wet ( absolutely no pun intended ). It's a far more graphic story but at times felt repetitive, just how often do we need to be told it's close to full moon? If honest I struggled to truly connect with the lead characters but found the supporting Pack to be interesting and quite entertaining with their dichotomy .So two completely different stories but I'm sure each will appeal to some readers. Having read books by both authors before I was shocked to discover my previous thoughts turned on their head. I'd expected the first story to be the most erotic and the second to be far more of a romance but these authors clearly had other ideas. I'm not a huge fan of ménage and seldom seek it out but I did find this book to be entertaining and I'd certainly try more from these authorsI was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

Well this is a hard review to write because I have no wish to ruin the book for anyone else. This is the final instalment of the Reveler series and it's with a heavy heart that I type. This has been such a unique world to fall into and completely unlike any other urban or paranormal story that I have read. It is a series that delves into our deepest fears, rolls around in them and then does the unthinkable , it destroys all that we believe in. Step out into the dream waters and discover a world of nightmares that are more than capable of consuming you!This series has featured several different couples who all interconnect but as the last book ended Steve Coll sacrificed himself in an effort to remove the Sandman from the waking world. This book takes up exactly where that story left off with those in Maze city under siege and those in the waking world still trying to save both those awake and those trapped in dreams with the carnivorous nightmares. This action packed instalment leaves our heroes so damaged and yet they keep fighting. This is not horror and yet the author takes us on a truly harrowing ride. The outcome is an intense story that allows all these fascinating characters to step up in their own inimitable fashions and I wouldn't have missed it for anything. The romance is integral but downplayed so that it just feels right and not intrusive . If you are looking for a dark world punctuated with hope then this series is a must read. Start at the beginning and wallow in the dream waters but never forget to check out just who is sharing those dreams with you! Yes these books are short but they will stay with me for a long timeI was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

It's been quite a while since I've read one of the In Death books but when I spotted this on a Netgalley I just couldn't resist. It's a great concept to showcase the possible workings of New York police in the future and to centre it around such very strong characters . Eve and Roarke are always front and centre but as this series has progressed it's been admirably fleshed out with a supporting cast with all the enthusiasm of the Scooby gang! Now add in the fact that each book is a crime drama to solve with police procedure driving it but with the twist of the addition of futuristic technology. Happily even though it is set in 2061 it still feels like the world we inhabit today but with faster cars, computers etc and of course the addition of droids!There is very little mystery here as the reader already knows from the start just who the killers are. No I'd describe it more as a process as Eve follows the (admittedly high tech) crumbs to unravel a chain of murders that could see a body count of twenty four or even more. The synopsis says "star crossed lovers" so Romeo and Juliet spring to mind but personally I'd liken the killers to the infamous Bonnie and Clyde as they wilfully leave death and devastation in their wake. What brought a fresh prospective to this book was the addition of a Deputy who refuses to just let his case slide and there's even dark cop humour to lighten the mood.As ever Eve is superb and so driven. She's a tough cookie who dislikes the world thinking she has a soft side. Intelligent yes but sometimes left a little bewildered by mundane things. Roarke is her love interest . A self made millionaire who will do anything for the woman he sees as "his cop".Sometimes these books are classified as romance but this time it wasn't really the case. I did enjoy the dynamics of the ensemble cast but the slow unravelling of all the clues just kept me glued to my kindle. One things certain if I or a loved one ever needed help I'd certainly like to have Eve on my side!I was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

This is the second instalment in this authors latest vampire series and we again return to the corrupt and violent land known as Five Bridges. This is a place were those altered by the Flame drug all reside but trust is in short supply and trickery and evil doings are unfortunately an everyday occurrence . Vaughn is a Border Patrol Officer but recently all he can think about is the tempting witch Emma. Both are rare in that they seek to protect the weak and fight the corruption and debauchery rife in their lands but they seem to have become entangled in something with far reaching consequences . It's well known that a dark Wizard is heavily involved in sex trafficking but when Emma and Vaughn discover three murdered teenage girls the race is on to stop these atrocities once and for all. Can they take down the slave ring when so many seem involved? Just how can two so different people work together but to succeed they will have to discover just what being a team really means !I really enjoyed this short story and thought that it really started to further open up this world that Ms Roane has created. Vaughn is such a driven passionate guy with a past that haunts him. Emma knows what it's like to lose someone she loves but still fights to hang on to her humanity in spite of everything. As different species they should be enemies but the chemistry and passion between them just cannot be denied. A huge plus for this reader was the ending as it brought hope to what is a pretty nasty world. Yes I'm really starting to get a feel for this series and will happily read more.I was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

Kelley Armstrong is an author who always seems to deliver top notch urban fantasy and this collection of short stories and snippets is such an interesting mixture. Because of the sheer amount here I won't review each and every one as that might make for an extremely lengthy review and truth be told that might be boring and also I already struggle to reign my enthusiasm in as it is! What I really liked was the simple fact that although we get snippets from her Otherworld and Cainsville universes we are also treated to completely new ( to this reader anyway ) and standalone stories.  Led Astray had me eagerly reaching to read the Otherworld stories as they are my personal favourite. If frank I was a little dissappointed as the couple I adore ( Clay and Elena) are mentioned here but sadly not present and I suspect I'm not the only one missing them. The Pack is present though so watch out for the story V Plates and even vampire Zoe is featured in the stories Learning Curve and The List.  If Cainsville is the series that enchants you then settle down and enjoy learning more about the towns inhabitants and in particular Gabriel in the stories Gabriel's Gargoyle and Devil May Care. I confess I've not yet started that series but this intruiging glimpse has me itching to begin.  As for the other stories here well it was an interesting mixture of just about anything you can imagine. We get a glimpse at a post apocalyptic world in Branded, zombies in both Last Stand and V Plates, there's even a nod to Hell Raiser and Pin head in The Collector! So lots to entertain but also poignant stories because this author reaches out and squeezes her readers hearts in both Dead Flowers by a Roadside and Suffer the children . If a twist in the tale is what grabs yor attention then dive into Rakshasi or Plan B but most of all read this collection and judge for yourselves. I truly was gripped but sadly did miss my favourite characters and had read one or two shorts before but if you are new to this authors work then Im pretty confident that you will be very satisfied and hooked just like the rest of her fans. Shocks, horror, grief, magic and a little romance this collection has it all!I was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

Larissa Ione and Demonica! These words are guaranteed to make my heart beat faster and then you have to add in that it's a M/M story as well! Yes that's right Ms Ione is prepared to take her characters on a truly liberating ride and who knew it could be so enlightening.This book works easily as a standalone but do watch out for cameo appearances from much loved demons. Here we meet Raze a medic and most importantly a Seminus demon. He is an anomaly really as his species can only survive by having sex with females but for Raze its all about those sexy guys out there. Resigned to never experiencing true passion with another male he lives with a Succubus but unknown to Raze she has powerful enemies.Slake is an assassin and pretty good at what he does. This job though puts him through the wringer as not only does his target have a powerful protector in Raze but Slakes own soul is on the line. What should be simple and straightforward is anything but and soon choices have to be made with very surprising outcomes!I am no expert on M/M stories but as a Demonica fan I had to give this story a go and I'm so pleased I did. It's quite a quick read but nevertheless I felt the author gave a well rounded story. A relationship that really shouldn't work but in this world anything is possible.I was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

This is without doubt my favourite sci fi series bar none. Ms Kenyon is at the top of her game with an imagination and talent that few can emulate. Whilst this series is futuristic we are never bombarded with lots of technical details but just enough to enrich the world she has created Amazing world building and a storyline of good versus evil that never grows old. Add in her trademark alpha males with romance in spades and yes I'm a very happy reader.This time it's Hauk the colossal Andarian warrior who steps into the spotlight. He has a truly awful backstory and unfortunately it's a past that still impinges on his present. He agrees to take his nephew on a quest but has no idea that his greatest enemies are closing in on him. When a mysterious injured female is discovered he realizes that she is an assassin but Sumi doesn't seem to want his life no her mission is far more nefarious than that!I really enjoyed this story and boy is it a long one. Both Hauk and Sumi have survived things that would break others but they have come through strong and driven. Sumi is seeking her missing child whilst Hauk just wants to fulfil his duties.I loved honourable Hauk and although he has suffered so much he has so much to give. My heart ached for him but thankfully didn't break as sometimes this author pushes a little too far into darkness with her tortured heroes. A lot of Hauks suffering is caused by his own mother and I wasn't happy with how that played out in this book if honest but there is a joyous ending and most things got neatly tied up. The war between the League and the Sentella continues with obviously more to come but for this reader it's Neros story that I really want.Four and a half from me

Ive been on a sci fi kick recently and had this author recommended to me but I fear I've made a tiny mistake and this is the second in a series. That being said I thought this story started with a bang and never let the pace slow. I admit I've missed a little of the background and world building but nevertheless I found this to be an entertaining read.The Phoenix brothers are treasure hunters and this book focuses on Zayn, whose past haunts him and his new mission is about to truly test his mettle. Ria is an assassin but she desperately wants to leave the Guild but that's impossible or is it? Ria has a cunning plan but she needs the Phoenix boys to help her. Ok so finally her plan is operable but there's a really big fly in the ointment because every time Zayn looks at her it's the face of a dead woman looking back at him, a woman he killed!I really liked the idea of these treasure hunting brothers searching for old earth artefacts. Yes it's an adventure story with a strong romance running through it but the more poignant moments really helped to open it up. There's a huge twist with corruption and secrecy to uncover and although the end seemed almost too pat I didn't really mind. What has me screaming though is the mystery thief Nera Darc and I can't wait to learn more about her. So bottom line I liked it and would read more by this author but my favourite character has to be a certain teenage bomb maker who quite literally blew me away! Fast,fun and entertainingI was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

This author constantly entertains her readers with her imagination. Whether it be shifters or even romantic suspense and now I find that she has turned her hand to sci fi romance too. Rest assured though its still the sort of book that will have you eagerly turning the pages of this fast paced sexy story. This is apparently part of a series but I had no trouble reading it as a stand alone.Set on planet Lumineta where males outnumber females we meet human Leilani who travels into the mountains to help work on a project. Problems arise pretty quickly though when it's realised that she is alone and isn't mated. The solution is to keep her one full moon cycle whilst the lonely males try to capture her interest but in their male dominated society it's two males to every one woman!Ok this was quick and I really liked the snarky heroine. Hold her hostage and just see how awkward a woman can really be! I also enjoyed the dialogue when the males tried to understand and learn more about human females.As for the romance if menage a trois not your thing fear not as this author writes about a fierce alpha with no intention of sharing his prize! There's enough of a subplot to engage interest and the ideas whilst futuristic fitted the story very well. Oh and lest you forget Con may appear human but there's a really big difference and its not the one you might think!So this is science fiction but it's not hard core or dry. This is most definitely a romance and best of all a happy endingI was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

Just finished the arc I received and if you love urban fantasy and haven't started this series then please do so now . This book starts exactly where the previous novel left off with our heroine Matilda standing back in her farmhouse kitchen but so much has changed. She came back from the past having saved time but she's now in a completely different timeline and it's one where she previously didn't survive . Those around her see Evelyn but it's Matilda's consciousness that's steering her Galvanised body. To make matters worse the man she loves seems set on killing her as he has no recollection of just what they mean to each other . Poor Matilda has saved the world only to discover that she's not the only one being dragged through different dimensions and hot on her trail is someone who quite simply wants to rule the world whatever the cost!This book has everything I enjoy. Courageous heroine, strong alpha hero and a truly dastardly villain. Add in the magic that powers the Galvanised, the mutated creatures and an action packed adventure and I'm one very happy reader. With it's crazy mixture of almost Frankenstein characters mixed in with mutated humans and lord I must include those insane creatures because giant lizards ( dragons?) and miniature sheep are not something I read about everyday. Yes I guess you can tell I loved it and this series is a huge recommendationI was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

About a year ago I discovered the steampunk genre and it's such a fun idea. Now in her own inimitable style Ms Silverwood takes the idea and just runs with it! Not just a world featuring almost Victorian ideals, mixed with unusual mechanical objects but a romance with BDSM elements and of course a really solid story.Imagine if you will being created from cloned body parts and then treated as if you really do not matter. Not considered human but known as a Frankenstruct and little more than an object . Our heroine Claire is a Frankenstruct and she has been raised as an assasin but inside is a woman aching to express herself and be free.Theo is by nature what many would consider to be a Dom. Through hard work he has risen to power and is highly respected . When an enemy airship crashes near his home amongst the wreckage he finds an enticing young woman but she's not quite what she seems. Now Theo wants nothing more than to discover all of her secrets. Unfortunately Frankenstructs are illegal but Theo sees the woman within the skin and knows in his heart that Claire is human. What he doesn't realise though is it's quite likely that he is Claire's intended target ! As their relationship develops it takes them both to their own nirvana but for Claire keeping her secret is purgatory !I will be honest and say that this is not the usual heavy steampunk type of story. Yes there are unusual devises and what could be described as quite erotic ones as well but this story mainly concentrates on the budding romance between Claire and Theo. No mechanical limbs here or augmentation but instead Frankenstucts biologically engineered with amazing abilities but the way they are treated is vile. As for the sexual content well Theo does enjoy exerting control both within and indeed outside the bedroom but it never felt forced or abusive. Claire is learning to finally live and relishes the lessons from her new lover as she explores her own submissive side. There are a lot of sexy scenes but I felt the BDSM was quite mild although the equipment and locations were highly inventive! I loved the supporting characters and sincerely hope the author revisits this world as there's a certain Dankyo who is very intruigingFour and a half from meI was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

Marta Cox said: " I've recently discovered that Celia Kyle who writes such fun shifter stories also writes sexy sci fi under the name Erin Tate. What's really funny is I'd read a couple before of them before I realized. So it was with much glee that when asked if I wanted to read this story I most definitely said yes please!Our story begins when a small girl decides to run away from her mum but as there's traffic around its probably not the best idea! Vanessa is distraught with worry for little Tabby but luckily a rather large Ujal warrior steps in and saves the somewhat precocious child. Erun the fierce Ujal believes Vanessa to be an unfit mother and wastes no time in making his opinion known but things are about to get worse when Tabby turns out to be a stolen Ujal child!I'm loving this series about this mermen type race of aliens who have arrived on Earth. It's hilarious how they struggle with our customs and ways. These big tough guys have no idea how to handle women but it sure is fun seeing them try. Our hero Erun has a very dark past and truthfully no reason to trust women so his actions do fit his character. Vanessa whilst a loving mother appears to me to be little too trusting and easily duped but I can say no more as it would reveal a huge plot twist.A well thought out story. Quite funny at times and even though it's a sexy one no instant getting jiggy so it worked very well.

Well if you enjoy raunchy vampire stories then you are in for a real treat with these books. Such entertaining stories and always with wickedly sinful plots. M.s Roane truly paints a picture with her words and this paranormal world( or should that be realm?) Is a joy to lose yourself in.Looking for strong males? Happily I can tick that box. Feisty heroines youwould happily change places with? Well that's covered too. Ok these characters occasionally might be a stubborn but you just know the incendiary romance will all be worth it. Now just add an evil Fae to the plot who schemes her way through totally uncaring who gets hurt and you just know there's going to be action and obstacles aplenty. If you enjoy vampires, weres, magic , a touch of humour and pulsating romance all tied up together then this series is for youI was gifted copies in exchange for an honest review

Oh my yet another story that firmly pushes any and all boundaries. If there is a taboo anywhere in the world then it appears to this reader that Ms Jay is determined to find it and let her characters grind it into dust! This book is not for those seeking sweet romance but if you are prepared to need numerous cold showers whilst rushing back for just one more chapter then this hot instalment is for you!The Guardians of the four realms are facing all manner of problems. They constantly fight the minions of the evil trio born to Apollo and his sister Artemis, it's their duty to protect humanity , one of their own is in a magical coma , Hades son has gone missing and to cap it all Conn has finally scented his Mate! He had hoped of course but never in his wildest dreams did he realise just how hungry for her he would be.Dacia knows she is an Immortal but like her family has tried repeatedly to locate more like herself but to no avail. Now she's determined to be of value and not just as her sisters housekeeper and to that end she's found herself a home and a new mission. What she hadn't expected was for a sexy wolf to just appear and pronounce her his Mate! The attraction is insane but he refuses to touch her. Dacia's body needs him so much but can she trust him? Just who is this Immortal and what exactly isn't he telling her?Love your heroes to be totally alpha , tall, pierced with tattoos and hot? Then allow me to introduce Conn. Except he's not the usual dominating bonehead no he's far more wily than that. He enjoys the chase ( well he is part wolf!) and he has watched his fellow Guardians almost succumb to the madness that the mating frenzy causes. Then of course there's the simple fact that Dacia is pure,innocent and has his inner wolf howling ! No Conn is about to seduce this female and boy is she a lucky lady!Such an amazing series that simply goes from strength to strength. If you love paranormal and are quite partial to some serious hot loving then get these books. In this particular one there are two words that describe it perfectly "extended foreplay"! Ok you might need a minute to digest that and no doubt rub ice upon your neck or something because Ms Jay has her hands on the thermostat and it's set to maximum! The story arc continues to grow with action and mystery but we still are waiting for more answers . Sleeping Gods aside there's trouble as that thoroughly evil Elizabeth excels herself here and of course the poignant truth about the female Guardians and just why Brianne acted as she did but it's an ongoing situation so I need the next book! On the plus side for me this passionate and possessive couple don't share so finally I get the mating ceremony that I want!I was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

A new series from this author who has previously entertained with hot alien romance and even dominant billionaires but as far as I know this is her first foray into a full length cyborg romance and what a doozy it is! From the first pages it's obvious that this futuristic world is a violent one where unspeakable atrocities occur and this author does not shy away from the darker elements . That being said this story is about hope and how no matter what you face anything can be overcome .Ok so yes there's a lot of sexy elements in this book and right from their first scene together Rage and Joan share much more than just a handshake ! Rage has reasons not to trust the humans and even though he starts to see more in Joan than he expected his refusal to trust her absolutely has truly dire consequences . Joan believes in the Cyborgs and wants nothing more than to serve and help protect Rage but the prejudice she suffers is off the charts! Her fellow humans behave in a way that leaves me with no words as I hesitate to ruin this book for others but warning this author goes into the darkest place in humanity but fortunately does not wallow explicitly.Can I believe that Joan loved Rage? Yes absolutely because he doesn't abuse or mistreat her in any way and in point of fact they clearly do bond. As for Rage and his fellow cyborgs I loved their interactions and it allowed the author to add humorous elements to the story. So a winner for me because I do enjoy a sexy cyborg romance but more importantly the first of what could truly be an excellent series and I'm definitely onboard for more!I was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

I happily admit that I devour any book by this author and always want more! Ms Roane writes very sexy vampire stories and this spin off series is a delight to read but these stories are very short so please be aware of that fact. Nevertheless this author gives us strong interesting characters with a darn good plot to follow and of course sensuous scenes to awaken the readers own desires!This story does have an unusual beginning in that human Charlotte and Mastyr vampire Willem are on their first date. Further more not only is it their first date but the opening scene is when they have both gone back to Willems home and are about to take their new relationship to a whole new level! Yes expect to be literally thrust into a lusty scene but it's one with consequences ! This passionate couple bond which is the very last thing Willem wants. Now luckily he's friends with the troll Davido ( a much loved character in this series) but when he arrives to advise it's only to discover that Charlotte is a rare blood rose! How is that possible when she's human? What will Willem do now as his past history prevents him from feeling worthy?I'm really enjoying the latest turn the author has taken and whilst previously the stories focussed on evil Fae and wraith/ Invuctus pairs it's been an eye opener discovering the workings within the nine realms. In this book we learn of the Realm Investigative Unit that seek to bring the worst criminals to justice but there's also a realm university that educates both human and paranormals alike. This really brings this series up to date as initially I thought the books had an almost fifteenth century vibe to them at times as we only seemed to see inns and bakeries .This couple are truly tested and it's an emotional story. Willem is in danger of losing Charlotte forever with the choices he makes. A well written story that pulls the reader in and leaves me wanting to read more. If you are new to her books and love very sexy vampire stories then I heartily recommend her Men in Chains series. Although no matter what she writes it's truly original and hot!I was gifted a copy of this in exchange for an honest review

My first book by this author but definitely not my last! I thought Ms Stark did a great job in this new urban fantasy series and her fresh approach really paid off. If you are tired of vampires and shifters and maybe demons too are beginning to pale than this series that features the Arcane world associated with tarot cards might just appeal .Our heroine is Sara and she has the ability to find and retrieve anything using her tarot deck to help her. It's a dark world she lives in with psychics being kidnapped and their organs harvested for black magic rituals . Sara is determined to help save as many as she can but this job working for Armaeus aka the Magician seems set to pit Sara against the Vatican and that's not a war anyone wants ! Ok so go into the Vatican , find a stolen box and bring it back now that shouldn't be too difficult. Oh maybe there's the slight problem of the devil to contend with but hey all in a days work right?Oh boy where do I start? This was fast paced and a very strong beginning to a series that's going on my wish list. I liked the feisty heroine and she seemed fearless at times. I imagined her as a cross between Indiana Jones and Lara Croft as it didn't matter what was thrown at her she ruggedly stumbled on. The scenes in the catacombs really stood out and I could picture it easily in my mind . There is definitely chemistry between Sara and the Magician but can he be trusted? Those of the Arcane like the Magician are described as demigods and they do seem to have remarkable abilities. To say more here would ruin the book for others but in this world not everything is quite what it seems. Sara is tough but she is also compassionate and she certainly goes on a Wilde ride ( pun intended!) . Please write quickly Ms Stark as I can't wait to read more .I have discovered a prequel One Wilde Night so I'm off to click my finger and urge my fellow paranormal fans to do the same!I was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

Well the unthinkable has happened and the secret of shifters is well and truly out. Humans now know that werewolves walk amongst them and it's up to the Packs to blend in and try to cause as little upset as possible. Humans often fear that which they don't understand and now the Redwood and the Talon Packs are both firmly in the spotlight.Brynn is an alpha female whose life has been all about protecting those weaker than herself. Her father cruelly abused her but she has survived and now fate seems to be a evil taskmaster as Brynn has met her Mate only to discover that he has no idea her wolf yearns for him.Finn is heir to the Redwood Pack but having been broken and gone through a near death experience struggles to hear his own wolf. Refusing to let that get in his way he will happily put on a brave face and go out trying to help put the humans at ease but the female they partner him with is anything but friendly ! No Brynn is downright hostile even though it's obvious she's not immune to Finns charms. His wolf may be quiet but his senses ( and nose!) work just fine! They might never be friends but would it really hurt to scratch a mutual itch? Things are getting dangerous though as the wolves seem to have targets painted on their backs!Ms Ryan has written what I can only describe as a heart stopping romance. Yes there's a lot of sexual tension between the lead couple but they have both had difficult and troubled pasts which still impact on them in the here and now. What really stands out in these books is the authors ability to let her readers catch up with the extended families. Constant trials await these characters and it's a story arc that continues to keep growing with shady politicians and even witches added to the mix. As for this story it's chock full of passion I admit but there is a truly harrowing scene that shocked this reader. I never know what to expect from this author but one thing I guarantee is an emotional ride that pulls you in and leaves you suffering with the characters. Intense and heart wrenching but just so good!I was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

My first book by this author and it's a novella so shorter than I prefer but I thought it would be a good way to test her style. Yes I still seem to be on a sci fi kick and indeed this book features a planet of cyborgs but they are at war with some beast like aliens called the Rahl and as the story begins I can't help but think I've missed some back story.Axton is the Prime on Centax and until recently he was held prisoner by the Rahl . Abused and tortured he never gave up but his rescue was nearly too late. The soldier who initially found him is Xenia, second in command of Centax security but she's a woman with a secret. Xenia is not the dead unfeeling cyborg everyone believes no, she has emotions and right now they are all over the place! Axton is desperate to recover an old Earth artifact that the Rahl stole and Xenia is on the case but thrown together and in danger things start to really heat up.Ok so yes I've come to this series a little late and I'm guessing the world building has already been done but I easily followed the storyline here. There are not many characters but that works due to the brevity of this tale . I'm not sure that it felt right to read about the cyborgs sexual education and if honest I thought it truly repugnant but at least Axton is a forward thinking guy. Axton has realised that his brother is a much happier and more fulfilled male now that he shares his life with a female . Cyborgs are not expected to feel emotion but sometimes it's a driving force that we all need. Axton is determined to explore this thing between himself and Xenia but first there's the tricky problem of actually surviving!So forbidden love that luckily finds a way. We have a down to earth hero and a heroine in denial. This was well written with a simple plot but lots going on. Not many authors seem to feature female cyborgs so this was a rare treat for me . I enjoyed reading about Xenias enhancements and thought the author showed great imagination and I would read more by her but perhaps a hopefully longer book next time in order to give me a more satisfying look at this world the author has created.I was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

Oo catching up with the Paladins was lovely but I must point out that this is a novella and not a full length book. That being said I've missed these larger than life characters with their mission to save the world and this romance featured one or two of those delicious warriors who have entertained this reader previously. For those new to the series the Paladins are a breed who for centuries have felt called to guard the barrier that exists between Humans and the Others, an evil race but the Paladins are not exactly the run of the mill humans but something more . I've no wish to spoil the fun but trust me when I say these mighty warriors offer out of this world skills!So where does Emmett fit into this world where there's a secret war going on? Well fifteen years ago he was sent to prison as at the time he could not prove his innocence due to his remarkable healing powers. Fast forward to present day and the true culprit has found God and confessed to his sins which finally sees Emmett being offered his freedom and liberty but not before two mysterious males show up offering him a job. Emmett is not sure of their motives and what they reveal seems preposterous so he thinks thanks but no thanks and happily manages to get work tending bar. A freak accident takes Emmett to the clinic where Jana works and she awakens all his protective instincts but exactly what does an ex con have to offer?Ok so not as long as I usually prefer and if frank it's not really a leap forward in terms of the Paladin story arc . However what this short story does offer is a believable romance that builds up allowing these likeable characters to really shine. Jana may be slightly out of the dating game but she knows what she likes and has no hesitation in letting Emmett know it. Which is handy really as at times he needs to be told a thing or two. Don't misunderstand me Emmett is lovely and not shy exactly but very much aware of how others might perceive him. Of course he is passionate but his aggressive side really worries him and as he comes to care more for Jana he will do anything to protect her no matter what the cost!I adore paranormal stories but this was all about the romance and I loved it. Well written with just enough of a tease to make me want more from these guys. A must read for fans of the series but works as a standalone I think to introduce new readers to this exciting world.I was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

My first book by this author but I've seen her books recommended and in particular her Solsti Prophecy series and I now realise that this spins off from those books but I found it very approachable and had no difficulty in quickly immersing myself in this world of demons.As the story begins Ria is in a magically induced coma as she has been seriously injured and it was feared she might not fully recover . Arawn is the leader of this band of Lash demons known as Watchers and he's pretty much stretched if honest yet he constantly finds the time to sit by Ria's bedside in the hope that she will recover and wake up. Drawn to her and yet knowing full well as his subordinate even if Ria did want him Arawn would never take advantage .Ria slowly but surely pulls herself out of the darkness that grips her , Led by the sound of a voice that constantly commands her to wake up. When Ria opens her eyes it's to find her leader Arawn sitting at her bedside and boy is he a sight for sore eyes! Ria has for many years found Arawn fascinating but he lost his true Mate and has never sought to replace her. Yet Ria cannot help but notice Arawn is just as aware of her as she is of him . Sparks fly but Arawn is keeping a dark secret and it's one that would rock the bedrock of the Watchers. Oo this had a lot going on. First there is obviously the sexual tension between the two leading characters but we also have very interesting supporting characters and I cannot wait to see how the next book plays out because , no I cannot say because that would ruin this one. What I can say is Ria has a very protective brother and a really funny sister in law.  There is more going on here than just a romance as there is a mission to find something that has been lost a long time and I loved the authors idea of what going undercover could actually mean! It made for a very interesting plot and was told in a way that held my attention. Do I feel I've missed out by not reading the previous series? Yes if honest but this worked very well as a standalone and now I have a new author to hunt down. Action, romance, humour and a cracking story. I really liked this book and happily recommend to fans of paranormal romance I was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

I saw this cover and instantly was curious about what these two authors could bring to a genre that if honest sometimes seems a little tired. I do enjoy paranormal romance but finding a unique vampire story that pulls me in is getting much harder. This book started in a completely different manner as the heroines husband Dalton is dying but he manages to leave her a message telling her he will always love her. Flash forward about eighteen months and Elsie is a vigilante going out at night to destroy the monsters that killed her husband Dalton. Elsie is grieving and cannot come to terms with the loss of her husband but her life is about to take a huge turn when she comes face to face with what is perhaps the biggest monster out there!Zander is the Vampire king and leads his warriors against the demons ( or skirm as they call them) who prey upon the humans. A chance meeting between Elsie and Zander arouses his suspicions that maybe she is more than just an ordinary human but he is truly shocked when he discovers that not only does she blame vampires for her husbands murder but that Elsie is in fact his Fated Mate! How can Zander convince her that his vampires are not the soulless bloodsuckers she imagines and more to the point when can he claim this woman who completes his soul? Elsie is tormented by her feelings but cannot get past her guilt . Yes Elsie is attracted to Zander but does not want to betray her late husbands memory so where does that leave them? I guess sometimes purgatory is something we create for ourselves !This is a tough one to review for me as I liked Zander and his delicious Scottish brogue but couldn't quite believe how he acted at times. One minute all dominant and passionate but then he would stand by and allow his warriors to get close to Elsie and ok he might growl a bit but that was about it. He just felt so very different to the usual alpha male although admittedly i did like seeing his more gentle side . Elsie hmm well if frank I thought she was a bit of a tease. Yes I know she's hurting but come on she's a grown woman and well aware that yes, no, maybe, no is just not how to treat anyone let alone a guy who clearly needs her! i admired her fighting spirit though but just wasn't impressed by her leading Zander on at times. What I did like were the fun loving warriors and there's quite a lot of interaction with them which clearly sets up for them to have books of their own . Frankly they seemed a little too playful at times and I'm amazed that Zander didn't react more because these touchy feely guys were all over Elsie like a rash! Playful puppies came to mind but as a first book that's setting up a series I can forgive that and just hope to see a little more action next time and slightly less pool time!I was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

This is the second book in this series that is sci fi capture romance but with an erotic edge. I must start my review by saying although I've seen comments about BDSM this is primarily a love story with tender moments and a surprisingly humourous hero. I feel some may be put off by the idea of master and pet but hasten to reassure fellow readers that nothing could be further from the truth . This is a sci romance series like none other and the author takes chances that are certainly paying offStom is our hero and as the story begins we learn just how heinous the crimes of the Bak-Lal are and it sets the scene for what's to come down on Earth. Stom is a Preyfinder and is in a dark place having lost the family he cared for to the enemy. He's intent on revenge and death but as a reward for his service has the opportunity to claim a human female as a pet. Stom cannot bring himself to replace his dead mate and has vowed to take no other female but is prepared to at least make it look as if he is cooperating knowing he will not follow through.Willow has no idea that she is already infected with a deadly virus although she's well aware that she has seriously riled a local gang member . Stom comes to her rescue one night when she is attacked outside where she works but Willow has no idea that he has slipped her a drug that could alter her and turn her into a very horny woman indeed! Right from the start Stom tells Willow that he is an alien and although she would like nothing more than to let him have his (hopefully) wicked way with her his sanity is an issue and Willow is very confused. Stom knows the danger Willow is in and tries to persuade her to leave but Willow has responsibilities and decides to stay. That decision proves to be a bad one and as Williw and Stom meet again it's clear that something tangible is between them. Now I'd like to say that they all live happily ever after but there is the very real threat from the Bak-Lal and it's getting a lot closer . Stom may not want another female in his life but we Humans can be quite challenging and Willow is well and truly something else!I commented on a lack of world building in the first book but thought the simple idea of showing just what could happen to beings taken over by the Bak-Lal really helped to expand the whole idea. I had trouble previously seeing the Preyfinders as good guys because they seemed perfectly happy to destroy whole planets so to have so much fleshed out here at the beginning of the story was truly enlightening. This is a sexy story but for me the highlight is Stoms growth . He goes through so much angst and pain and yet he really is a sweetie . His comments had me smiling as he fought to get to grips with pop culture and I was truly convinced by the romance that played out. Stom may not want a pet but he's certainly happy to explore ideas and Willow is perfectly onboard with that and more! Willow is never a victim in her dealings with Stom but she is indeed a very happy participant ! I am loathe to say too much more about the plot but will state that if you enjoy sci fi or paranormal romance then I think this series is something you should look for. For this reader the third book is a must read but I'm a little apprehensive as these aliens have Gods and the next story features one loud and proud!As I write the first book is free on kindleI was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

I loved these books featuring the princes who reside on a planet far away and are searching for that special woman who will connect with them and their birth crystal. In exchange for access to their planet the Divinity corporation provides willing brides but not is all as it seems. Several of the females are there to escape their tangled lives and do not really expect to get married . These books each feature a different prince and his bride but they all connect and give different points of view enabling the reader to get a much wider picture. Expect a wonderful adventure featuring alpha males and the four women who capture their hearts and prepare to be entranced by Ms Pillows imagination.I was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

This is yet another extremely erotic read from this author who clearly has the most vivid imagination! Yes these books should indeed carry a warning because hot and sweaty times abound. This time it's the Immortal Dorian who has found his Mate but his past haunts him and he has absolutely no intention of claiming her because in doing so Dorian would be sharing all his memories and secrets.Rain is a mortal whose family have chosen to live in the Tetartos realm and since first seeing Dorian at her friends wedding  he's all she can think about. Problem is he looks like he hates her and Rain has no idea why . When Rain starts showing signs of the "Mating Frenzy" it's feared that she is bound to one of the evil acolytes who recently kidnapped her but no it turns out the source of her misery is much closer to home and it's the one male who keeps trying to avoid her it's Dorian!Dorian has reason not to trust females but he was such an arrogant and rude armpit towards Rain! Accusing her of just wanting to share his immortality. Now the reader knows that if he would let his past go Dorian would make an awesome Mate  because he is just so protective. Luckily Rain is made of stern stuff and no matter how much her body might yearn for Dorian she stays strong. When things come to ahead and they both realise that maybe they should take things further it's still not quite a done deal but Rain is never bitter and her quiet determination really impressed this reader. Although I confess it was Dorians possessive nature that really gave me qualms.I wanted more plot if honest and although there are some action scenes and one in particular that had consequences that will reverberate as this series continues I felt something was lacking. Yes we still get to see the "bad guys"but I have a sneaky suspicion that the author mght try to redeem at least one of them. Sexy times dominate the second half of the book with dirty talk and interesting scenes involving water. So if explicit reads are not your thing then this book is not for you as believe me you could not just flick through the odd page to avoid them. Having said that I am enjoying this series and wonder just what will happen next. I believe it's Conns book up next and he's a lovely wolf shifter so I'm onboard for his bookI was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

Now fans of this author might just recognise this story as it's previously been published under the title Whipped Cream and Handcuffs but clearly Ms Walker wasn't quite satisfied and has revisited her characters to flesh out their story and indeed their motivation. I hadn't read the previous short story so went into this with completely fresh eyes.So seemingly Tessa has it all, challenging job, good looks, home of her own, great friends and the almost too perfect fiancé . I say almost as Tessa is discontent with his controlling ways and feels kind of restless . It doesn't help that her gorgeous best friend Caleb keeps telling her she's making a huge mistake and there's also her mysterious admirer who keeps sending her very naughty messages!To be frank Caleb has loved Tessa since he met her aged four but she only sees him as a friend. Caleb is a former Seal home from war and wounded but he feels it's time to act on hs feelings and stop letting life ( or in this case Tessa) pass him by. What follows is a very sexy story filled with heart that takes these two people to the very edge and then we watch them plunge head first into what could be a beautiful thing. Tessa has needs and boy is Caleb keen to help her feel fulfilled. My only slight quibble is the end as it seemed quite abrupt but guess when the story is told it's probably right to leave something to the readers imagination.I was gifted a copy of this in exchange for an honest review

So here we are back in the world of a Swat team composed of werewolves! Sounds completely preposterous and yet this author pulls it off with aplomb. I would expect the intensity of that job to bring out the worst in them and allow their inner beasts to come to the fore but no, these disciplined and highly motivated guys do an amazing job . So why on earth are they put in a position that might compromise all they have worked so hard for? Forced to take on a token female as it looks better for the police department because heaven forbid it should look like they actively discriminate against women Team Commandert Gage sets out to recruit someone he has had his eye on for a few months. A woman who just might fit in with his team becase she too is a werewolf!Khaki has been having a hard time lately . She's ditched her douche of a boyfriend but he's part of the old boys club at the station and nobody has her back anymore. Ok Khaki can deal with that but when a traumatic rescue leaves her injured she starts to experience all kinds of strange things . As for the Swat team leader offering her a job and then dropping the bomb that she's a werewolf, well Khaki is not too sure about that but it's too good an offer to turn down and a chance she has to take.So here's Khaki trying to prove that she is more than capable of holding her own amongst a Pack that are naturally cautious. Luckily most seem friendly and Khaki's hard work and dedcation quickly impresses her new team mates. Now I said most because Xander who is running the team she's with seems remarkably distant and almost downright hostile. Problem is he just smells so good ! There's a part of Khaki that wants to take that man down to the floor and well here's where you use your imagination because Khaki sure is using hers! Yes Xander is mighty fine but Khaki has a job to do and distractions cost lives. The last thing she needs is for everyone to know how turned on by Xander she is but with werewolf noses that might just be out of her hands!This the second book saw the author giving her readers far more background into the life of this Swat team. A lot of the book is centred around the training they do and just what Khaki has to go through in order to become a fully active member of the team. I liked seeing her hold her own but fear not there is action within these pages and Khaki gets to fully utilise her new found abilities. As for the romance, well it's a slow build up but boy do this couple finally get to grips with what's between them. Perhaps not the most suspense driven story by this author if honest but I still enjoyed this book. If you enjoy shifter books then give this series a go because Ms Tyler seems to have found a completely fresh approach fuelled by action and passion that just works . I like her covers but I'm a little undecided by the heroines name here but it's not one I've seen used before so maybe kudos for that.Four and a half from meI was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

Well this was a very short read but just so funny. I'm not usually a fan of light frothy romances but have to confess the sheer enjoyment I got from the situation in this book totally surprised me. Paige is having a bad day, by that I mean it's just going downhill so fast you can imagine she is jet propelled! First off a job interview goes badly wrong, then she finally meets her fated Mate but is in no condition to cope with all that entails , keeps shifting unexpectedly into her inner ferret and to add insult to injury nearly gets run over!Werecouger Archer has decided to do something positive about finding himself a Mate because hey if his younger brother Holt can find his then it should be a breeze for Archer. First stop the M and M Mating agency and what do you know there she is! Just one scent of the rather cute little ferret and Archer is on the hunt but she doesn't seem that keen! No no no Archer is not giving up and will use every trick in his arsenal to find her and when he does he just isnt letting go no matter what or who gets in the way!Poor Paige has never quite mastered the art of keeping control of her ferret and keeps shifting spontaneously. Sometimes it's just a few whiskers but then there's the other times when her fight or flight mode kicks in and yep small and furry rules the day! Her family are embarrassed by her and she is so tired of blundering awkwardly from one embarrassing situation to another. Now she's being hunted by a very persistent cat and you know what there's just something so sexy about this fiercely protective and patient male. If only Archer didn't keep setting off her ferret and then there's the tiny problem ( oh who am I kidding? Huge problem!) of the most interfering family on the planet! Mates are fated but families come first, don't they? Or do you get to make your own family and if so could werecougers ever accept a ferret or will they eat her?This book was short, funny and had a happy ending . Yes it's sexy but it's not a book that just focuses on the erotic aspect and it was the storyline and the trials of the couple that kept me happily turning the pages . No cliff hangers , hurrah but we do get introduced to interesting supporting characters and there's a certain guy with purple eyes that has this reader intruigedFour and a half from meI was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

Step into the world created by Ms Heaton where the fine lines drawn between Heaven and Hell seem to get more complicated with each book. Having survived a near Apocalypse you would expect things to quieten down for a while but no those original fallen still have one or two tricks up their sleeves and right now it's the Devil himself who they plan to trick!Lucifer is having a really bad day and when that happens it's probably best to stay well out of his way as heads will roll ( or explode or whatever takes his fancy!). Mihail, the only angel who might have enough fire power to kill Lucifer has dumped an unconscious human female right outside Lucifers fortress. Now Lucifer is a wily chap and certainly no pushover but the temptation to discover just why the woman is there is one he cannot resist. Besides what could one weak mortal do to him and if she is a trap then the consequences for her will be severe. Nina, the female in question awakens with no idea where she is or how she got there but the beautiful male who offers her shelter is a conundrum as one moment he is caring and then the next a much darker side seems to appear. He is charming, charismatic and yet somehow a danger to Nina and she's determined not to let her life go to Hell again but is she too late!Lucifer is the ultimate bad boy and yet here we are surprised by his vulnerability. As the original fallen angel he has suffered atrocities and yet somehow found the strength to rise up and claim his place as the much feared King of Hell. He has feelings for his daughter Erin ( who is a fabulous foul mouthed badass heroine) and is in awe of his grandson Dante. Yes it's fair to say that this book showcases his personal growth but he is not weak, no just another tortured hero that Ms Heaton so cruelly loves to play with. Giving him Nina as a heroine allows the reader to see his depths and at times it's quite sad learning just how trapped by his circumstances he really is . Nina for me was just a little too trusting far too soon but I think that's just what Lucifer really needed.Ok now for the bad part, I really didn't connect much with the first half of the book because nothing really seemed to happen . Both main characters spent far too long being introspective and constantly seemed to be working things out in their heads. Yes self analysis is all very well but I just wanted something to happen. Luckily about half way through this story a fight ensues which is closely followed by a passionate scene and from this point in it felt much more like the type of book I normally associate with this author.If you enjoy steamy romance with a hero who is more than a little messed up and want action then this series is a must read. Good versus evil but not always in the way we imagine. These books are imaginative, hot and full of twists and turns with characters you will love. A huge recommendation for paranormal lovers but to get the best do read in order starting with Her Dark Angel, you won't regret it!I was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

If you have read any of the previous books in this series then like myself I feel you will be pretty stoked to see this world starting to expand. We have seen the mastyr vampires find their Blood Roses and for the majority of those tales the author has featured those masters' who have control of one of the Nine Realms . In this book it's not a Guardsman but a Detective who is our hero and what a fine and noble one Yolen makes. He is determined to protect the woman he loves and so just sees her on Fridays but Brianna wants so much more. Her need for Yolen is soul deep and whilst she has no wish to stifle him in her opinion it's beyond time to take their relationship up a level . One fateful Friday night well and truly sets the cat amongst the pigeons when another Vampire pays attention to Brianna and no matter how much she loves Yolen she can't help but feel drawn to the master vampire Keynes! Oh what a mess but why is it happening?I really liked this book and usually I'm not that impressed by shorter stories but this book really added new depths to this series. I loved that Yolen is a Detective and he's hot on the trail of a drugs king pin type person as it brought a more realistic dimension to the plot. Yes there is still a war going on and the blood thirsty Invictus wraith-pairs are still on the offensive but this interesting story allowed Ms Roane to show that even vampires make very human mistakes sometimes! Yolen is misguided but his intentions are good. You know what they say about relationships , communication is key and that delicious male has a lot to learn! Brianna knows her own mind and is prepared to make hard choices and I loved that about her but the final chapter and Yolens actions had me melting . I'm so pleased there's a happy ending and advise that this couple are not just loving but passionate to boot!Four and a half from meI was gifted a copy in exchange for an honest review

This is the first book in a new series and I enjoyed it. I've not read anything by this author before, so I have nothing to compare it with as far as writing style of previous books, but except for a few small typo-type errors, the writing and editing were professional. I felt that the author used this book really to introduce the characters and their conflicts, rather than to have a complete story per book, because the main characters are just starting to have a relationship and do some character development when the book ends in an almost  cliffhanger-type fashion.My biggest issue with the story was that very few issues raised have been resolved, all of the principle players are in a state of unrest and the author moves on to the next book (which is, coincidentally, not free). This is not to say that there isn't plenty of dramatic tension, action and adventure to be found in this volume; everything from blizzards to kitchen surgery to wolf attacks and death in the family.  Fortunately, books 2 & 3 have been published and are available, so readers don't have to wait.There is violence, some mild profanity (along with some creative cursing- "son of a whorish turtle" was my favorite), and some kissing and discussion of sex, but no sexual scenes, so it's a pretty clean read. I liked some of the characters after getting to know them a bit (Dr. Becky and Dr. Slate), and was a bit baffled by the changing personalities of several others (feuding siblings Amelia and Ronan), but I'm not sure if I care enough to keep reading the series.Heat factor mild.

I enjoyed this great story from an author who has not disappointed me thus far. Professionally written and edited, the book is built on strong male and female lead characters {the female quite rightly being a bit smarter and more stable than the male ; ) }, but also peopled with a terrific supporting cast of characters, great dialogue, an interesting plot and a surprising villain complete with nefarious plans. While I enjoyed the storyline of the leads, Jack and Merry, I liked Merry more as a person until near the end, but I always loved their motley crew of protectors and teachers. There are many Shakespearean quotes woven into the story because of Cluny and Clancy, once traveling actors turned nursemaids and beloved parental figures. Jack's friend, Kipp, Viscount Willoughby, proves an interesting and loyal friend as well and the next book in the series is about him- "Someone to Love".There are some married sexual scenes in this book, three I believe, but they are not terribly graphic. There is some violence and some mild profanity and a lot of creative uses of Shakespearean descriptions of worthless people ( scullion, rampallion, fustillarion, whey-faced loon). 4 1/2 stars.Heat factor moderate.

This is a well written, well edited historical romance. I enjoyed the storyline of a young man, Alistair, who has been in love with a slightly older lady since he met her just before her wedding to another man. Jessica also thought him interesting and attractive, but was happy with her husband until his death from consumption six years later. After her year of mourning, she decides to take a trip to clear her mind, and inspect the sugar plantation that her husband willed to her. The ship she books passage on is owned by Alistair, who jumps at the chance to be able to spend weeks on a ship with Jessica, finally getting to court her, but also help her if she needs it since he owns the neighboring plantation.This author is known for the steaminess of her books and her historicals are no different. While the scenes are well written, I sometimes think that the characters' explorations of their sexuality within their relationships often overshadows any other plot devices. In this story, Jessica, Lady Tarley, is a widow who goes to see the sugar plantation that her husband left her in his will. Much is made of this being an unusual bequest and of her wanting to make independent decisions about the property, such as whether or not to use slaves or to free them and pay them a wage, whether to sell it altogether, etc... but once she arrives on the island, all we read about is her love affair with Alistair, and never again is the plantation or it's decisions mentioned. We are told that they can talk about anything and know all each other's secrets, but readers are privy to far fewer conversations than sexual encounters.The other component of Jessica and Alistair's love story is a common history of poor self esteem and a belief that they are unworthy of love. Jessica grew up in a home, even as the daughter of a Marquess, where she was physically and emotionally abused; Alistair where he was emotionally abused. Their love for each other finally allows them to feel secure for the first time. Even though Jessica was relatively happy with her first husband, she always felt the need to behave in a very "proper" way or risk losing his approval. With Alistair, she can be herself and Alistair feels he's finally got someone who loves him despite his past mistakes. Jessica's sister, Hester has a secondary storyline and there are domestic and sexual abuse issues within it as well. (A heads up for those with trigger issues.)Overall, I liked the characters and the story. I don't mind some steaminess in a book, but I prefer character development and plot over a multitude of sex scenes. 3 1/2 stars.Heat factor hot.

From the queen of well researched, authentic regencies, this book is a delightful story about a disillusioned rake and the minor gentry distant cousins he decides to assist out of boredom and a need to irritate his sister. The title character, Frederica, is the oldest of the five siblings and has run the family since the death of their mother many years ago. Although the family solicitor kept the estate out of court until the eldest son reached his majority after their father's long illness and death, Frederica has always handled the estate and the younger children and the oldest brother is happily off at Oxford. The middle child, Charis, is extremely beautiful, sweet and kind (if not very bright), and the family has come to London to give her a season and a chance to find a husband. Upon arriving in town, they find that the aunt they were counting on for an introduction to society can't help them because her husband is extremely ill. The only other relative that their father talked about was the rakish Marquis of Alverstoke; their mother was disowned for marrying beneath her so they don't know any of those relations.The plot revolves around the relationships between the characters, not just the Marquis and Frederica, but the way the whole family interacts with each other, and how they interact with the Marquis. Also, there are interesting dynamics within the Marquis' family and friends. There is a lot of characters development throughout the story and the reader really gets to know the characters well. The writing and editing are excellent. There is never any straying from the time period in descriptions of locations, dress nor in dialogue. This is a clean read, there is only a hand kiss and an allusion to an embrace. This is a very nice story, but contains no real antagonist or villains, which lessens the tension and excitement levels of a story IMHO.Heat factor mild.

I liked this well written and well edited regency romance. The main characters are a divorced couple, which is an unusual plot angle. I liked what was revealed about the Duke and former duchess, but didn't feel as though the author explored them deeply enough for me to become really attached to them.
