As events unfolded, I found myself engrossed in the story, rooting for Sera and Tor and becoming quite protective of them as they found themselves on some fairly wild adventures with both Erlanders and A’aiheas alike. However, I must say that the very last volume left me wanting; there is minimal closure, and so I am sure that Tyler must be planning a sequel of sorts. While an epilogue does exist, it creates more questions than it answers, with the biggest of them all still left unanswered: what is Sera’s purpose the A’aihea spoke of? Overall, this is a great fantasy serial that I highly recommend, but know going in that this isn’t the whole story.

This was an interesting whodunit type mystery dealing with college aged students, though it reads more as a YA or MG novel. It’s easy to understand prose and characters draw the reader in from the get go, and it’s definitely a fun ride. There are a bit more characters involved in this story than I’m used to, and so as a reader I had more people to try and keep track of, but overall Flann does a good job keeping the reader on track. I will say that I didn’t really connect with any of the characters due to the vast amount of them—they were spread a little thin in terms of characterization for me—but overall, they were likable and intriguing, spurred on by different motivations that cast them in different lighting as the novel progresses.While I found some of the events within the novel to be a little far-fetched, the premise was on point and I thought the search for the missing artifact to be actually quite enjoyable. From crazy sleuthing in the dead of night to false antics, the characters and events kept me on my toes as it all came to a head. This is a clean novel with a somewhat humorous take on the “whodunit” mystery, and if you’re in the mood for something a bit light, then I suggest taking this novel for a spin.(Please note: I use the rating system of Goodreads, which is different from Amazon.  My overall rating is that I liked it.)

This novel is split into two parts: the “before” and “after.” It’s a very interesting way of dealing with a novel that involves a school shooting—whereas the beginning of the novel shadows that of Jack as he spirals downward, the second portion of the novel jumps ahead 10 years, following Jason, a young man returning to teach English at the very school he attended when the shooting occurred. This allows readers to gain the unique perspectives of both those leading up to the event and those still recovering from it years afterward.Perhaps what I found most frustrating, but also rewarding, is the fact that Cook doesn’t give readers a specific reason for the violence that occurs on any account within his novel. No one aspect or person can be pinpointed for blame, which is, in reality, a truth I feel many people do not want to accept. Why do people do the things they do? The news constantly tries to pinpoint one specific reason, and I feel like it is our human nature to try and understand, to cast blame, but in reality there are so many factors that make up these nightmares that the finger pointing and blame game is speculative at best. Thus, Cook leaves readers with more or less an ambiguous look at the mindset of both Jack and Jason, which I admit frustrated me, but is probably more accurate in its portrayal of events than anything else.Having escaped his hometown for a while, and reluctant to be back, Jason is roped into becoming the school spokesperson as the 10 year anniversary of the shooting comes upon the town. I found this fascinating, but as Jason tries to deal with his memories, his students, the faculty, and the people of the town, he begins to break down. I don’t know if this was intentional or not, but I really zoned in on the antics of Jason as a teacher—perhaps because I am one myself—and I just couldn’t get over how terrible he really is at his job, morally speaking. Having witnessed illegal activities, I would expect him to report them right away—to intervene—to speak up—but instead, Jason begins to hide inside himself, pushing everyone away from him and, as faculty members begin to die and the blame game once again becomes the town’s favorite pastime, he begins to lose himself. While a very interesting look at the human psyche, my morals as a teacher made me quickly begin to lose any respect I had for Jason as the story unfolded. I think the point was that Jason was completely and utterly shaken to his core during the shooting; that it is an event he will never truly recover from, but as an adult in charge of children, I expected more out of him in this aspect.I also found some aspects of the novel to be a little too predictable in terms of the current deaths plaguing the school, which is unfortunate, but could also be intentional as I feel Cook is more so interested in human nature and the psyche than a full on mystery novel. Overall, this is a well-written novel, but remains somewhat ambiguous on many fronts, especially with the ending, and there are a few grotesque events in the novel as well, aside from the mass shooting, so reader beware.(Please note: I use the rating system of Goodreads, which is different from Amazon.  My overall rating is that I liked it.)

While the premise behind this novel is indeed very good, I personally found it a bit slow. The main character, Cady, jumps between flashbacks and the present, which is usually one of my favorite types of writing styles, but this time, it fell a bit flat for me. I really just felt like this was a story about some cousins who visit an island every summer, only to watch their parents fight with one another over money and other superficial things. The story itself didn’t really move, and while the kids are friendly and they have a few fun excursions, I must have completely missed the segment that explained how, exactly, they were known as the liars—they didn’t seem to do anything, let alone talk to one another.Gat is a friend of the family and soon becomes Cady’s crush, but there is no development there aside from her pining for a boy she can’t have, so the romance aspect was a little bit of a bust for me as well. Truthfully, I could have done without it, since it didn’t go anywhere, and much of the grumbling on Cady’s behalf became monotonous fairly quickly for me. In terms of characterization, Cady isn’t a character I like, and though not much time was spent on the other characters, I didn’t really care for them either. Because of this, I think I struggled a little more than usual trying to connect with the character, and hence, I wasn’t a fan of the story overall.The last few pages of the novel reveal a surprise I didn’t see coming, and I liked it very much, but by that point the novel was basically over, so it was a short-lived revelation for me. I think, had the novel had a little more action and characters that meant something to me, I would have enjoyed this story so much more, but as it is, it just isn’t for me. However, a lot of my friends absolutely loved this novel, so I highly suggest you check out other reviews and give it a try because I may be the odd man out on this one. As is, though, I can only give it two and a half stars.

For you Ham radio operators out there, I can tell you that these are not bad quality and I have no complaints.Yes there are better but these are good enough and take legal limit power with no problems.

I checked this against my fluke 87 Mark V  temperature probe and it was between one and three degrees off at about a one foot distance.Not bad for a $20 temperature gun.  First good use was checking the seal going around my refrigerator then checking some windows for leaks. Now it will go in my tool kit for checking circuit board components or if I need it when working on my cars engine.

I was skeptical at first but after trying it I am truly impressed with just how hard this stuff gets when it dries.  It's easy to work with and feels like very hard plastic when it dries.  Only problem is that you don't get a lot for the money and it goes down pretty quickly.BTW I found Alcohol as a great way of washing the stuff off your fingers after kneading it like dough.
A must buy item if your getting a CX-10.Without this you will be breaking propellers almost daily.  Since I put this on I have broken none.
Small and very handy set of sockets, and I also like the way the handle is designed.  The case makes it perfect for dropping into tool bag.So far they have held up pretty well.

Well they work pretty well and they fit JIS screws perfectly.  I have found the metal to be pretty hard and have yet to have a problem with it stripping.  About my only gripe is that they could have included a case so that they don't get mixed in with my regular Phillips heads and get mixed up.  Thats why I took off one star.

I think FIFA better watch out because PES has really caught up.The game play is excellent, the graphics are great and the AI which I always found to be a weakness with previous versions of PES is really pretty good now.

Let me compare this to the T300 which I have used several times at my friends house and you will understand why I say this wheel is a Game changer in the steering wheel market.First of all the T150 steering wheel is not removable like the T300 but IMHO that was not much of a big deal, it also does not have the same quality pedals but for half the price what can you expect.What it does have is excellent driving control and a fantastic feedback system.  When you first take it out of the box and turn the wheel and hear the whirring sound of the internal belt it's a little disconcerting, you start to wonder how smooth it will be when hooked up. Also at first glance the pedals do not look like they have bolt down holes but on closer inspection they DO, so that's great. Unfortunately the wheel itself is clamp down system only.When I started using it with my PS4 I was shocked at how smooth this $200 wheel felt, I was expecting a very loose feel and a fairly large dead zone but instead I found it was excellent!  I could detect almost no dead zones or free play in the wheel, and the feedback also had no dead zones. In fact it's a very good steering wheel that gives me a good sense of realism with a very good turning radius and unbelievably good feedback.  The only really noticeable difference was that the T300 is a bit more of a precise feel, but as I said at half the price your getting a wheel and pedals that are more than adequate for just about anyone except the most avid drivers.Another nice thing is that you can hookup an external shifter if you want and other accessories and you can swap out the pedals if you want to upgrade to metal ones later on.  I did find the break pedal to be a bit soft but the $5 rubber insert mod I found on YouTube fixed that problem in minutes.Overall the T150 is a great buy, if you have the cash and can spring for the T300 or T500 go for it, but if your not an absolute racing fanatic the T150 is a really great match for a PS4 or PS3.  I did not try the PC driver and see how it worked on the PC but I suspect it will work pretty well.I can't say enough good things about how pleasantly surprised I was with this wheel and it's various controls.

First of all it's a must that you buy the propeller guard kit or you will break propellers every flight while learning.Overall it's very small and very hard to fly.  The only nice thing is that with the propeller guard it's pretty hard to damage it during the numerous crashes while learning.  I found the range to be about 15ft and the controls to be a bit confusing.Overall it's fun but it the confusing control's plus the short battery life makes it also frustrating.
It's been one month and it's still working perfectly, I cant really find any faults, it plays everything I throw at it and its slim compact profile makes it easy to stuff in my laptop bag.

The Beast!At our work place we use a lot of server power supplies for various servers, but this one has got to be one of the largest and heaviest 750W units I have ever seen.  It fit perfectly in the case but it uses every inch of length and width available.The packaging for this power supply is unbelievable.  It felt like I was opening up a box from Tiffany's.  Everything is in top class molded foam and you get so many spare cables that you will never have an issue with that.  It even comes with a elegant black fabric bag to hold the spare cables.As for the performance, it does not disappoint, it is virtually silent and it has no problem working with the server we put it in.  Time will tell with the durability, but I am guessing that this is going to last a long time, because it has so much thermal mass that the supply is very cool and a cool power supply that is not overly dependent on a fan typically lasts a long time.

Very good stand that looks nice and is easy to put together once you figure it out!Yes that one star came off because of lack of instructions and the fact that it's not very clear how the plastic inserts that hold up the shelves are positioned.  I had to spend a bit of time trying different ways before I hit on to the right method.  After that it was smooth sailing :)  The shelves went in within 15 minutes and I had a really nice and very strong set of shelves.

How do they fit it all in there, that's the first thing that came to mind when I got the Mobi Pro.They did and it works great!  For me it's a great way to take my  older digital SLR camera and add WiFi to it.  Now I can transfer pictures to my PC without having to attach a cable or pull out the card.  I really cannot find anything bad about the Mobi, it's pretty much perfect at doing what it says it will do.It does come with a cloud based storage offer, with some free time then a yearly fee and the Mobi card will upload your photos once it gets a WiFi connection and it can also be configured to post to twitter and Facebook accounts.  Since I am not into sharing my personal photos with the world I did not test that aspect.  For those who are Facebook fanatics this is a great tool as you can have your photos uploaded to your account right away.I was intrigued by the cloud service as it seemed like a very practical application when your traveling.  When I am on vacation I always have a fear that my Camera will go missing and all the great photos will be gone with it.  The Cloud service would allow me to instantly upload the photos when I get to the Hotel without even having to think about it.  So that a nice feature.Construction etc are excellent and 32GB is more than most of us will ever use during a typical vacation or trip, so overall this is certainly a five star product.

At last I found a Sprinkler that lasts more than a week LOL!After using about six other models that each broke for various reasons I decided to listen to the other reviewers and spend the extra cash and get the "el supremo" sprinkler.They are right, this one is well constructed and works perfectly.  I love all the different settings for getting the water exactly were I need it. The most amazing part is how far it can send the water, almost twice the distance of any of the others I have used and it's completely adjustable for almost any situation.  I also like that it works perfectly even with minimal water pressure and does not get stuck like the cheap one's.You can do what I did and keep on buying the cheap ones or you can get this model and save money in the long run.

Coming from the older 300 and 350's this 450 Turbo is really fast.  If your using an older dymo printer you might want to consider an upgrade, this thing spits out labels at about 4 times the speed of my old 350 and it also has a checking mechanism that makes sure it always starts printing at the right spot.
Works really well, my only warning is check out your internal case dimensions, this card is a lot longer than I expected and I ended up having to change computer cases.

Works perfectly, it's a bit pricey but it's well constructed and does the job perfectly and alignment seems to be perfect.  I had no issues putting in new batteries. Overall I get the feeling that this should last a long time.

Absolutely great!  My shooting accuracy went up by several notches in just the first week of usage.  The method of scoring and resetting etc is brilliantly implemented, you can just stand back and shoot, then shoot the score circle, write down your score and then shoot the reset circle and start again without having to go back to the device.  If I have any gripes it's that you really need to count your shots because if a second one land on top of another you still only get one LED lighting, so you need to do the math of dividing your score by the number of shots to figure out were the non visible ones landed.  They really should have used triple pin LEDS so that the duplicates would show up in another color.The count down and draw timer is great for increasing your draw and shoot speed and it's even better if you have a double action auto or a revolver, for me with a single action it's a bit more challenging, but none the less it gives me excellent results for that all important first shot.The construction of the case and everything else is OK, but it's not spectacular and could have been better but it's good enough to get the job done.  There is a wall mount hole on the back along with the battery case for 4 AA batteries and the on/off switch is on the side.Overall if your looking for a method of improving your accuracy, this may be one of the best ways of doing it short of going down to the range.  It's also the safest way possible to practice quick drawing and firing.

I wish this had been a 5 star product but unfortunately it has some issues that take away from what could have been a great product.For starters the watch is a lot sleeker and slimmer than I first thought, it is actually a very nice looking watch for people who don't like bulky watches.  The band on the other hand is pretty cheaply designed and is very awkward to put on each day.  They do give you a spare grey band along with the attached black one and also a nurses type pendant band for people who need that kind of band.The software installed seamlessly on my iPhone 5S and updated the watches firmware, I think that eliminated a lot of the bugs that other people had experienced. so on the software side I give it high marks.  Where the watch falls flat is in the way it operates on your wrist and the actual usage of available LCD display area.I am not sure who designed the system for it to show you the time, but it took me several minutes to figure out that you needed to lift up your hand and also give your wrist a slight twist to point the screen at your face to get the display to show the time.  Now this may seem like a no brainer but believe me it's not just the the action that is required but the way you do it that makes the difference, it's like you have to learn the movement in both speed and the motion steps to get a reliable readout.  Then there is the Tapping of the screen to move between the different items, it's not very reliable and I ended up tap tapping and more tapping to get it to change.My second gripe is the LCD itself.  It's really nice looking but it uses a fraction of the available screen size to show you the time and date!They could have easily made the Font double the size if not 4 time bigger but instead they made it so small that you have to look hard to see what time it is.  Why did they do that, I can only assume to save battery power.Speaking of battery life, it is pretty much what I expected, it's about one day and then it needs recharging.  The funny part is that it does have enough power to probably get you part way through the second day, so why bother saving that power and just use it to make the display lettering bigger, your going to have to charge it daily anyway unless you want to have a dead watch at lunch time every other day. The good news is that the app does a good job at syncing it with my iPhone and it does seem to have relevant info, although I think it would be a mistake to assume each step it measures is really a step and not some other form of movement, therefore the Calories burned is dubious but none the less relevant because one can see a trend in activity and therefore know if your doing more or less each day.  I also like the 14 day memory ability, you don't have to worry about syncing it with your phone every day.Overall given the price and what you get for that price it's not bad but it could have been so much more if they had made a better band and added even a single button to the frame so I could just press it to see the time.  Lastly, if they are not going to use magnetic induction charging and instead use physical contact pins I can see why it's not rated as being water proof, only water resistant.  So if it's water resistant why not add some buttons instead of depending on tapping?

I have used lots of electric shavers over the years and each and every year they keep getting better.  A model like this would have probably sold for $200 three years ago.  Blades on the other hand seem to be limited to just adding more blades which does not really make the shave much better.The PF7400 gives me a very close shave without any irritation and the batteries are good for approximately two days of shaving and then it needs recharging.  The overall unit I suspect from past experience will last about 1 year before the foil starts to develop holes or the blades just get dull.  This will still be a significant savings over buying expensive razors.  The Remington 7400 is constructed ok, it's not a $250 Braun but then again it's not supposed to be.  What you get is a mid priced razor that fairly quiet and shaves surprisingly well.  The bonus is that it will save you a bag of money over it's lifespan.

It's a great toy for those kids who love Sesame street, your child will spend lots of time playing with  Elmo, because he talks up a storm of phrases.  My wife kept saying how nice the fur is, it is very soft and nice feeling.  Personally I was pretty surprised that the size of the actual toy is really as big as it seems in the picture.

My Son and the Dog are having a great time with this.  My Son fills it up and his target is almost always our dog,  I think the dog tries to act like he's intimidated, like "oh don't shoot me"  but once the water starts to fly he goes after the stream trying to catch every drop in his mouth.  Great fun for both of them during this hot summer.On the more technical end, it is well constructed, feels sturdy and the filling cap is big enough to filled with from our garden hose.Not a bad toy for the price.

Very good monitor, it's 4:3 which is the way a PC monitor in an office environment should be.  If you watching videos and playing games all day get a 16:9.  If your doing serious work use a 4:3.  Maybe I am old fashion, but I don't get the marketing hype on 16:9.  All my paper work is 4:3 in format, every book and news paper I read is 4:3.  Even most of the webpages are 4:3.  If you look at them on a 16:9 they look weird as the content on most sites is spread out to much and not enough of it going downward, so it's scroll, scroll as you try to read the text.Anyway this Acer is great, the picture is excellent.  I just wish that it had two ports like most monitors.

When it works it works great, but every couple of days it drops the connection.  I am not even going to bother looking at any other units because they all seem to have this problem.  This WN823N is probably the best of the bunch.

Well constructed, it's exactly what I needed for my bench.  I was pulling my teeth out trying to find a bnc to sma adapter, so I tried amazon and there it was.  Quality is pretty good, not spectacular but certainly good enough to get the job done.

Brilliant idea, and it's a well constructed heavy piece of equipment that is well thought out and engineered but I had to take one star off because the weight of the unit plus the attached drill made it pretty difficult to work with until I ggt all the slack out and the tension started to build, after that it's pretty very easy to deal with.  At first I was a bit concerned my less than optimal she man cordless drill was not going to be up to the task, but they have so much gear reduction going on in this thing that my puny drill had no problems moving about 350 lbs of weight straight up into the air.This is a great piece of gear to add to your tool collection, it does not use up a lot of space and it really has a lot of power.  Great if you need to remove pieces of fallen tree out of your property or to hoist  some heavy items into your pickup truck.  BTW It also has a built in system that will prevent damage if you try to lift or pull too much weight.

The Chair is an absolute 5 star chair, but IMO the assembly instructions or lack of are 2 star.  Maybe it was just mine that lacked them.  None the less if you read my review you should have no problem.The first thing that impressed me is how heavy the whole package is and how well made the piston assembly that moves the chair up and down is.  With all the previous office chairs we have had to replace, this mechanism was the weak point.  After a few years they fail and the chair starts to slip downward on it's own or the piston starts to wobble.  With this Basyx chair the piston is about 2 times thicker and it really feels heavy and solid.  Also it's the first one I have seen with a locking mechanism.The chair itself was not as comfortable as the one it replaced but that's expected since the leather and padding are new and still a bit hard.What might get to people is the complete lack of documentation, now at first I was not a concern  because these chairs are not rocket science to put together, but what was frustrating was that you see threadings in each of the holes that hold the piston but you see nothing to hold the piston in place, like a big locking nut.  After a few minutes I decided to just stick it together and sit on it.  Evidently that's the right move because your own weight pushes both ends into what are really gripping threadings and after that the chair seems almost impossible to separate the lower and upper halves.  I should also mention that  I did appreciate the extra screws and screw covers and the fact that they are clearly labeled as extras.What else can I say, I have assembled about 5 or 6 office chairs before and this one is certainly the best in terms of how the materials feels.  The wheels have a very solid feel to them and as I said the piston assembly is first rate,  the leather surface is smooth and has no pattern in it, some may like that and others may not.  For me it was not an issue.  I also like the rock back feeling on this chair, it goes back nicely but does not feel like it's going to tip or anything.In the end I had to base my review entirely on the chair itself since the 30 minutes it took to assemble it is just a tiny fraction of time and not a big deal in the grand scheme of things.

Mostly Screws, I should have looked and read more before buying it.  I got 6 out of 12 compartments half full of differnt size screws.  Then 2.5 compartments full of bolts and 1.5 compartment full of Nuts and lastly two compartments about 1/5 full of washers.  Certainly does look like 347 pieces but I guess every washer and nut counts!

It's an ok quality mic connector.  Not the best I have seen but not the worst.  Good for hand mikes etc, but I would not wire my $200 Heil mic with one of these, I would prefer something made of a better alloy.

I kind of have mixed feelings about this Drill press.It's pretty good for light to medium work, but not so good if the item is heavy or getting to the point in size where it uses more than 1/2 of the opening width.  I found the screwdriver type turning system with pull out and bend 90 deg for tightening it down hard to be a very neat idea. I also liked the quick release button for sizing the jaws quickly.  What I did not like was how flimsy the quick release and the 90 deg turning elbow felt.Bottom line is that it's small, compact and fairly easy to put away in a drawer yet can be used to hold small and medium sized items for quick drilling.  It's just a pity that they did not include a bottom attachment that would allow me to clamp it down on a table.  The idea of drilling holes in my work bench to hold this clamp in place permanently kind of defeats the portable nature of it.

Excellent portable charger, most likely one of the best on the market, but it is pricey.  For someone who is on the go and needs to have their phone working at all times this charger is fantastic.  My wife is one of those people who is always forgetting to charge her phone, so I gave it to her and she keeps it in her pocket book for emergency charging.  So far she has used it about 4 times in just 3 weeks and I only had to recharge the power pack twice.I did some test and found her iPhone 5S takes about an hour to charge from the 20% marker to 100%.  The unit had enough power left to fully charge her phone again, so it's like having two spare battery packs on you.The great part for most women is that they can just connect the phone to the battery pack and just drop the two back in their pocket book and go about their business while the phone is charging.  I really like the fact that I don't have to worry about her running out of power while she is on the road.
It's a good blender, nothing fancy about it but the construction is durable and I get the feeling it will last a long time.For the price point you really cannot go wrong buying it.

After 3 weeks of use let me just sum this one up with a Good the Bad and The Ugly type review.THE GOOD1) Sounds pretty darn good for a low cost portable speaker. If you have Never owned a set of portable speakers before, you will be surprised at just how loud it can get and how good the Highs, Mids and even the Bass can be from something this small.  Keep in mind the size and don't expect miracles, but let me just say it is good enough to used at a small get together party.  The Bass is probably the only thing that is less than stellar, but for the size and the fact it's battery powered, it's amazing.2) The construction is first rate!  From the moment you pull it out of the box you know this speaker is not a toy but instead a well constructed piece of gear, it's solid yet light weight and seems to be designed towards budding audiophiles who are on the go and need something portable.3) Connectivity via Bluetooth was easy and straight forward, it should take almost anyone just a minute or two to have music playing.4) Comes with a lot of accessories, including a nice case that can be used even when playing music, it really does not effect the sound very much. Also included are plug adapters for use when traveling abroad and a few other items.5) Pretty good built in rechargeable batteries. I would hate to estimate how long it will play on a single charge because that it really based on how loud you have the volume.THE BAD1) Bluetooth range is a bit more limited than expected, I got about 14 ft before the audio started to drop out.2) It requires a bit of boosting to the the various frequencies to get the best sound. The default sound setting from your phone will be a bit flat, but if you go into the phone/tablet audio settings you should find one that makes it sound good to you.THE UGLY1)  The controls are confusing and not all that well thought out.  You will get use to it after you play with it for a bit, but it is not intuitive to operate,the manual is like everything else you get today, a fold out multi lingual confused mess and I have noticed a few glitches in the button presses.CONCLUSION:  It's not a $500 powered Bose speaker, it's a portable speaker and in that arena it's a very good product.  I took one star off because the controls bugged me and I also think they should have gotten at least 25 feet of range on the Bluetooth.

So far so good. My HP printer recognizes that they are not the OEM cartridges but it prints with them just the same.  So far no leaks, no streaks but the colors are not exactly right and the vividness is not as good as the OEM.  If your looking to do regular office printing they are fine, for photos you might want to buy the OEM model.  For the price I am very happy.JUST ONE WORD OF WARNING:  Always check the latest reviews when buying non OEM toner cartridges. The quality of the one's sold this month may not be the same one's sold a month later.  I have been burned several times by not looking at the latest reviews.

Somebody thought of every conceivable thing you could want in a survival radio.  I can tell you this thing is no toy!  The hand crank for charging is the real deal. The construction is the real deal.  Everything about this unit is made for a  "what if scenario".Yes if the Dead come back to life this would be exactly what you would want to carry in your nap sack.
Very nice gift basket, it was bigger than expected and came packed nicely in a durable box

This is real deal OEM cartridge.  I am tired of playing with the "compatible" models that are sold for 1/4 the price and end up streaking all over the paper or leaking into the printer.  At some point it just suits you to spend the $$ and get the real deal.

The meter in the picture is a Telepost LP-100A meter which is one of the most accurate Ham Radio meters you can buy.  It is even more accurate than a Bird Watt meter.  I do not know what this guy is actually selling but for around the same price you can get the meter directly from Telepost.You can check eHam for reviews, this is a 5 start meter when bought from the manufacturer.

Very cool unit, I never owned a cordless phone with this level of features.Besides just being a regular Panasonic cordless phone (meaning great reception and call quality), the Link2cell has built in Bluetooth, so it can link to your cell phone and extract your contact names and numbers and store them in it's own memory.  So when someone calls your house you not only see the caller ID of the number but also the name and it announces the name via voice.  That's a nice feature, but even better, is the fact that when your home and a call comes in on the house phone it will also instantly ring your cell phone via bluetooth and you can answer it on your cell phone.  It also works in reverse, a cell phone call can come in and the house phone will ring as well and you can answer it on either device so long as they are both within blue tooth range.  All of these features can be modified the way you want them, you can prevent the phones from pairing automatically, that way you can just extract your phones caller list but not have the auto pairing or both phones ringing and sharing numbers.  You can also turn off the voice announcement.  This phone has a ton of features in the menu, it can do so many thing that it's impossible to right about  them in a small review.One thing I should stress, is that the phone itself is well made and solid.  It's full color hi-res LCD gives you a hint  that a lot of stuff is happening in the phone. Like all my cell phones I expect that one day either the Answer or Hangup button will fail from all the use, that's what seems to be the killer of all my phones is dead buttons.  With the Link2Cell you can buy extra handsets, I think it supports 4 at a time.  I bought one extra one that will be left in it's box until the original one dies.  For just a few extra dollars I should be able to double the life of this fantastic phone.
So far I prefer my Wouxun radio over this Baofeng.  The Baofeng feels a lot cheaper in the hand and the charger is really not that good.

It works for about a year if you use it right and make a proper trench around your house.It also decimates every other insect that lives in the ground and comes into your house.  We had no Ants at all in the house for that same period,it made my wife even more happy with the product.

Seems to be doing the Job, the termites have disappeared.  It's been 4 weeks, so I have no idea how long this keeps them at bay, but so far it's working.  It practically has no smell which is great and it also did not stain anything like wood or paint on the places we sprayed it with.

Works great, my wife is has transplanted her orchids to them.  At first we though they might be a bit too shallow but they worked out just great and the plants are looking a lot better since we transplanted them.

This is a lot of space in a small package and that's great!  It is about the same length and width as a standard portable drive but is twice as thick, I am not sure why they put on the textured plastic surface, but it makes little difference to me.Here are the Benchmarks I ran on it.Write Time PC to Seagate Large Files:  131mb/s.  I tested it with a 5gb fileWrite Time PC to Seagate Small Files:  22mb/s I used 30,000+ small system filesRead Time Seagate to PC Large Files:  131mb/s.  Using another 5gb fileRead Time Seagate to PC small Files:  30mb/s. I used 30,000 small system filesI am not sure what is going on inside that larger case, maybe they are using some extra Ram buffering.  It certainly works great on Large files, but does not help much on multiple small files.  IMO probably not a bad thing since you don't typically read or write  thousands of small files on drives like this.  For large files it's absolutely flying, this is probably the fastest portable drive I have used for large files.I am taking off one point because the speed difference between large and small is huge, with that said it's still one super fast drive and is fully USB port powered.

First of all, I am a backup fanatic!  After losing the first 5 years of my sons baby photos in a hard drive crash I learned my lesson and now I backup everything onto a raid drive system. I already own a Western digital 4 drive NAS  so when this Seagate Pro2 fell into my lap I was really anxious to not only be able to backup more stuff but to see how they compared.The unit comes in a fairly plain square brown box, but it is well padded with internal holders and you also get another box inside the box that has the separate brick power supply and an Ethernet cable along with a small fold out starters manual.It has 1x USB3 port on the front, one USB3 on the back and a USB2 port on the back.  Also two Ethernet ports that can be configured for separate IP's.  So you can basically configure this to work at your home and backup your home PC's on port one and have the second port configured for another network location like your office.Now you need to know this, the fold out manual is a bit confusing.  If the unit you purchased already has drives in it you do NOT need to press the reset button.  Just unpack,  and attach the Ethernet cable to your LAN and then decide if your going to use port one or two on the back of the Pro2. Next attach power and press the power button and the drive will go through a series of sync ups that take about 8 minutes.  The drives come already set to RAID 1 so they are mirrored and your available space with the 4TB version will be about 1.8TB which is the norm. You can change that for full 4TB storage but do so at your own peril as you will no longer have redundancy.Once the power light is no longer blinking you can then open a browser window and go to the URL that is provided.  That site will guide you through the rest of the setup.  Keep in mind this drive is like a full PC with dual core 1.7mhz cpu and 2Gb DDR Ram, so it can run software independent of your regular PC's. I think you are limited by what Seagate has to offer, but I did see several programs including torrent software for those who are into that.  BTW it also has full UPS communication support for power outage shutdowns.I ran some benchmark tests and had very good results, I am truly impressed.Write Speed from PC internal HD to Pro2 was 117mb/s with large files (5gb) This thing flies when your writing to it.Write speed with 30,000 small system files was about 60mb/s which is also impressiveRead speed large files was 83mb/sRead speed with small files, same 30,000 files was about 57mb/sMaximum internal temperature reached was 50C and the smart fan had revved up to 1230 RPM.BTW you have a full real-time diagnostics page when you open the browser. You can see performance graphs over time, for almost every aspect of the drive including transfers speeds, it's CPU usage, memory usage, temperature and fan speed etc.The Seagate Pro 2 is well constructed, it feels solid and while it lacks the LCD info screen of the WD  it makes up for it in other areas like faster speed, and a few extra ports.  The only thing that I did not like was that the ejection system for the hot swappable drives, it is a little less robust than my WD ejection system.Overall I am very impressed, it's fast, it came with NAS drives installed, so that means the failure rate should be really low compared to regular drives.  The FAN is absolutely silent even at full speed and its not a little fan, its fairly big for a bay of this size. It certainly keeps the exterior cool to the touch.  Always keep in mind that heat is the number one killer of hard drives, so a good cooling system is something you really want.  I also really like the the ability to configure it for two different network systems. I have already set one port up for my home IP range and another for my office IP range.Time will tell, but after almost two weeks I am very happy with this NAS drive.

First of all this track is a load of fun for younger kids and it’s great that it is expandable and can be added to a much larger track system.  You will not be disappointed with it if your kids are into hot wheels cars.With that said I do have one major gripe, why did they not include another car in the package?  I mean it probably costs hotwheels Co. less than 50 cents to add another car and yet they make a track system that requires two cars for it to be useful and then give you only one!  Arggg oh well, just remember to order another car if your child does not have one available already.So the way this track works, is that one car goes from the top tower and can trigger the launch of two more cars as it goes down the track.  Depending on how you assembled the track you can end up with different configurations of how each of the cars will exit the track and what they will do.  As I said before, you can join this into another set your child may have, so think of this track as a kind of nexus hub that can make a normal track layout much more interesting.  If you don’t have another track it is still great because the layout is large and interesting on its own.  Just don’t look for collisions etc. it’s not designed to be a smash up track but more of hub for creating interaction between multiple cars.I am sorry that I had to take off one star on this one, because it is a really good toy, but it was very frustrating on the first night when we finally got it all setup and both of us realized that another car was needed to make any of the magic happen.  Once you know that your experience will be a lot more pleasant than ours because you will know to buy a second car.

I have used Netgear Wifi routers at home for years and have always been very happy with them.  When it came to the office I always used Cisco routers mainly because of their reputation.  So I was really intrigued when I got the opportunity to test a Netgear commercial router against one of our 16 port Cisco routers that we installed last year.Well I am happy to say for 1/2 the price the netgear was on par in speed performance with the Cisco router I had and it has a few bonuses that the other companies could learn from Netgear.  For instance the Snap on wall mount is so much easier to deal with than the typical screw down bracket, the corner power plug in makes it easy to turn off or just reset the router.  It also has the typical reset to default recessed button at the back.The built in power supply with the Netgear Prosafe makes it easy to plug into my UPS.  With some of the other routers at work (Not Cisco) router,  I have to figure out how to plug in the wall adapter without it covering over an extra plug.The Ethernet ports on the netgear are solid and the cables plug in with a very positive and secure feeling.  The internal configuration software is easy to get to and you can setup QSO for the ports.I really cannot think of anything bad to say about the prosafe. I have been running it for a week and so far everything has been perfect.  Once again I cannot stress how nice it is to have that quick snap off system, it eliminates the biggest problem I find with normal routers when I am trying to check cables or ports.

I gave this Fan a 4 star instead of 5 simply because it does not oscillate like I would have expected.  You can aim it up or down but the real trick of this fan is it's use of  air diffusion so that the baby does not get too much direct air blown on them but at the same time that kind of limits it's use in keeping away mosquitoes etc.One thing that is great is that you can tell safety was the prime motive about the design.  From the child proof switches to the grill openings that are made in such a way that it is impossible for a baby to get their fingers inside, to even the plug cord which is hidden in the base and retractable.  It all comes together into a very safe package that's easy to clean and keep dust free.  The noise from the fan is about what you would expect, it's not whisper quiet but at the same time it's kind of a soothing white noise sound that may aid the baby in sleeping.Overall a very good design in a compact package.

Turbo Calcium is fantastic stuff, it works great for getting up your calcium levels up quickly.  Just make sure to read the instructions, don't add water to dry calcium, that can be very dangerous.  You need to do it the other way around and add calcium to the water in increments and stir it up.  You should expect some heat to be generated if your adding it to water in a small container.It's not a complicated product so I don't think it needs a complicated review :)

Unit worked fine on low volume setting but when switched to high volume the unit worked in an erratic manor.  Put in a fresh set of batteries, it worked fine again for a day at high volume then the same problem came back.  I checked the batteries with a volt meter and each time the combined voltage drops by a little due to usage the audio goes erratic.  The other problem is that the low volume is too low so that makes high volume the only option.  Maybe I got a defective unit but at this point I cannot bother to return it.
Works great and the price is really good.What more can I say, it gives a great shave and it does not break the bank like some other high end models.

It really is important that you read the instructions for these units.  If you already have mice you need to get rid of them first using traps etc. before installing these or it's just going to be a waste of time.  Mice that already know your house has a nice supply of food are willing to put up with some sonic irritation if it means a full belly.  If you where hungry and the only nearby source of food was a room full of huge speakers playing rock and roll at 100db level, you might back off at first but when the hunger really strikes you will certainly bare the noise to fill your stomach.  On the other hand if you had no idea that this room of pain had food in it you would most likely move on and check somewhere else for a snack, that's the reason that you need to get rid of the mice that already know your house is a feeding ground.So what you really have is a device that makes your house unattractive to scouting mice and send them scurrying before they even begin to locate food sources.This would have been a five star review if it was not for the fact that the design needs a free plug and that can really limit where you can put these units.  Before making a purchase make sure that you have unused electric outlets in the areas that you need the Repellers. IMO that would be in the kitchen and other places that have food sources.

Very disappointed that it does not work with XBMC for playing directly off the hard drive.  Sure the internal player can play anything you throw at it, but I purchased this believing what it said, that it could run XBMC and play media via XBMC.  Well yes it can do it but only if the media is not in HD!  If the show is in 720p or 1080p you get massive stuttering and frame dropping.  Why use XBMC?  Well the Scrapping ability of XBMC is fantastic, the one that the built in player has is almost worthless.  You have to go in over and over to keep getting it to scrape movie info and even then the info is very limited.  You also have very little control over organizing your shows with the built in player.  With XBMC you can do all these things perfectly.  And yes to make XBMC work  I have tried all the recommended accelerator settings etc.  I spent 3 days looking up stuff on the web, even editing command lines in files but  in the end it was clear that for STREAMING HD media XBMC from external sources XBMC will work fine but for playing local HD media it just does not have a proper driver for that and XBMC does not seem interested in providing one either.Also beware this unit has no fan that I can see for the internal hard drive.  In my experience that's a really bad thing that's going to lead to a rather short life of the hard drive.

I gave this to my little Niece, she is 5 years old and her parents recently bought her a Leappad 2 Ultra for Christmas.First of all what you receive is a cartridge that fits into the to top of the leappad.  So you can only have one of these cartridge based games on the system at a time.  You can download other software into the system using the online store but cartridges are one at a time based.Onto the game itself.  She was already familiar with Umizoomi characters so I guess that made it more fun for her.  She quickly mastered the Game play and was learning some new math concepts along the way, I would imagine that all of the shape building games would be great for slightly younger child, say 3 years old, but at 5 they pretty much have basic shapes down pat, none the less a few did have her a bit confused and she learned some new shapes as the game progressed.  IMO Umizoomi Math is a win win for any parent that has a child with a Leappad unit and is looking for a nice educational game.

It was easy to setup and has fairly good range.  The speed is a little slower than I had hoped but all in all not too bad.Construction quality is good and I like the dual antennas, I would hate to know what the range would be like with just one. I used my web browser and pointed it to 192.168.1.1  which is the routers default address. I then logged in using the User Name "admin" and the WiFi password.  I went "Applications & Gaming"/QOS and disabled WMM as people have mentioned and it did have a bit of an impact on the speed, but not the super amount I expected.  Anyway for the price you just cannot complain, it's a good soild router and I have not had any issues with it for the 25 days I have been testing it.

First of all my 5 star rating is based on the Toothbrush itself and the excellent job it does at cleaning my teeth.This is probably the best electric toothbrush I have ever used and you can definitely tell that your teeth are a lot cleaner than they would be had you used anything else, short of a dentist cleaning your teeth. The construction and build quality are first rate and I see no problems at all with anything in it's construction. I expect this unit to last a pretty long time.With that said I was almost tempted to take off a star because my first impressions of the Bluetooth hookup was that it was just a big gimmick!  After all I know when I brushed my teeth I have an idea of how well I brushed them, an added app is really not going to make much difference.  Then I started to think about it and realized this might be a useful tool for monitoring my Sons brushing, so I attached an extra head and loaded up the app and gave him a lesson in using it.  The end results are excellent!  He feels like it's a bit of a game/competition and I get an easy way to monitor that he has really brushed his teeth properly.  About my only complaint is that the app is a bit intrusive and of course it's another device to plugin and charge.  Those issues aside this is the Mercedes Benz of electric toothbrushes.

Well so far so good, it has been working properly with no leaks, streaks or other problems.It's very hard to find 3rd party toner that is any good but this one has so far delivered.  Always look at the latest reviews when buying toner because the quality control of the sold cartridges can change very quickly.Update: 17 April 2015Ordered a second pair and had to dump both of them in the Garbage bin!  Streaks on every page, most at least a 1/4" wide and varies between 2 to 4 streaks per page.  Both cartridges had the problem and they also leaked Toner out the sides.ALWAYS READ THE LATEST REVIEWS WHEN BUYING 3rd PARTY TONER.  THEY MAY RELEASE A GOOD ONE FOR A FEW MONTHS AND THEN WHEN THE REVIEWS ARE POSITIVE THEY GO FOR A CHEAPER BUILD QUALITY.

I am going to keep this review very short.It does what it says it will do but the light show is not very bright and the unit feels really cheaply constructed.My son was entertained by it in a dark room for a little bit but that wore off very quickly. In a normally lit room you have a hard time seeing the arcs of electricity, that probably due to them keeping the voltage in a safe zone but it kind of makes you wonder why bother making it if you cannot do it properly.

I used this on my ceramic tile floor and I found it to be adequate for the job, it is no miracle worker, some stains require you to manually remove them and that's probably going to be the case no matter what device you use.What I liked:Easy to assembleDoes not use up much storage space.Pads are reusableGood construction quality.Steam cleaning gives me a bit of assurance that most bacteria etc are killed.Light weightTriangular head makes getting into corners easyWhat I did not Like:Pads will need replacing after several uses.This is not a unit to clean the floor from Hell, but it is a good unit for cleaning floors that are well maintained.Overall not a bad product, your mileage may vary but for the price its a pretty good unit.

First of all Read the manual, this is one of those items that it is a must that you read the manual.  After you have read it, you still need a few important tips.1) Turning on and off the unit using the touch sensitive buttons is a hit or miss thing depending on how dry your finger tips are.  I found that wetting my two finger tips with a little water made it work perfectly. (I think they went a little too far on the child safe stuff on this one)2) Using the included voltage tester is great for making sure the unit is working properly.  Make sure to run a test the first time you use it.Now onto the review:I tried the Petsafe on my 100lb Rottweiler and I can tell you that it does work on larger dogs, the shock that is emitted is very mild (tested it on myself) and that's exactly what you want, the pendant will work on any size dog as the shock can be adjusted from very mild to just mild.The problem that most people will have is that they may be trying to use this device to train a dog that has no previous training, that is not what a device like this is used for, you have to first have your dog trained using a regular collar and leash and the main thing is to instill into your Dog a very good understanding of the word "NO".  Dogs that behave badly are often timed the result of the owner letting the dog get away with the bad behavior because they just cannot be bothered to correct it every time it occurs early on in his life. This leads to the dog getting the idea that he can do it again with a good chance of not having a reprimand and this is a very hard thing to undo.  If you take the time when they are a puppy to correct problems gently, they will behave properly without you having to do much work later on.The Petsafe pendant becomes an ideal tool when your dog gets a bit older and wiser and starts to realize that your too far away to see that he's breaking the rules.  At that point you may call out a stern "NO" through a window or down the stairs and if he ignores you.  A short burst from the Pendant will fix the problem and let your pet know that your rules need to be followed at all times.  I have trained several dogs and it would be beyond the scope of a simple review to go into details but this has worked well for me except when it comes to Shih Tzu's.  I have found that breed of dog to be extremely hard to train once the owner has let them rule the house during the puppy stage.As for the pendant itself, it may be problematic on long haired dogs but it certainly works with most breeds.  The shock is very mild and the audible chirp button is IMO too low, but it is enough to get your dogs attention. The unit is well constructed, it feels very durable and is fairly waterproof.  Mine has actually gotten wet when the dog got caught outside during a sudden rain storm and decided he was going to have fun playing in the rain instead of going to his shed.  The battery life is short on the collar unit, maybe 8-12 hours but you can get around that by charging the device and leaving your dog in the environment that he's misbehaving in.  For example if he's digging up your garden, put him outside with a freshly charged collar and then covertly watch him from a distance. As soon as he makes his first attempt at digging shout out "NO" and then give him a small burst.  The shock is so mild that he will most likely just stop and wonder what was that!! And go back again. Repeat it and he should stay away for a few minutes.  After a couple of repeat attempts I stopped shouting at him and just gave him the shock. I found that by watching him for an hour or so I was able to completely correct this behavior and he no longer goes for that section of the garden.If used in a correct manor you can stop most of the problems in a week or two and at that point you can remove the pendant for good and put it up in case your dog starts to ignore the rules again.  I know many people will have mixed views on using a device like this, but it is a far better solution that what typically happens, which is that the dogs behavior becomes increasingly more difficult to deal with and the owner eventually decides to drop him off at the pound, which as we all know is often times a death sentence.

This sweet princess is the daughter of Sleeping Beauty, and she is gorgeous.  I'm loving this line of Disney princesses and so is my sweet niece.  She found the locket contains a sticker for her to wear. Great fun doll, and feels like it's well constructed.

Nicely made, and sturdy feeling bar mops.  I use these for everything including bar tending.  They are great around the house for cleaning bathrooms and floors.  I wash these in hot water and bleach and they work great.

These dish clothes are nicely made and compliment my kitchen.  I washed these in cold water prior to using just in case the colors were gonna bleed, but fortunately they came out just fine.I'm a big fan of cotton cloth for everything and I despise microfiber.  These are cotton seem to be well made.  They absorb well and dry fairly quickly.  Nice set!

So refreshing! Who knew it would be their Momma !  Yes, it was me ready to try almost anything to release the ugly redness and swelling from my latest pimple.Great product that I was thankful to have in thre frig  before my anniversary dinner. I had high hopes for this dry kibble, but Drake has no interest in this one.  I opened the bag and he was sniffing like mad, so I handed him a few pieces.  He gobbled them at first but then spit it back on the floor.It doesn't matter what the ingredients are if the dog won't eat it.

Now this is my kind of 'Barbie' doll.  Mal is so cool.  From her purple hair to her awesome boots, this girl is ready for fun.Mal of the Isle of the Lost, is the daughter of Maleficent comes with her very own spell-book locket that opens up to reveal a dragon sticker inside.This is not your average princess doll, she's got an attitude.

Very happy with this nice long cord fro my iphone 5 and ipad.  It works great with my car charger and with my wall charger.  No problems.  The cable feels durable and I'm hopeful it will last a long time.

I think this may be one of the coolest toys I have seen in my life.  I know its not so much a toy as a learning tool, at least for the kids, but for me it has a real wow factor.  I simply could not wait to test this out, and experience building something from nothing in 3D.The kit has everything needed for small basic projects, but we just played around and tested for a few hours.That being said my children are teenagers.  I cannot recommend this kit for a young child.  This kit involves a spotlight and special 3D ink which is not safe for a young child to use without supervision.  It also requires a skill to developing any form or design.  It may be frustrating for young children unless they are truly artistic .Very cool kit for an older age group.

This KT tape is such a fabulous find for me as a Mom of two highly atheletic Teenage boys.  They are forever comeing home with a new ache or pain.  Most of the time these are fortunately the result of a tough practice.They seem to get beat up more in practice than in the actual games (they play Football & lacrosse).Our latest injury took us first to the general doctor with a referral for physical therapy.Seems the SI joint is inflamed and well disjointed.  Fortunately we learned this is a combination of agressive Lacrosse practice and a big growing spurt in the past several months.KT tape is fabulous.  It provides the extra needed support to relieve the tension and pain my son has been having.We have relied on this brand of tape to support, wrists, ankles, feet and just about everything.

This play mat is soft and comfortable with lots of different textures for baby to explore.  Its a lot larger than I expected it to be, but it folds ups easily and neatly.  This provides a soft play space on our hardwood floors.  Holds up well to normal machine washer and dryer.

Very pretty earrings.  The stones in these absolutely sparkle in the light.  They are longer than I prefer for an ear cuff because my ears are rather small.  They are well made and would make a lovely gift for someone special.

Both dogs love this food.  Max is a very picky eater and after a few sniffs he finished the bowl and sat waiting for a refill, while Drake ate his much slower than he usually eats. I was expecting a real shower treat and was rather disappointed.  This had little to no effect on my skin and I felt the need to apply my normal moisturizer after my shower.  The label said it will lather, however it didn't for me.This has a mild scent and it's a shimmery gold.

I have used TENS units in the past and understand this will not melt fat or leave you with six pack abs.  What it will do is strengthen your core and back muscles.  Honestly, I don't know if this will help build my abs or not, but the feeling is an intense like a massage on the abs and back muscles. This hasn't worked for me.  We have a few feral cats in our neighborhood and they seem to love our landscaped front yard.  The first application we used about half the bottle and saturated an area approximately 8'x10'.  It rained a few hours later and the next day the cats were still in the yard.
