On the whole, it's ambitious and draws from diverse influences. It's a bit poppy, a bit psychedelic, a bit electronic, and all good.This is a solid record and a great return for a band we weren't quite sure had any returning to do. And it sounds like there is still plenty of creativity left in these guys.

If you're like me, you weren't there to see Ryan Adams perform at Carnegie Hall. Thankfully, this recording exists to capture two outstanding shows from one of the best performers in music today.This career-spanning set is a complete delight for both hardcore and casual Ryan Adams fans (Bryan Adams fans, however, will be disappointed by the lack of "Summer of '69"). The album feels intimate and captures the magic of witnessing the real thing. You not only get 42 fantastic songs, but you also get the true concert experience through Ryan Adams's banter and improv, including a hilarious on-the-spot track that conjures the likes of Michael McDonald.Ryan Adams is in great spirits for these two gigs, but that doesn't make the music less beautiful or less heartbreaking. He flat-out kills these performances, and you can feel it through the recording. Whether or not your favorite Ryan Adams songs appear on this album, you will be blown away by the performance. I must admit, I was disappointed at first by the tracklisting. Many of my favorite Ryan Adams songs are MIA. But listening to this, I didn't care at all. I forgot all about my favorite Ryan Adams songs and found myself lost in the performance, not caring what he played next (just as long as he kept playing).This is one of the best live recordings released in a long time (both from a sound and performance standpoint) and a must for any Ryan Adams fan. If you've never seen him live, listening to this almost takes you there. It's a divine listening experience.

Untethered Moon is a fantastic return for Built to Spill. This album is an instant classic filled with everything that makes Built to Spill a great band. The scorching guitar riffs and solo in opening track “All Our Songs” represent some of the best musicianship the band has ever laid down on a studio album. Fortunately, the album doesn’t peak with this incredible first song.Untethered Moon is a strong effort throughout, rivaling some of the best work in Built to Spill’s catalog. “All Our Songs,” “C.R.E.B,” and “When I’m Blind” are some of the strongest tracks, but the entire album is outstanding. This is a guitar-driven album with blaring riffs that will rip through your speakers. It’s not necessarily groundbreaking in that it doesn’t explore too much new territory for the band, but there are still plenty of fresh sounds that will make you glad Built to Spill is still making music. I think it’s their best work since Keep It Like a Secret. Let’s hope it doesn’t take so long to get the next one.

This is a great concept for young kids just learning how to spell. However, the game is very cheaply made. The board does not have the traditional letter spaces to hold the tiles neatly in position. I know it would be difficult to incorporate that feature on the full-size board, but it is sorely missed here. The tiles don't stay neatly on the board at all. This is forgivable, but the board itself is ridiculously flimsy. The board snapped in half when my 4 year old daughter picked it up. She wasn't even being rough with it. We only had the game for two weeks before it broke. For almost 20 bucks, I expect much better. I guess what they say is true. They don't make 'em like they used to.

The Poser, Jacob Rubin’s debut novel, has a unique premise and ambitious goals. Unfortunately, much like Giovanni (the book’s main character and narrator), this book falls short of meeting those.It starts as an engaging and quick read with a delightful (although not necessarily likeable) cast of characters. Once Max enters the picture, we are treated to fine humor without expense of the plot. When Giovanni begins his career as an impressionist under Max’s watch, we start to see the big ambition of this book. It becomes a tale of finding oneself, of really learning who we are, but without the usual triteness and overdone tropes (other than the mother-son issues).Unfortunately, it doesn’t quite make it there.Another reviewer commented that s/he became bored with the story and only cared about Rubin’s prose, to the point s/he no longer cared what happened to Giovanni. I can’t fully agree with this. While the story did begin to drag, by the third part of the book I found myself caring only about what happened to Giovanni (as in I just wanted to skip ahead to the ending). The language had ceased to entertain, and the premise had faded into something thin and tired. Whereas the story and writing had fully engaged early on, the latter part of the book all but loses the reader completely.I won’t spoil anything (not that there’s much to be spoiled about the ending), but the last few dozen pages or so feel cliche, forced, and rushed. Rather than learning anything about the human condition, we are forced into sentimentality and reflection. There’s also a new character that frustratingly serves as a pseudo deus ex machina. It’s a shame the book had to end this way after starting with so much promise. I will say this (very small spoiler alert): did we really need another story narrated from a mental hospital?Overall, it’s a promising debut that comes up a little short. It’s worth a read if you’re really looking for something new.

Hey, Killer is Local H's first album with new drummer Ryan Harding, and it's a great one. Although Brian St. Clair is missed after an amazing 13-year run with the band, Harding fills in nicely with aggressive and pounding drum beats that match the Local H sound perfectly.The album starts off with a wall of feedback and then launches into the instant classic that is "The Last Picture Show in Zion." The album hammers on from there, never missing a beat (although it does slow down for a track or two in the middle). Scott Lucas shows little signs of aging here. His vocal delivery is strong with a nice texture of maturity that gives these hard rockers even more power. "City of Knives" has the best yelling of Scott Lucas's career. The music is loud and at times angry (see especially "Freshly F*cked" and "The Misanthrope"), oozing with everything there is to love about Local H. Lyrically, it probably packs the most punch of anything the band releases.In a way, this is a logical follow-up to Hallelujah, I'm a Bum. However, it's a much more focused effort. There's no filler here, and the music is louder and stronger. It's easily the best album the band has released since P.J. Soles, and possibly even better than that.If you're a Local H fan (even if you've been disappointed by their recent albums), this album will kill you - in the best way possible. If you've never listened to Local H before, this album actually serves as a great introduction for any fans of rock, punk, or grunge. Do yourself a favor and support this band. Go buy this album. I grabbed the vinyl copy from their PledgeMusic per-order, and I'm quite glad I did.

From the opening riff of Modzilla, it's clear that Blaster is a solid rock album. Scott's vocals are strong throughout, and the music hits hard with classic rock influences and a modern twist. The band is pretty tight with some excellent guitar work. While the music doesn't quite mesh the same way as STP, this is a quality musical experience all around.In a way, this feels like the next logical step after STP's self-titled album. On the whole though, I think this is a stronger effort. In terms of Scott's career, I'd rank this ahead of Scott's solo album Happy in Galoshes, STP self-titled, and Velvet Revolver's Contraband. It's a little weak lyrically at times (Way She Moves, Beach Pop), but there aren't any bad songs on here.In terms of the quality of the vinyl pressing: I purchased the clear orange vinyl through the PledgeMusic campaign prior to the album release. It's a good looking record in a quality sleeve with a nice insert (and the bonus sleeve with Scott's autograph was a nice bonus). The pressing itself sounds good for the most part, but there isn't enough dead wax on Side B, so closing track "Circles" sounds a bit muddled.

This is a quick collection of powerful and emotional stories that span the broad range of human experience. Jeffrey Miller has the rare ability to say a lot with only a few words. These stories are sharp and cut to the core of what it means to be alive.

When I first heard that the new Sufjan album would be a return to his folk roots, I was a little disappointed. While I have long enjoyed Sufjan’s folkier albums, The Age of Adz is one of my all-time favorite records. I couldn’t help but hope we’d get something similar to that.Fortunately, Carrie & Lowell does not disappoint in any way. From the opening guitar on “Death with Dignity,” it’s obvious that this is one of the most beautiful albums in recent memory--and perhaps ever. Sufjan is at the top of his game musically, lyrically, and vocally. The album flows together perfectly, drawing the listener into a deep and heartfelt experience. However, each track also can stand alone as a great song.“Death with Dignity” and “Fourth of July” might be the highlights, but this is really an album that works so well together that it’s almost criminal to break it up. The entire album is perfect. I’d list the best songs or do a track-by-track analysis, but there’s no need. This is simply flawless. The musicianship is so rich and gorgeously layered. As much as I love The Age of Adz, Michigan, and Seven Swans, this is Sufjan’s true masterpiece.Because it is such a quiet album, some listeners may treat it as background music, but this is an album that really begs for complete immersion. It’s criminal not to give it your full attention and really listen to the rich music, beautiful lyrics, and minimal production. When you spin Carrie & Lowell, do yourself a favor and give your undivided attention to Sufjan. This is a record that rewards the listener again and again. An instant classic of profound and elegant musical beauty. Sufjan Stevens has really set himself apart from all other singer-songwriters of our generation.

After reading a story by Eric Bosse in an online literary magazine, I immediately sought out his full-length collection of fiction. I was not disappointed. This is a smart and powerful collection from the hand of a skilled writer who isn't afraid to take risks. Bosse's stories touch on many deep issues, but he achieves this without being overly reflective or forcing it upon the reader. These stories are at once developed and succinct, with rich characters and rewarding scenes. In each story, Bosse pulls the reader into the lives of the characters, making us feel their mistakes, heartbreaks, and confusions. The stories aren't necessarily connected, but they flow fluidly together, and the collection definitely works as a whole. It's a collection filled with emotion, humor, and just the right amount of bizarreness. It's hard to pick a favorite, but I'd probably go with "The Master of Submission." I eagerly await more from this author. It would be a magnificent mistake not to pick up a copy of this book.

Are you tired the mountains of BS from the media, politicians, and everyone on your Facebook feed? Then Debunk It! is the perfect book for you.Debunk It! serves a twofold purpose: 1. To teach you how not to fall for BS in a world filled with BS, and 2. To dispel some of the biggest BS out there today. It accomplishes both of these pretty well, but it isn't going to arm you with high quality arguments for debunking all the BS out there. Rather, it gives you the tools to learn how to do it yourself. By touching on BS topics like anti-vaccination, anti-evolution, and a wide range of other nonsense, Grant teaches readers of any age all the tricks of the BSers. While he does dismantle these BS topics quickly, this book won't actually help you argue against them. You'll still have to do your own research.The writing is very accessible. It's written for teens, but it can be appreciated by anyone. Parents should probably be warned that there is mild profanity (bullsh!t is used dozens of times), but it's all in good fun. Grant certainly isn't obscene.Overall, a fun and informative read that anyone can enjoy (except maybe extreme liberals and extreme conservatives who are too brainwashed by their own BS).

This started off very strong for me, with a captivating voice and great scene work. Unfortunately, the storytelling started to spiral out of control about halfway through. Much of the characterization felt forced, the narrative voice became too reflective, and the chronology of events felt stifling. The book lost its momentum and failed to deliver suspense at the expense of trying too hard to come up with grand realization after grand realization. Overall, it's a pretty good YA book, but it doesn't hold up for the whole thing. It becomes very difficult to really care about these characters after awhile.

I’ll be the first to admit that I was quite nervous when I heard Twin Shadow’s next album would be on a major label and was going to be even poppier than Confess. While I enjoyed Confess on the whole, I was hoping for a sound a little more similar to the amazing debut album, Forget.It took only about 10 seconds of “Flatliners” before I shed that nervousness and jumped out of my seat, dancing and thinking to myself, “Yes! This is pop musical genius!” I didn’t expect this reaction at all, especially after being a little disappointed when I first heard this album's singles.Eclipse is an incredibly catchy album from start to finish, and it’s radically different from George Lewis Jr’s previous efforts. And that’s perfectly okay with me. There is so much growth here. Yes, it’s “poppier,” but in a mature way, not in some contrived I-wanna-be-on-the-radio way. It’s immediately clear that this is the album George Lewis Jr really wanted to make, and I commend him for following his grand musical vision.Tracks like “Turn Me Up” and “I’m Ready” show just how strong Lewis’s songwriting is on this album. At heart, these may be pop songs, but they contain strong rock and experimental elements that prove Lewis has something bold up the sleeves of his leather jacket.“Flatliners,” “Turn Me Up,” and “To the Top” (the last of which I actually didn’t like at first) are the standout tracks for me, but the whole album is solid and filled with surprises. The guitar work on “Watch Me Go” is especially incredible. I won’t be surprised at all if a few of these tracks get a bit of radio play, which would be fantastic. The world needs to hear more Twin Shadow! I don’t love this album quite as much as Forget, but I think it's better than Confess and I have a feeling this is going to grow more and more with each listen. These songs get in my head and stay for days. Unlike most of today’s pop songs, I welcome George Lewis Jr. in my head.

After 8 years, Modest Mouse is finally back, and this album should not disappoint you, as long as you give it a fair chance. Let’s start by stating the obvious: this is not Lonesome Crowded West. Nor is it The Moon and Antarctica. However, it’s still a solid body of work with some standout Modest Mouse tracks.The album starts off strong, building from the slow “Strangers to Ourselves” into the driving “Lampshades On Fire” and “Sh*t in Your Cut,” all three of which are very good songs. Then, we have the unfortunate thing that is track 4: on first listen, “Pistol” might seem like one of the worst songs ever. However, it grows on you, reminiscent of My Morning Jacket’s “Highly Suspicious,” a song that seems so bad until you realize it’s actually embarrassingly good (but still in a bad way).It doesn’t take long for the band to recover. Track 6, “The Ground Walks, with Time in a Box,” is an instant classic, the type of energetic, fist-pumping, foot-pounding song that makes Modest Mouse so great.From there, the album remains pretty solid until the complete throwaway track “God is an Indian…” Why they decided to include this on the album is beyond me. After 8 years, I guess anything goes. But a lousy 1-minute track isn’t enough to ruin a good album.Overall, there’s plenty of good stuff on this record. Yes, it feels a little bloated at times, and it’s by no means their best. Some of these riffs feel recycled, and it doesn’t cover much new territory. But this is still one mighty mouse that packs a lot of punch.

This is a beautifully illustrated and imaginative story that will delight children of any age (including those of us over 30). My 3 year-old daughter was engrossed from page one and wanted to read it again and again. Unlike many of her princess books, I didn't mind at all! It's a magical and funny story with giant ants, dinosaurs, and a few cameos from familiar characters like Little Red Riding Hood. An instant classic.

This is a fast read with some amazing dino-on-human action that will get your heart racing and craving a little dino lovin' of your own. However, I'm very confused about two important points:1. Just how did this dinosaur become a billionaire? I need a lot more backstory here. The character development is a little shabby at times (although I can really picture the dinosaur's huge member).2. How exactly did the dino turn him gay? I don't know if I'm reading this too literally, but I got the feeling he was gay all along. The dinosaur just helped him find himself.Really, I think this is a deep and insightful commentary on how our society views sexuality, but it was missing some key elements.

If you're looking for first-rate literature, turn back now before the Shatzilla gets you. But if you want a fun, riotous adventure of low-brow literature and high-octane chuckles, then you won't find much better. This quest to save William Shatner is witty and engaging, taking almost enough creative license to land this author in the slammer for blatant copyright infringement. Yeah, that's what Jeff Burk risked to write this glorious book for you. You owe it to him to pick up a copy.Never seen Star Trek? Doesn't matter. I've never seen an episode in my life. Not into nerdy gamer stuff? Doesn't matter. I've never been to a nerd convention or played any nerdy magic card games in my life. This book is still hilarious. It at once parodies, mocks, and ridicules these things while also showing how awesome they probably are for the people into them. Bottom line: whether you are a gamer nerd, Trek nerd, some other nerd, or not a nerd at all, you will love this book and laugh along.Also, I hear this is a sequel (or more like a follow-up). I didn't read the first one, but now I want to. I don't think I lost anything at all because I read this first. Shatnerquest doesn't seem to require much prior knowledge. Of anything. At all. Except you probably should know how to read.

If you’re expecting any Arcade Fire on this album, then I have good news for you. Will Butler, brother of Arcade Fire frontman Win Butler, certainly draws from his own experience with the powerhouse indie outfit. But this definitely isn’t an Arcade Fire album, nor is it simply an offshoot or a footnote. This is a strong and diverse album that offers up foot-stomping blues, piano-driven ballads, and good old-fashioned rock music.There are definitely songs (like “Son of God” and “What I Want” and “Witness”) that sound straight from an Arcade Fire record (or maybe more like Arcade Fire B-Sides), which should be enough to please the diehard AF fans. But for those listeners looking for more or even for a slight departure, you will get it. This is not a wholly unique album, and it does feel a bit derivative at times, but it also stands on its own and stays strong throughout. It’s a diverse album, possibly the workings of an artist who doesn’t quite know the direction he wants to take, but that makes it all the more rewarding in this case.The biggest complaint is how short it is. At just 27 minutes, it can hardly even be called an album. Still, the music is good, and standout tracks like "Anna," "Take My Side," and "Sing to Me" certainly make this worthwhile.Will Butler may not be the star of the Arcade Fire, but he shines brightly here.

Acclaimed author Neil Gaiman introduces this collection by confessing it doesn't stand up to his own test: that a collection should consist of works meant to go together, not just a hodgepodge of writing. Mr. Gaiman more than sells himself short with this confession. Yes, it's true that the first piece is seemingly a throwaway prose poem about writing. A foolish reader would stop here and deem the book an unworthy read. However, Gaiman quickly redeems himself with the (of course unrelated) combination of "Lunar Labyrinth" and "The Thing About Cassandra." It's immediately apparent that Gaiman was telling the truth in that introduction. We aren't going to see a common theme in this book (other than great writing, of course). Rather, we're going to get a little bit of everything, and it's a huge reward.Gaiman shows in this collection that he's capable of it all. From humor to the absurd to the utterly fantastic to the downright traditional, Gaiman churns out story after story of engaging plots and characters, yanking the reader along for a satisfying (if not confusing) ride.At times, this reads like a collection of demos or outtakes. Some of these pieces will have you thinking, "How could such a great writer produce this?" However, the amount of fluff and filler you have to sift through to get to the good stuff is far from a monumental task. Gaiman provides plenty of hits in this collection (although some stories do feel like false starts).My personal favorites are "The Thing About Cassandra," "Click-Clack the Rattlebag," "The Man Who Forgot Ray Bradbury," and "And Weep, Like Alexander," the last of which is surely one of the most amusing and thought-provoking stories of this century. Sure, not everything in here is a gem, but it's a fine hodgepodge of writing. Don't say Mr. Gaiman didn't warn you.

When I first heard this album, I listened to it at least 5 times in a row. It was one of those rare, "Holy crap, this is what I've been waiting for" moments. This is music that forces its way in your ears, slams into your brain, and stays in your head for weeks at a time. It can get you again at any time. You'll be listening to something else, and this thing in your head will scream, "Put on Guilty of Everything and turn it up LOUD!" And you can't resist, because this beautiful, soaring, pulsing music is an addictive earworm that must be heard again and again. As cliche as it is to call something "soaring" in a music review, this truly qualifies. Heck, this might be the one album that justifies that term ever having been used to talk about music.Go ahead and insert the My Bloody Valentine comparison here, but this deserves so much more than that label. Get this album now.

Nervous is Siskiyou's third album and first in four years. It's also their best one yet. Nervous has a more mature, richer sound than the first two efforts (both of which were also very good).Opening track "Deserter" is a fantastic effort and possibly the best on an album full of great songs. The folk-horn freakout in the second half of the song makes it clear that Siskiyou is trying new things on this album--and doing those things very well. That's not to say that Nervous is a drastic departure from the first two albums. At the core, this is still Siskiyou, just stronger and more adventurous.This is a fantastic effort that will reward the listener again and again. Siskiyou has really found their sound.

Kelly Link is an innovative writer, and these stories show off her diverse range. The first story, "The Summer People," is by far the best. It's a mysterious, playful, and dark story that captivates the reader for all 38 or so pages. Unfortunately, like much of the collection, it rushes to conclude after developing such brilliant tension. It's almost as if Link just decided it was time to start a new story. Honestly, I'd rather see a novel-worth of "The Summer People" than read any of the other stories in this collection. Each one felt a little weaker than the last, and Link's "experiments" with language sometimes grew quite tiresome. The second story in the collection has great characters (the demon lover is fascinating), but it is told in such a scatterbrained way that it loses most of its power. Everything after that is hit or miss, including closer "Light," which is so close to being a very good story. Still there's a good amount worth reading here, and Link does have a strong contemporary voice. I'd give this 3.5 stars if I could.

I've heard a lot of people complain that this isn't as good as Shrines, but I disagree. It's not the same album, that's for sure. It's not even necessarily the exact same style. I found this a richer experience, with better beats, fuller songs, and more powerful vocal harmonies. This is a great follow-up to a masterpiece, and it's a masterpiece in its own right. A beautiful and fun album from start to finish.

This is a stunning collection of music from Iron and Wine that really needed to see an official release. It really feels like a cohesive album as opposed to a mishmash of old songs slapped together for a buck. No, this is the real deal. Even though it's not a "proper" album, it's the best thing Sam Beam has released since The Shepherd's Dog (and maybe even better than that). Songs like "Two Hungry Blackbirds," "Your Sly Smile," and "Slow Black River" stand up to anything else Sam Beam has done. This is a perfect reminder of the great music he is capable of making, and I'd love to see him return to this sound one day. But as long as he keeps releasing these old tapes, I'm happy.

Have you ever wondered what happens to all that "seed" spilled into the toilet when a man pleases himself? Well, thanks to Shane McKenzie's hilarious Toilet Baby, we now have the answer. Welcome to the crazy world of the half-human, half-toilets.Okay, so it may seem like just a silly book about toilet children, but there's actually a lot more going on here. This is filled with timeless themes about prejudice, relationships, and being all you can be. Brave to Shane McKenzie for using toilets to make important statements about life and society.Overall, this is a quick read with a lot of funny and heartfelt moments. If you are a fan the strange, weird, bizarre, or funny, then this is for you.

For the price, this garbage can seems a bit underwhelming at first. Let's be realistic. $50 for a plastic bin that holds your trash before you put it in another plastic bin...that seems a bit steep. However, even though this thing is far from stylish, it's $50 well spent.Sure, you can buy a $10-$20 garbage can at your local discount store, but you won't have the reliability of this product. Simplehuman stands behind its quality. This trash can comes with a 5-year warranty, which might sound ridiculous because why wouldn't a trash can last for 5 years? What could happen, right?Well, our foot pedal broke after 2 years. That's right. A $50 trash can broke after two years of normal use. It's not like we were clomping on the thing with 25-pound steel-toed shoes. No, most of the time we weren't wearing shoes at all. A normal human foot is plenty to cause damage to this thing.Luckily, Simplehuman sent us a brand new foot pedal, no questions asked. We didn't even have to prove our purchase. It took about 2 minutes to order it online, and about 15 minutes to replace the old foot pedal. Now, we're back to having a functional plastic bin that holds our garbage until we're ready to move it to the plastic bin outside.

There isn't much to say that hasn't already been said about this release. The vinyl sounds amazing, and this mix is almost like listening to a brand new album. However, it saddens me every time to listen to the revamped guitar solo on Serve the Servants. The original version was perfect.

Hard Bodies is the sexiest thing you will read this year. Or next year. Or last year, if you build a time machine. Justin Grimbol is a master storyteller without using all that bogus literary storytelling garbage. If you can read this without laughing, then you shouldn't be allowed to read. Unless you physically can't laugh. Then keep reading.My only complaint is that reading this tale of Eddie Grimboli's life makes me realized I haven't even lived yet.

In The Vixen Scream, Nancy Stohlman handles tiny men, death row inmates, pops, Avon lady stalkers, missing penises, clones with bad taste in literature, and a s***load of Biblical characters. This is a fun, profound, and brilliant world of eclectic stories that will have you laughing as you wonder, "Why didn't I come up with this?" Somehow, Stohlman expertly creates vivid worlds in tiny stories that leap off the page and into the dark places of your soul.

This is not an easy book. Rather, this is a book that provides great rewards to patient and diligent readers. It begins so cryptically that it is almost impossible to follow and enjoy. Midway through the second chapter, almost any reader who has made it that from will be completely hooked. I read the entire book in one day simply because I had to. John Darnielle's brilliant prose and bold non-linear structure made me unable to put this down. The novel unravels like a deep maze, revealing our greatest fears along the way. It's almost like a modern choose-your-own-adventure where you don't actually get to make the choices (but the illusion of choice is always there). As you get deeper into the this strange world, you realize just how clear everything is. And clarity makes the world take on a whole new depth. Read this. You won't be disappointed unless you really want to be.Edit: A lot of reviewers seem to suggest you can't get into this book if you aren't a gamer. I'm not a gamer. I have never been interested in any role playing games, and I don't own a gaming console. I still love this book and found it captivating, haunting, and relatable.

Black Love has long been my favorite Afghan Whigs album. It is aggressive, passionate, haunting, and beautiful. From the opening sounds of Crime Scene to the final sonic blast of Faded, this is a gripping album that won't let you go.Recently, MOV repressed this classic album on vinyl. They did an excellent job, and I strongly recommend picking up a copy. You will be rewarded with a brand new listening experience. My copy has no surface noise, and the songs take on a whole new life.

Timothy Gager achieves an incredible feat in "The Thursday Appointments of Bill Sloan." The style and structure is innovative and experimental, yet Gager somehow weaves together the lives of this cast of misfits without ever losing the forward momentum of the larger storyline. This is a brilliant story that dives deep into the human condition. Reading this book will make you think everyone in the world is simultaneously crazy and the most sane person you know. It's a difficult read at times because of the non-linear structure, but it rewards the patient reader. I strongly advise against reading a bunch of other books while reading this one. It's meant to be taken in all at once so you can get to know these characters and remember them well along the journey.

"Tell Me More About Evil" isn't so much a brand new album as it is a beautiful re-working of the absolutely stunning "Slingshot to Heaven" (also released in 2014). This is a must-buy for all fans of Margot & the Nuclear So and So's. The versions here are remarkably emotional, and it is well worth repeated listens. Is it as good as Slingshot? Maybe not, but it doesn't have to be. It's different, and it's awesome. The DVD is an intimate look into the recording process and lifestyle of one of the greatest minds in music today.

Glass Animals is one of those rare short story collections where every story is great. Stephen V Ramey takes the reader on wild adventures, with stories that are hilarious, poignant, and powerful. Ramey is a master of the short craft, and he pulls it off whether the story is a half-page or ten pages. Although the stories aren't strongly connected to each other, Ramey's pacing and prose makes this book addictive.

This fits my HD 6 perfectly. It feels like a good quality case and the stand option makes it just about perfect. I also love that you can close it with the elastic strap so it doesn't come open in a bag.

These truly do work. I live in an apartment and noticed one windy day that our sockets were whistling. This surprised me since this is a newer construction, but alas, it was happening. We spoke to the management and they said they'd look into it but a month passed to no avail. I saw on the forecast that we were getting some below zero temps and decided to remedy the drafty things in the meantime. There were just enough of the outlet and switch covers to do our whole apartment (3 bdrm, 2 bath). I noticed a huge difference in the amount of cold air coming from them on the outer walls pretty much immediately. There was still a bit of cold coming from the outlet holes themselves where things weren't plugged in and this was solved with the use of  closed faced socket protectors which can be found in the baby section of just about any store.

This puts grocery sacks right where I need them most, in my kitchen near the garbage. I use grocery sacks to wrap up dirty diapers to contain odor (which on the record works just as well as diaper genie but basically for free).  I can't say that it holds sixty bags, but maybe I stuffed it wrong. Either way, it serves it's purpose.

I've purchased these to go in my heels as I have issues with plantar fasciitis, and I cannot go with out arch support for very long when it flares up. And wearing heels tends to cause them. This put support right under my arches where I need it and its not awkward or uncomfortable feeling like other types I've tried.

I bought three playhut tents for christmas this year, and so far so good. This Planes one was actually to replace a Mickey Mouse tent (Plastic poles) that lasted about 12 hours and was broken immediately. I did a review on it, and I recommend you seek it out  so you know what style of bed tent to avoid so you don't waste your money like we did. The Playhuts, are pop up tents and seem thus far very durable and have a great material. We have this one, a Spiderman one, and a Frozen one and all of them are doing well. They fit perfectly on twin beds and are held in place with elastic straps, they don't interfere too much with making the beds eighter if you just tuck one end of the blankets under the mattress and put the elastic over that. The one downside is despite following the photo instructions, I cannot get them folded back up to store when the kids don't want them on their beds. I can get them "close enough" and shove them under the couch, so all is well :P

I typically turn to Amazon for most shoe purchases as I can almost always find good prices on name brand shoes for my children. New Balance is particular favorite of mine for them as they just seem to have the best durability because they usually look close to new even after several months of play and abuse. My kids have never complained about discomfort as they have with Saucony, Nike, and other store brands (I gave up on the store brands after the "toddler" stage because the soles would literally fall apart within weeks). My son flipped when we were looking on here for a new pair of shoes because they have yellow on them, and I did because the price was amazing! I think he's been wearing them for a few months now and aside from a little dirt on the bottom, they look as good as they did coming out of the box. Totally recommend!
My husband uses these as shower shoes. They serve the purpose very nicely.
This little duo does what it supposed to. Not to sticky, not to runny.

First and foremost I want to say that EasyUps are the BEST training pants out there. My only complaint is that they don't have the tear-away sides to make "diaper" changes simple and quick. Which in their defense isn't the point of trainers most times, but pull-ups and other brands have them on theirs, and that feature would make them my all time go to.  My son is a larger boy (why we NEED trainers) for his age and also has some cog/dev delays and potty training has been on going for two years now because of this. I've found that pull-ups tend to leak or "seep" through, especially at night, requiring that I either buy Goodnights, or change him in the middle of  the night. I do however buy them for his preschool and our diaper bag, so that they/we  don't have to take his pants and shoes off (he is in a boots only phase, so it can be a real chore in a hurry) when he does need changed. This is why I'd love if Easy ups had that option for changing because then I'd only buy them. With easy ups, they are more than sufficient for day and night both so I only need to keep the one kind on hand. I should also mention that with diapers and wipes, Amazon Prime/Mom and subscribe and save, you actually get more diapers for right around what you will pay in a big box store.

I stumbled across this series just browsing the options and figured I would check it out. I was impressed and satisfied with it and had a hard time putting it down. If you did NOT like 50 Shades of Grey bc of how repetitive and poorly written it was, give this series a shot. It's much better quality and only mildly repetitive as there are only so many descriptive words that can be used during steamy scenes. In regard to those I didn't feel as if the author had just copied and pasted them throughout the books. I will say my only real complaint is that the majority seems to happen over just a span of a few weeks but in my mind most of these things would develop over the span of a few months realistically. That's truly a minor detail though and doesn't impact my opinion negatively enough to effect my rating.
Perfect for his mickey celebration

I felt like this shoes fit a little big. I have narrow feet and usually boots are okay in regular widths, but these were slipping off my feet. I also felt like they were a bit to wide around the leg and just looked weird where they hit on me.
Great little decor set. Really ups the ante for any party
She is his favorite girl train and he loves her! High quality like all the other trackmaster trains!
This tablecover was the perfect finishing touch to my sons Mickey party!

The scent is perfect for a little girl, the packaging is cute, but not what is photographed. My daughters was purple and the cap was a  ball, not the green color or style in the photo. I should also mention the spray comes out in a stream and not a mist.  Hard to get even coverage.
These will make your tongue hurt and the lips pucker! They didn't melt in shipping either!!!!
My son loves spiderman and he loves motorcycles. The two combined is a double win!

I've found it's hard to find quality character bedding. Usually its super thin and doesn't last long for that reason. These are some of the best I've found yet. Soft, but thick. They washed up nicely and look so cute on my sons bed!
These are decent and do the job. Not the greatest quality, but arent the worst.
These looked so cute hanging up!

So far so good. I've washed them and curled them and I had no issues with severe shedding, burning, or melting. I cannot say I am 100% convinced that it ALL human hair but is mostly since there were no problems working with it. I def recommend this brand if you are looking for the effect of extensions without a huge hit to your budget and want a decent quality set.
My son loved this tablecover on his birthday
Perfect banner for Cars birthday themed parties!
I bought these to hang hair extensions. They serve this purpose well and I def recommend them for this.
I truthfully bought this outfit for my daughters doll babies because real baby clothing is sometimes cheaper and more durable than the doll clothing they make.  It fits like a charm.

These little things are so much bigger than the pictures make them look!  That or I had abnormally small cupcakes :P Either way they took up almost half versus the 1/4 shown in the photos, but no less they did the job and made one little boy very happy on his birthday :D

My son loves having his favorite characters on his bed and currently his favorite is Mickey. This fits his twin size bed much like a comforter would, and that's exactly what I look for in plush blankets since he prefers them to actual comforters which NEVER get used.
This necklace was beautiful and as described! The recipient loved it!!! Totally recommend it for  any one who loves dolphins!

My son is a huge Herbie fan, and when I found a Hot Wheel Herbie I had to have it for him! It took two of his favorites and combined them into one product, not a losing situation at all! Best stocking stuffer ever!!!!!!

We just got this feeder to ensure the Fishies in our new set up wouldn't starve to death while we were out gallivanting with family and friends over the Christmas week. Set up was pretty simple, and the installation was pretty cut and dry. We filled it with some crushed up flakes and took off with hopes of the best since we didn't get to "test it" for a day or two before trusting it. (We got it the day we had to leave out for our Christmas travels). When we arrived home, we half expected to have some floaters, but all was well. It apparently did the job it was designed for since no one starved or was eaten by the other fish! Eheim is probably one of the most trustworthy brands out there in respect to aquatic "Life Support" so I guess we shouldn't  have had such low expectations.
The format I purchased was supposed to be DVD. What I received is an empty case with an insert and a code. Thats fine and well except for we can't use it.

My opinion of this hair dryer is just MEHHHH. I'd recommend looking for one elsewhere as this one was one huge disappointment and has been the source of much irritation. I'm sure it would be okay intact.

This thing barely made it to the bed, and was toast within 24 hrs. While I was putting it together, one of the end poles poked right through the corner slot you put it into to give it structure (I remedied this with bandaids.  Within two hours the kids had bent one of  the poles so I had to brace it with a dowel and packing tape. Save your money and buy a pop up tent. I got one of those for my other sons bed, and so far it's superior in quality and durability. I should have literally threw the money I spent on this into the trash can.

This thing barely made it to the bed, and was toast within 24 hrs. While I was putting it together, one of the end poles poked right through the corner slot you put it into to give it structure (I remedied this with bandaids.  Within two hours the kids had bent one of  the poles so I had to brace it with a dowel and packing tape. Save your money and buy a pop up tent. I got one of those for my other sons bed, and so far it's superior in quality and durability.

I bought a ten pack of these for my boys to wear with their new boots as they only had ankle socks up till then.  One boy wears a 12 and the other a size 1, so I figured this would suit them both nicely. They fit the 12 perfectly, but were a little small on the 1, but were passable. In the end I bought him the next size up because I wanted to be sure he was completely comfortable. So my advice is to go a size up if they wear a 13.5 or higher.

I've got two boys who wanted boots "Like Daddies", and these fit the bill perfectly. They gave the boys the look they wanted, and the features that I wanted. They are insulated with thinsulate, and water proof (perfect snowy/wet days!). The one thing I'm not loving about them, is that after about a month solid use, the strings are already starting to fray, so pick a pack of those up and you'll be set!  We got a pair of the standard "wheat" color, and a pair of the dark brown, and of the two, I prefer the look of the dark brown  ones. Cosmetically they look cleaner longer, and that's always a plus where little boys are involved.

This set is a nice "throw back" toy for anyone looking to get their kids out of the digital age for a while. George toys are harder to come by, and this one is pretty great. It has A LOT of little magnet pieces to create numerous scenes and stories with. Highly recommend for any George fan!

This a great little bowling set for any child up to preschool aged. My kids have a blast playing with them! My only warning is that they are hollow and the plastic is thin, so make sure they don't squeeze them and it will be fine :)

My son absolutely loves this book and playset! He takes the cars everywhere with him!  My only wish is that they made the mat out of something a little more durable like a thick vinyl, the paper tears easily with heavy use. My little ones also have two other sets, Toy Story, and Thomas, the pieces have held up nicely for two years so far, so they are good quality!

I got the wood handled set of brushes simply for the lack of stores in my area that sell makeup brushes. I absolutely adore them. They feel like decent quality brushes in your hand, and are very minimal in respect to shedding. They also come in a pouch which is nice for storing!

I feel like this case is as sturdy as an otter box just much cuter and a lot cheaper. I've had it for several weeks now and so far am very pleased with it. I will say like other reviewers that the color isn't as vibrant a blue as shown but truthfully, I like the color it ACTUALLY is better. Its more of a silvery blue, and is really gorgeous!

I got this to use in my HP dv6 after the WiFi card suddenly just went bad. Installing was simple, and honestly I feel like it may even be faster than the on board was. As of right now, I'm impressed with the ease of use and its performance at the price point. If any issues arise in the near future I will be sure to update. In the meantime I highly recommend!
I feel like the print could be a smidge lower, but that aside its a good shirt. Nice color too.
Excellent shirt for any one who wants to wear their beliefs with pride. Nice quality and wear it all the time.

The blanket is really soft, and the print is adorable. I saw that it matched a sheet set I had for my sons bed and thought it would be nice to have a back up or be able to coordinate. I checked the measurements given on the description to his other fleece blanket and they were the same. The fleece blanket that he uses nightly is big enough to cover his bed like a comforter (my kids dont like the feel of those, so I buy HUGE fleece ones to use in place of them), this one is a good deal smaller and literally only covers the top of his bed. Regardless, he likes it, but he usually wants his "big" Thomas blanket on his bed instead.

These are my absolute favorite earrings. I just love them. I tend to be pretty sensitive to most metals, and these don't irritate my ears or turn them green. They can pretty much go with any outfit or occasion, I love the flexibility they have so they get LOTS of wear and have held up nicely with no tarnishing.
I got this set for my Thomas loving sons bed. It's not as soft as I'd like which is why I gave it four stars. I'm hoping that after a few more washes it becomes less stiff.

My son  received this blanket set for his first Christmas, and in the several years since then it's withstood lots of washing, dragging, stuffing, chewing, etc. Finally we have arrived at the point where he is noticing holes and isn't happy about it. I searched on here for the set, and got lucky to find that its available. I totally recommend this set because the blanket is so durable to have made it this long!

I've had such a hard time finding CUTE sandals that come in a Narrow. But not only are they cute, they are SOOOO comfortable! They seem to run to true to size as well. I will def be checking out Clarks in the future.

These shoes are pretty comfortable but do seem to run somewhat big. I also noticed that I need to wear thicker socks with them BC there is an awkward rubbing on the top of my feet when walking if I wear my usual athletic socks with the mesh top. That aside for the price not bad!

Cute cover, seems like it will last. My only real issue is that it seems to be a bit small for a checkbook and register so the sides aren't flush when its closed leaving the "feathered" end of the checks somewhat exposed.  Annoying, but not a deal breaker.

These are kind of a pain to put on. I went through  all three protectors before I got it right and still have air pockets that won't come out. I had Zagg before and it was flawless till it got all dinged up. However... this works and I can deal sine they were cheap!

My son loves his mobigo. Its his first "computer" as he calls it and he is learning how to work it fairly quick. I really love that it works for such a broad range of age groups so it will be appropriate for years! And I was worried about battery life but I have to say it does pretty well!

It holds the mobigo2 excellently and can store numerous games. I do however wish that there was space fr the optional accessories like the wall cord, or the rechargeable battery station for when we travel. I like having everything all in one place, and this makes it impossible BC of its size.

This is such a cute little house. It was primarily intended for our daughter but all three of our kids enjoy it. My only complaint really is the assembly factor. For the size of the box FP uses you'd think they could twist in the last screws so its ready for play out of the box.

Since sizing info is vague, I will be specific. My husband is 6'4 and wears 3634 pant on average. They fit him pretty well in an XLT. not to loose, not to tight and they are perfect in regard to length. He isn't walking on them but nor do they resemble high waters.

I got this for my step dad as he is protective of his tools and my brothers tend to not put them back and lose them. Its to the point he locks them up (the tools, not my brothers, although on occasion they may be considered as such).

We actually have Maytag and ordered this because it looked identical to the one that was in our dryer. The little felt guard on ours was falling out and it wasn't doing a very good job of holding the lint from falling down into the dryer wall. This is a perfect fit and looks like it will actually last as the felt bumper dealy is slightly different and seems muchmore secure!

I have obviously been trying to find relief for my feet. I stumbled upon these at the store trying to locate the Dr. Scholls machine and figured "Why not get both, these are cheap." I must say I was hesitant because I have longer feet at a size 12-ish and wish I had listened to that initial instinct to pass them by bc they are one-size. Most certainly not the case! While the heel cup is fine, the arch support just falls short of where it should be. Obviously, someone in a 6-7-8 or even 9 will have an arch that falls into a place slightly different than each other, but especially from those in a 10 and up. I must say, the advice on the insert was VERY helpful though, and has made a huge difference in the level of pain. My only other complaint is they seem to raise you up a good bit in the shoe when place in over top of the factory insole that comes inside the shoe. I felt like I was walking in a low heel. Kind of awkward feeling. I may try the Men's insert if I find myself on the market again soon. I do suggest trying the Dr. Scholls custom fitting thing. That insert feels about spot on size wise, but still a bit high heel-ish as well. And if anything you can learn a little info on your feet, which is helpful when trying to find good shoes. Which ultimately is what we all need with plantar fascia issues. A good, well fitted shoe can go a long way when your feet are literally screaming with each step!

I wanted so much to LOVE this shoe. But I just could not. I have been searching for my "sole-mate" shoe for working out in and this one certainly is not it. I am an underpronator with low arches, and because of this I could FEEL the "roll bar" on both shoes and just couldn't stand it. If you have med to high arches this shoe would probably be fine for you. I just couldn't handle the feeling of the "bar" just between my heel and arch. It does however do as it is intended and is an excellent stability shoe. True to size (if you know your actual size).

I recently mosied into a locally owned shoe store that specializes in custom fitting because I do HIIT training and workout daily and just couldn't find a shoe that didn't hurt my feet in some way, shape, or form. The very first pair the owner suggested was these when I explained my predicament and new-ish foot pain. He measured my feet and low and behold... I was wearing the wrong size shoes. Turns out I need a size SKI aka 12 2A. I took these guys home and immediately put them to use (Indoors only of course). My arch pain was almost immediately gone! However, they stunk for my workouts because they are just a bit to deep in the toe box for me and the ball of my foot moved within the shoe when pivoting and twisting and I personally didn't care for that. But as a runner (what they are built for) and for walking they are amazing and SUPER cushy. If I had not needed a shoe for working out (haahaa except now I need shoes for everything since ALL my shoes are at LEAST two sizes to small :P) I would have kept them. I do have SKINNY feet according to my shoe guy, so the problem I had with depth may not be an issue for you. So they are at the very least worth a definite shot if you have arch/heel pain related to plantar fasciitis!

The camera itself is sturdy, but the quality of photos is not that great. I had hoped for something a little better. I understand its a kids toy, but for the price point it should be better. For what it costs we could have gotten a cheap real camera and gotten sharper photos....

My son is a huge Thomas fan and he really loves this game. Love having Thomas with a bit of an educational twist! Highly recommend for any child who has a mobile and loves Thomas and crew, it will be a hit!
Its a very pretty ring but seems to run a bit small. I ended up returning it ultimately BC of that.

I am really picky with my scents, but fell in love with this, and at the price point, its even better. I can't really describe the scent, but it its in the same field as the Sarah Jessica Parker line and some of the Britney Spears scents. I recommend if you like those! And you aren't losing out on much pricewise if you don't like it!

This kit makes application a snap! I am not a steady handed person and have failed epically at past attempts to put lashes on.  This kit makes it a breeze, and i can finally do it!!!  And the lashes don't look fake at all, which is a nice bonus if you just want to make your own look a bit fuller and longer.

I got these because my natural nails just aren't smooth enough or long enough to look good painted. I do my own acrylics but its a long tedious process and I wanted something I could do quickly. The reviewers saying they are not strong are probably putting the nail on backwards. I did this on both thumbs and did not realize it immediately. An easy mistake to make, but now I know better. They are very sturdy and I have had them on for three days with no sign of loosing or coming. I have three kids so they see their fair share of abuse. Just make sure you put enough glue on and press down on the whole nail and you should be all set!

The gloves are good but are not for children. I can easily fit them on my hand. I will keep them as emergency back up gloves given they were so cheap. But will have to find a different pair for my son. They really need to correct the item description.

This is a cute tool kit, but I concur with other reviews about the "screwdriver" sucking. Make sure you invest in a decent set of those if you buy this kit. There is no non-electric one in this, which is unfortunate because the screwdrivers are pretty essential and turning the giant thing is very awkward. Also it should be noted for things that have screws down in a deep hole (i.e. vacuums, carpet cleaners, some childrens toys) this one wouldn't work because the part you put the desired screw tip into is too short or too fat. I have used all the other tools in the kit a good bit though. they need to re-release this with normal screw drivers and it would be a HUGE success.

I really love these heavy duty, extra long nitrile exam gloves.  I like the powder free type as I never cared for the residue left by the powdered ones.  These slip on and off easily anyway so I see no need for the powder.  I ordered medium and they fit my 7-7 1/2 hand well, snug, but not too tight.The 12 inch length is so nice for working in damp locations, for cleaning, or if reaching into areas.  If working in fluids, I don't have to be as careful not to flood my glove accidentally.These are ruggedly made at 8 mil thickness and hold up to a lot of abuse.  They are exam gloves however, and while they are a quality biological barrier, are not meant for prolonged use in harsh chemicals as industrial grade gloves are. Yes, there are only half as many as the lighter gloves but you can feel the greater quality and protection.  Order what you need for the job you expect to be doing.  I like having a choice.

I ordered these Xtreme Nitrile gloves in large and I'm happy with the fit.  I could wear a medium if I wanted them tighter but this size allows a less confining fit and I don't feel that they are stretched excessively so that they tear as easily.  My hand fits about a 7-7 1/2 surgical glove.I like these a lot.  They are quite durable for the cleaning, gardening, and shop tasks I need them for and I'm pleased with the wear-time I get before needing to replace them.  My hands are happy with the protection they provide from germs, dirt, and chemicals.I've had no negative reaction to these and will update my review if I have more to add.

These are nice nitrile gloves for use around the house, in the garage, and garden.  I wear them either alone or under my cotton gloves when transplanting things in my pots or planters.  I also use them for cleaning in the kitchen or bathrooms when using cleaning products that might damage my skin.  Even using them part of the time saves my hands from getting dry during the winter months.I ordered the extra large, thinking my husband might also use them, and am surprised that I can wear them pretty comfortably.  Unless you really want a tight fit, I suggest you order at least one size up.I'd rate these at medium durability.  They tear pretty easily without much abuse but are great for a lot of cleaning jobs.

I had tried and enjoyed the FSTG black bean multigrain and sweet potato chips in recent months so thought I'd give these a try.  None of these chips are as greasy, salty, or heavy as regular potato, Dorito, or Sunchips and have more redeeming ingredients than the aforementioned too.  Along with this, they are all natural and cholesterol, trans fat, GMO, gluten, and preservative free.  When I eat these, I feel like I'm putting a better quality food in my body and I think these taste good too.  I'm glad that I do because I ordered a case!These are very crunchy chips, which I like, and so far I haven't had any more breakage in the bags I've eaten than I would in a bag I picked up at the store, if I could find these locally.  These aren't heavily seasoned chips and most of the taste I noticed came from the sesame and other seeds and the sea salt as the pinto beans just don't have a lot of flavor themselves.  They are very satisfying to me by themselves but they work well with guacamole or salsa too.  The 5.5 ounce bag is about 5 servings so the 12 bag case shouldn't last longer than the expiration date at my house, especially with the holidays coming.I didn't detect a burnt taste in these like some reviewers mentioned, however, I did get that a little in the sweet potato chips when I first ate them.As with any food, the enjoyment or lack of it is completely subjective.  I'd try a bag of these if you can find them locally before I'd order a case as I did.I like them a lot and give them 4 and a half stars.  Good job, Pete!

I love having a kitchen tool that can do double (or triple) duty as this one does.  It works as a stirrer and a scraper, being flexible enough to get into tight corners, and yet is sturdy enough to stir relatively thick sauces and lighter batters, and you can serve with it too!  It fell only slightly short for me at scraping can corners as well as my trusty small spatula, but beyond that small shortfall,  I'm very happy with it's performance.  It is a handy length and size for me, feels good in my hand, and is a pretty too!.I see myself grabbing it most often for stirring soups and sauces while they cook, scraping the bottom of the pan with the straight edge of the spoon.  Whisks often allow things to catch and wooden spoons do as well, besides requiring hand washing.  You can pop this in the dishwasher if you can manage without it for that long.  You may want to order two!I love the red color as it hasn't shown any stains, is bright and fun to use, and is pretty enough to serve with.  I'm happy I found this new spoonula and look forward to many years of cooking with it.  I feel that it's reasonably priced for the quality too.  I will definitely look at more of the StarPack line when I need any more kitchen tools.

Like so many now days, we have a number of televisions around our home.  Most are Sony, the largest being a 5 year old Bravia, which has worked very well and has a wonderful picture.  I'm comparing this Hisense to our Sony.Besides it's great picture, the most impressive functions of the Hisense are it's "smart" capabilities.  The menu is user friendly, the 19 preloaded apps are easily accessed, and the ones I've used so far worked as they should.  I really enjoy the media sharing capabilities and look forward to using it more to view and share pictures and videos over the holidays.  There are also USB and HDMI ports for connecting and sharing through other devices, as well as the standard component connections. Though I'm still investigating and learning the plethora of functions that this TV has I am impressed so far!The picture is brilliant and clear, as good or better than our Sony.  The blacks are black and the colors are vibrant.  Motion is well defined and  without shadowing or lag.  The screen area fills the full face with only the small black frame around it and the picture is well defined to the edges. The sound quality is quite good too, thankfully, as I don't have external speakers to hook up in it's location.We mounted our TV on a wall though it does come with two stands.  After it was mounted it was easy to set up and program the remote.  The included batteries were a pleasant surprise.  I'm glad that the manufacturer makes that little extra effort to avoid the buyer's frustration of not having any when they get to that point.A quick start guide and warranty information are included in the box.  There is a lot more info available on the web and a complete user manual  available on their website.  I had to enter 55H6B model to get the manual but it is the same, I believe.  Their FAQ page is very helpful as well.Considering we paid 3 or 4 times as much as the current cost of this Hisense for our comparably equipped Sony, I am very impressed with it.  I will update my review as time passes and we use it more.  If you would like to view a Hisense TV before you buy, I've seen them in department and home appliance stores locally where I live.  I'm pretty comfortable that you could find them as well in most locations.

I chose this pretty, unique ring because I liked that it was two-toned, yellow gold plated and silver, and it looked like it had a lot of sparkle, which it is and does.  I was a little concerned about the size of the stones and overall ring but was willing to take that chance to see it.  After having it for a few days and trying it on, I'm a little disappointed due to the way it looks and fits on my hand.First of all, it's a large ring so really needs a larger person and finger larger than mine to look it's best.  I'm not tiny or extremely petite but about average at 5' 5" and a size 12 in most clothes.  For me, if the stones were 50 to 70 percent of the size they are, it would fit my hand much better.  As it is, whether I wear it on my middle or ring finger, it looks and feels too broad.  The top is so wide that the sides of my fingers hit the stones which causes me to want to take it off very soon.  It feels like brass knuckles might feel, (though I've never owned any), and would undoubtedly make a pretty effective weapon in a pinch.The stones appear to be set well, are clear, and sparkle a lot.  The metals are smooth and shiny.  The size seems accurate.  I just need a smaller ring to fit my hand.  I give it three and a half stars, mostly due to personal preference than lack of quality.  If you are a larger person than I, it may be perfect.

I purchased these lovely, blue and white, Swarovski element earrings recently on a lightning deal and really couldn't be happier with them.  I love this color of blue CZs and have a few pieces in my jewelry collection.  These are the best of both worlds as they will coordinate with both clear and blue colors as I choose.They appear to be made well.  The hinged posts work smoothly and the click top backs fasten securely.  I still use a plastic ear nut over the post after passing it through my ear for extra security.  Too easily do these types of earrings accidentally come loose and fall out before you even realize it.  Just a suggestion from one that's lost a few. . .I like the "swirl pattern of these that is somewhat unique and different from a regular hoop.  The size is perfect for me, being large enough to be noticed yet lightweight and comfortable to wear all day.  You have the option to wear them either with the clear stone bottoms toward your neck or on the other side of the blue if you like just by reversing earrings.I've included some pictures to try to give another idea of their size.  They are marked inside the front of the earring, "PAJ 925 CHINA".

These are heavy, well-made dish cloths.  What that may mean to other shoppers obviously varies.These are for washing dishes, I think, though they are larger than most of my other dish washing cloths.  They are great for bar wiping and that sort of thing but almost too large, IMHO, for washing dishes in the sink.  I use them for both duties, and they work well for me, but many (like my 92 year old mother) would consider them too large and heavy for a dish washing cloth.They wash up well on regular cycle, dry in the dryer, and come out like new.  The only concern I have is using some cleaning products with bleach as the color will be affected.  They are too pretty to let that happen to!They are, indeed, 15 x 15 inches, are hemmed nicely, and I've had no issues or problems with them.  I give them 4 1/2 stars.

These Zak Designs sippy cups are wonderful for my 22 month old granddaughter.  She is becoming more independent daily and likes to do things for herself.  These colorful cups allow her that while keeping Grandma's house safe from most spills, keeping everyone happier!  She likes to name all the different animals, letters, and numbers.She has been using different brands of "sippy cups" for quite a few months now but hasn't had any like these.  It took her a few, somewhat frustrating, tries before she was successful at getting a satisfactory drink out of the cup, but then it was easy.  I began at a medium setting but moved it up quickly.  We weren't running around the house with it though so it wasn't too risky for spills.  The glasses contain most leaks or spills unless they're dropped hard or shaken upside down.  Then, it's just drips and sprinkles.Being double walled is nice for keeping drinks cold longer so that they are safe and refreshing.  These 8.7 oz. glasses are a handy size both for little hands to hold, to fit in a drink holder in your bag, and for capacity, and they are BPA freee, of course!We're all happy at Grandma's house!  I don't think the cost is out of line if they work.

Having had the matching earrings for almost four months now, I recently picked up this necklace on a lightning deal and absolutely love the set!  I've included a picture to show them together.  It doesn't do them justice, as they shine and sparkle amazingly, but it's really difficult to get a photo that shows that without so much glare that you can't see the pieces.To me, it looks like all the stones are the same size, about 5/16 inch or 7.5 mm.  I think the pendant appears a bit larger but don't believe it actually is. . . could be the extending bale that makes it appear larger.  I've had 3 carat cubic zirconia earrings in a different "square" cut that were so large that I sent them back.  The Asscher cut is a "thicker" stone so it doesn't appear as large.  It gives great depth and sparkle to the stones though and I love the shape as well.  The platinum plated setting is extra shiny and elegant looking.The included chain is dainty and 18 inches long with two round links to wear it at 16 and 17 inches if desired.  Mine arrived slightly tangled but they were carefully and easily removed.  It fastens with a spring-ring clasp.I have quite a few pieces of cubic zirconia jewelry and have never had any of them dull or loose their shine.  Some of the cheaper plated settings may change but the stones remain shiny and clear. I take care of them and clean them carefully per instructions.  My Swarovski Zirconias are even more consistently manufactured, cut, and beautiful!I trust that I will enjoy wearing this set for many, many years.  Recommend!

These Flax heavy-duty industrial disposable towels are thicker than most, are a very handy size, and are sturdy and absorbent. The ones I have measured even a bit larger than the stated 9" x 16.5". My experience has been that they hold up well to wiping and scrubbing so outlast regular paper towels by many, many times.  Though they seem pricey, in a shop or industrial setting, the cost could be comparable to the expense of laundering along with the increased cost of cloth towels.  Being the chief laundry officer, I definitely prefer these in our own farm shop as well as for some cleaning jobs around the house.I was pleasantly surprised at the generous size and durability of these towels.  The fact that they are made with a sustainable resource certainly adds to their appeal.Noted from their packing material; these towels are also available in light and medium duty as well as in large rolls.Four and a half stars with a half star off for the cost, though I'm still evaluating them.  I really like them a lot!  Now, if I can just get my hubby to use them instead of his jeans!

This is a wonderful sunless self-tanning gel that doesn't have the yucky scent that the less expensive ones do.  Xen-Tan's light cucumber melon scented gel is pleasant and leaves a medium to medium dark tan depending on your skin tone and how long you leave it on.The first time I tried it I applied it with a plastic-gloved hand and the separately available mitt on the larger, smoother areas of my body (legs, arms, chest).  I just used the gloved hand for my face and it turned out nice and even thanks to the tinted color of the gel.  I left it on for about 3 hours as I wanted to see how dark I would get in this time.  After showering, I had a nice, even color that looked like I'd laid out, without the dkin cancer risk or the red burn!  It was a bit sticky for awhile after applying, about 45 minutes before I felt comfortable putting on loose fitting clothes but it was worth it.  It was hard to wait the rest of the time to see the results but it is the price you must pay, unfortunately, and it is a lot less annoying than the self-tanners with the weird odor.My husband was surprised to see a suntanned me when he got home from work and thought I'd been outside all afternoon. Thank you Xen-Tan!With Fall here and Winter on the way, it's nice to know I don't have to be pasty white, go on vacation, or wait until Spring to have a natural looking tan.  This is a bit pricey but not if compared to the cost of a spray tan and you can get at least 3 or 4 body tans from one tube, and more if you don't do your whole body. This is depending on your size, of course.I had a nice, natural color for the week with daily showers.  I didn't have stained clothing or bedding.  Love it!

This just arrived today and it already has me dreaming of the holidays!  The beautiful cardinal sitting in pine needles, holly, and ivy with a red ribbon is so fitting of Christmas and the season.  Lenox quality is evident in the colors and design and will coordinate with many of my other holiday pieces.  I could find no flaws in the crock or design.  It looks just like it does in the picture.The slots in the spoon were pretty rough cut and should have been made better.  The rest of that spoon and other tools are smooth and well made.If I don't sit this on my kitchen counter I may use the crock to make a centerpiece or floral arrangement.  It's so pretty that I want to show it off!If you have someone on your gift list that loves Cardinals or Christmas decor this would make a nice gift.  It certainly makes me happy!

This is a nice set of tongue and groove pliers that will meet and exceed the needs of the average homeowner and is a welcome addition to our arsenal of shop tools.  Each pliers has 6 different jaw settings to grip many sizes of nuts, bolts, or materials you are working with.  They appear to be made well, "from the finest quality tool steel, forged, hardened and tempered for long life," ,though are not the smoothest looking pliers you can find. They aren't the most expensive either, but are very good quality for the cost.  Function is more important in my book.They are a bit stiff operating now but I assume will loosen and become more smooth with use.  The cushioned grips seem tight and do the job of making the pliers easier to hold tightly during use.The package was a pain to open.  It kept the tools dry and secure though, until after purchase.  I give this pliers set 4 and a half stars.

This is very nice, effective self tanning gel.  It goes on easily and evenly and gives an instant color that gradually darkens over the course of a few hours.  One of my favorite qualities is the lack of the "odor" that many self tanners have as they work.  This has a nice scent that I would describe as a mild coconut, which I found pleasant while not being very noticeable or overpowering.I find this "Moroccan Tan" to be just a little dark for me.  Even though I applied it quite sparingly, I feel it looks too dark, too brown, to be realistic on me.  I have a medium to light complexion and don't think I've ever looked like this with a natural tan, even before sunscreens were recommended.  I suggest trying the lighter XEN-TAN product initially for those with similar natural coloring, unless you really want to look like you're using fake tanner.  It IS NOT orangey, just too brown for me.I used thin gloves to apply this and had no problems either with application or stained hands.  I suggest to go easy with it on your first application as it blends more easily, it dries faster, and you can always add more.  It just doesn't take that much to achieve a decent color.I showered after about three hours and it's worn well.  It's lasted me most of a week with daily showers and hasn't looked blotchy or uneven.  I probably shouldn't subtract a star for the color as it is mostly personal need and preference.  I'd say four and a half stars just because of that, not the product quality.Be sure to exfoliate well before using and the mitt is very helpful if you get it.  It's pricey but cheaper than a salon spray tan and should last at least a few applications.

This is a wonderful room heater for a nursery or other medium sized space but for a couple of small issues.  I love the remote crib sensor, the numerous safety features, the hidden power cord storage, and it's relatively quiet and efficient heating.The first issue I had was when I tried to use it.  It wouldn't start.  After a bit of deducing, I realized that it would not run on our short, plush carpet as the safety "tip-over" button on the bottom was not depressed enough.  I have another Vornado room heater that I use in the same spot very frequently which has never had this problem so it puzzled me.  I resolved it by placing the Vornadobaby heater on a magazine and it started right away.  Yes, I realize you shouldn't have an electric heater sitting on paper or anything easily burnable but, that said, this unit not operating on short carpet is a problem!  I'm including a picture comparing the buttons on both heaters to show the design difference.  It is easily resolved if you know about it or non existent if you have hard floors.The second issue that is the cycling noise it makes turning on and off to control the room temperature.  It isn't extremely loud, really is unavoidable, but is noticeable.  My concern is that it may wake a baby or whomever may be sleeping in the room.  Beyond this small concern, the heater does a wonderful job at maintaining the temperature of the room.The remote is easy to link up and operate.  I had it set near my chair and the heater turned off and on, rather frequently, to keep fluctuations to a minimum.  I didn't have any problems with it overheating or tripping breakers and our desktop computer and a small light are on the same circuit.  It is a 1200 watt heater, drawing up to 10 amps of current.Included in the box is an informative manual with helpful drawings of how to safely use and clean your Vornadobaby heater.  There is a 5 year "Happy Parent Guarantee" of customer satisfaction, a toll free number, a website, and a support email address.I like this heater a lot and recommend it with acknowledgement of the two mentioned concerns.  Four and a half stars.Edit- I have been using this almost daily, sometimes with the remote thermostat, sometimes not.  It seems to be a more effective heater than the other, standard room heater I've pictured with it, as it either has a larger fan or somehow throws more heat.  It has functioned without a problem so far, but for the safety button aforementioned.  Love it!

I've had a different brand of drying mat for over 4 years that's a waffle weave beige color microfiber but I like the decorative look of this one.  It's nice that there are different colors to coordinate with your kitchen better, or just to make the task of washing dishes a bit more enjoyable.  Though I have a dish washer for most of our dishes I often wash my pots and pans by hand as well as some things that aren't dishwasher recommended.This is a decent size mat for smaller drying needs.  It's soft and pretty and folds neatly to store when not in use.  The plastic snaps are a great idea to keep it folded for storage. There is a decorative kitchen pattern on one side and a solid color on the other.  More about that later.This Now Designs drying mat soaks up water fast and dries pretty quickly too if you allow air to circulate around it.  I washed it in warm water before using it the first time and there was no fading or shrinkage.
