All the stitching remained intact.I'm happy with this mat but wish that they made it with sports motif patterns so that, possibly, I'd get help washing dishes.

When my True Glow Sonic Pedicure Kit arrived I plugged it in to charge as advised.  The instructions were for a 16 hour charge but the little light was glowing green within 6 so it must have been partially charged at the factory.  I don't have a lot of areas on my feet that are calloused or overly dry as I try to take care of them.  There are a couple of problem areas, however, and I went to work with this on them once it was ready.  I snapped in the coarse softener and started out on high setting.  I was pretty underwhelmed with the results.  I continued for about a minute longer on that area and, still seeing little change, I then hit my heel, where it appeared to have more of an effect.  My overall reaction was to be less than impressed.To earn space on my bathroom counter and a plug, a device needs to be indispensable, which this is not.  I have an epilator set that includes a rotating stone callous head that is much more quickly effective than this tool that's designed specifically for foot care.  This Conair Pedicure Kit is gentler, and with continued use will eventually do the job, but with much more time and effort on my part.  The brush feels nice and cleans my feet but, again, isn't so wonderful that I feel I need this appliance.I love my sonic toothbrush but this pedicure kit, not so much.

I just received this Ravenna patio furniture cover and put it on our table and chair set.  It fits well and covers all pieces nicely.  I love the corner hold down straps and the elastic bungeee cord on both ends that tighten to fit the cover to our set.  It was a little breezy when I put it on and it held securely once I fastened everything down.  The test will be when we get heavier winds throughout the fall and winter months.  Hopefully, the baffles will release enough air to not take it all airborne, as the wind has pushed the rather heavy chairs around in the past.This is a very nice looking, large cover that has good provisions for fitting and holding onto various sized table and chair sets. It is has a 4 year limited warranty against defects in materials and construction.  I like it a lot but will reserve one star until I see how it performs.  I'll update my review after some months have passed.11-15  We've had some 40 mph winds over the last month and my patio set has moved across the deck but the cover remains in place.  Rain pools in the center, as would be expected, but it drains over the course of 24 hours or so, if not dumped manually.  I'm expecting good things by my recent experiences but my rating would only go up at this point.

This 100% cotton oven mitt and pocket-potholder set is pretty and bright.  It washes well per directions, without fading, and offers good protection for standard cooking tasks.  Instructions are to wash before use.  The material thickens and fluffs up after washing and drying.  It also seemed to shrink a bit but it does stretch out again with use.  They are made well and I'd say the mitt fits most women's hands and small to medium men's hands.  It is long enough to protect over half of my forearm as well, which is nice.  The mitt is usable on either hand as it's padded the same on both sides.  The potholder is padded more heavily on the large side but the outer pocket has one layer of padded cloth on it too.Being all cotton, you do need to be aware that it will scorch or burn if close to flames or excessive and consistent high heat.  Silicone or Kevlar are better selections for high heat or grilling types of uses but they require some sort of additional padding inside to protect your skin too.  I've done some research on oven mitts recently while looking for a gift for my son and found that you will pay much more for high heat protective oven/grill mitts, but that's worth the investment for safety in those applications.  These work well for standard, around the kitchen type use, and there are many color selections to coordinate with your decor!They are made in India.

Oh, wow!  These chips are addictive!  I love the black bean and sesame flavors, the little bit of salt, and the amazing crunch!The chips are a generous size and arrived in better shape than many of the other types of chips I get at the local store. They are all natural, cholesterol, gluten, and trans fat free, and made without MSG or artificial flavors, colors, or preservatives.  With 10 chips as a serving size, you'd think that you wouldn't be satisfied but, surprisingly, they are quite filling and I was!I love the flavor enough to be happy eating them by themselves but suggested dips are hummus, white bean, and spinach artichoke, which all sound pretty yummy.  I think they'd be great with guacamole too.  Substituting these for a corn chip or other, less healthful-type chips would be a plus at any snack or mealtime.  The 4 grams of fiber and protein per serving are unexpected and welcome additions to your diet compared to most popular chips.  But, that all means nothing if they don't taste good, and I really do love these!

This is a heavy duty and really useful convertible hand truck/utility cart.  We've owned it for a couple of months now and it's saved our backs, time, and strength numerous times.  We're doing some construction on our property so it was a practical purchase for us at this time but I anticipate it's usefulness and durability for the next few decades, at least.It is easily convertible from the hand truck to the cart and the smooth flatbed helps move loads securely as well as more conveniently.  The tires move over even uneven ground quite well.  I did not experience the extreme odor that many have mentioned, even when it was new.  After 2 months, I went to check on it in our garage again just to verify this and I could only smell the tires if I put my nose within a foot of them, and I am usually quite sensitive to odors.  Maybe ours was older stock but I never felt that the smell was unusual or off-putting.  I love the cart and highly recommend it if you're considering purchasing one.11-21-15 - We have used this numerous times since I wrote the initial review.  I'd guess we use it as a cart the most to move heavier things over distances that would be a strain to carry.  I've moved large trash cans in the shop, odd sized packages, and just the other day, my husband moved the metal guards from our combine for cleaning.  It's saved our backs over and over again.  Love it!

I purchased two pair of these as potential gifts as the price had been greatly discounted.  I've bought Myia Passiello jewelry in the past and have been very pleased with the quality.  These do not disappoint.They came individually wrapped in tissue paper, inside a small plastic bag, inside of the attractive and padded presentation box.  The stones are clear and sparkly and the gold plated metal is sturdy and lovely.  All of the four earrings were intact and lovely and I'm thrilled with them!  I hope the recipient will be as well.  They are a nice sized stone that looks believably like it could be a diamond, in my opinion.I would rate them 5 stars but will not until I know how they wear and their durability.  I have no qualms about recommending them though, as Myia Passiello jewelry has been a reliable purchase in the past.

This is a really lovely pendant.  I have the set and received the earrings first, before the pendant, and since receiving it, I truly love them more.The design is rich-looking and it is well made.  The 18 inch chain is dainty, yet strong enough to hold this good-sized pendant.  It's not really heavy, or too large.  I have heavier murano glass pendants that are just slightly larger so this is a comfortable pendant to wear.  It was easy to put on as well, unlike some tiny spring-ring clasps.  I wish that they would use a lobster claw clasp though, especially at this price point.  They are much easier to work with especially if you don't have someone handy to help.I'm including some pictures so you can see the set together.  The teardrops are all the same size.  At first I thought the earrings were slightly smaller but they are the same. The pendant just has an extra drop link.This looks great with a red and black print outfit that I have.  It sets it off perfectly!

This is a very good multi-size pencil sharpener for a classroom or home.  It's fast, relatively quiet, and stops when the pencil is sharp so you don't waste your pencils.  The shaving tray is large and empties easily and there are suction cups to hold it to a flat surface so that it doesn't walk away while sharpening.  It even has a soft, blue lighted rim around the pencil size selector that glows to indicate when your pencil is sharpened and, it also looks pretty cool.Fifty dollars seems a bit steep for an electric pencil sharpener but most of them don't accommodate six different sizes of pencils.  If you don't need this capability, or ever think you will, then you'll probably be happier with one that costs less. This will do the job it's designed for efficiently and quickly if you do.  It's "tool-free removable cutter cartridge" makes it easy to clean or replace, if needed, prolonging the life of the unit.I haven't used it on all the sizes of pencils yet but I am impressed with this sharpener as many times as I've used it.  I  will continue using it and update if I have comments or concerns as time passes.

These pretty earrings are colorful and well-done with beautiful antique silver and Marcasite detailing.  They are larger than most earrings I normally wear but are lightweight for their size and still not too big.  I don't wear them every day but enjoy them whenever I do wear them.  I also have the matching necklace to complete the set and it looks lovely all together.I've included a few pictures to better show the size and appearance when wearing.  The teardrops are the same size in both the earrings and matching pendant.

With all the good reviews, I was expecting this roll-on oil to at least have a discernible scent.  When it arrived, it was packaged well and had plastic tape around the cap so it didn't leak.  After I opened it, however, the oil leaked out the cap badly so it was not transportable in a purse or suitcase, if that is what you'd planned.  The scent was weak even before applying it and after 10-15 minutes, indiscernible on my forearm. I applied more but it just didn't last.  So, I pried off the roll top and added a few drops of my own essential oils so it's not a complete waste.Basically, I have a $10, ten milliliter bottle of fractionated coconut oil.  All this purchase did was cause me more anxiety.I do not recommend this product!
Very pretty and unique beads.  I've used them in earrings with antique silver and blue faceted crystal and I love them!  Still working on coordinating pieces but these do not disappoint!

My husband has had two pair of these shoes in the past three years and wears them once or twice a week to work, where he has a desk job.  He likes the fit and look of the shoe and it fits in with the dressy-casual expectation of his office.  I expected the Cole Haan product quality would be better than other, lesser priced, retail shoes that are available, which would justify the cost.  This has not been the case, however, and it took two pair to teach us this lesson.The problem is that the sole has worn through on both pair quite quickly, much faster than any other shoes that he owns, and he owns a lot of shoes.  If you look up on Cole Haan's website, they do offer a repair service, but it costs almost as much, or as much, as a new pair of shoes.  Tack on shipping and you'll be paying more.I am highly disappointed in these shoes and will not be purchasing any more shoes from Cole Haan.

Simple Oatmeal chocolate chip bars are pretty tasty.  The chocolate is very evident in the bar that is soft, chewy, and quite satisfying.  With 10 grams of protein per bar and gluten-free rolled oats, they have staying power to help you feel fuller for a longer time than many bars with less protein.I try to keep one in my purse to snack on if I'm out and unable to stop for lunch.  It keeps me from grabbing junk food or being famished by the time I do eat, causing me to overeat or make poor choices.  They are nice and handy to have between meals as well rather than donuts or candy bars.  Of course, fruit is always a good between meal snack too, but when you're craving chocolate, these are a reasonable and satisfying choice.With 8 grams of fat, (4 of these saturated), 10 grams of sugar, and only 1 gram of fiber, these can hardly be called health food, but with 180 calories per bar, they aren't a bad choice either.  Plus, they taste quite good!The only small issue I notice is that the texture is a little grainy, from the soy, I imagine.  It's not a deal breaker for me but I do notice it.  I still recommend them, at least to try.  Not bad for a gluten-free product and quite good overall!The boxes I received had an expiration date of July 2016, a year from my ordering.

This is my first George Foreman grill.  I've always thought that they would be a good appliance to own but just never purchased one.  I sort of figured that it would be another appliance to take up counter and/or storage space in my kitchen and wouldn't be worth it. I can say now that I've owned it for a few weeks, that I was wrong.  I love this thing!It heats up quite quickly and saves a lot of time cooking as well. The grill plate is large enough to hold 4 third pound burger patties, six slightly flattened boneless chicken breasts, or four breasts cut into tenders.  You need no extra fat or grease when cooking and the meats come out looking nice and brown with grill marks.  Fats and extra liquids drain into the included pan and there is little or no splattering as when you fry things in a skillet.  It cooks quickly and the meats retain moisture too.  It has earned it's spot on my counter top and I don't bother putting it away as I'm using so often.It's been easy to clean up too.  I leave it open to cool once the meat is done and it cools in 10 minutes or less. You push a button on the side of either the top or bottom to release the plate and I rinse them off before putting in the dishwasher or soak them a little while and wash them by hand.  Either way, they have been easy to clean.  They are very non-stick, which is nice when cooking as well.The cord is a minimally useful length but I've not had trouble with it.  I have a lot of convenient outlets in my kitchen, however, and can see how it could make it difficult if a kitchen didn't.  The slide temp control has been easy for me to use.  Most things I'm grilling I want on medium to high anyway and it's easy to slide up or down as needed.I've learned that the best thing to do is to have your meats seasoned and ready to go before you place them on the grill as, once you open it, you'll want to place the meat and close it as quickly as possible to retain the heat.  When I was cooking the tenders it took me quite a while to place them all on the grill and I did lose more heat than I wished.  It heats back up quite quickly but a little of the sear was initially lost from the top.  I was still happy with the results but I'm learning these things as I go.I'm excited to keep trying new things with this grill.  I highly recommend it!

The Sony SRSX11 Bluetooth Speaker is a sweet little package of great sound!  It has the looks and quality build that you expect from Sony as well as strong, true, room-filling sound, all in such a cute, compact, ultra-portable 2 1/2 inch cube. It has a neat wrist strap, and, it comes in cool colors!I charged it per directions without problems.  It linked up seamlessly with my Android phone and began playing my music.  The sound quality was well balanced and I was surprised at the loudness capable from such a small speaker.  I'd love to hear the sound two of these paired would provide.  I'm a bass lover from way back and I felt that it was adequate and true. I suppose if you need more, you'll have to modify the track before you add it to your library.For the current price of this little gem, I feel it is fair and possibly the best in it's price range.  I'd imagine it may be a hot item around the holidays and possibly go on sale if you watch.  It would thrill many music lovers to find it in their stocking or gift bag.

I have a newer home with a central vac system that includes two "electric dustpans" that suck up residue that you sweep into it with your broom.  I have one in the kitchen and the other in the garage foyer/drop area.  I wish that I had one in the master bath as this area collects a lot of hair and dust and needs to be cleaned more often.  I love my central vac but it's a chore to pull out the vacuum head and it's long hose just to clean this area and a broom or dust mop doesn't get it as well.  Enter the "Swiffer Sweep and Vac", which works perfectly on this tile floor, is compact to store, and quick and easy to use.I've used it a few times now, after charging once, on that floor as well as the other hard surface floors in our home.  It's held it's charge and I've not had to recharge it yet!  The pad does get dirty but I run it over the carpet to dislodge the dust bunnies and then use the vac to clean afterwards.  This cleans the cloth somewhat and extends it's life.  When it gets completely soiled, I'll toss it and put in a new one.  The combination of the vac and dust pad is great at picking up dust, hair, and small debris quickly.It's very easy to empty the dust cup but the filter can be a pain.  You have to pick the dirt off and out of the many crevices if you really want it clean and the dust bunnies stick like lint on velcro!  There has to be an easier way.  I have used a cleaning toothbrush, which helps, so something like that would be nice to include with the kit.Other than that, I have only one major complaint.  The positioning of the on/off switch is aggravating!  I have inadvertently turned it off many times while vacuuming as it's placement is too close to where my hand holds the handle.  Maybe it's me, but I can't think that I am that unique.I like my new Swiffer Floor Vac a lot!  It has it's limitations but is certainly handy for quick clean ups between full blown vacuumings.  I hope it lasts and I will update with any issues.

I have been admiring these these and a few other pieces of Asscher cut jewelry for awhile now.  I finally ordered these and received them today.  They are lovely!They are a bit on the larger side though, for a somewhat believable stone.  The information was confusing about their carat weight.  The page heading said 2 cttw, implying 1 carat each, and the specifications below stated they were 6 cttw, or 3 carats each, which I would say is correct.  I've gotten 3 ct cubic zirconias before in a princess cut and these do not look as big.  I assume this is due to the Asscher cut being a deeper stone than a princess cut one.  They measure about 5/16 square, a bit bigger than the 1/4 inch another reviewer mentioned.  That all considered, they are a beautifully cut stone and have a great deal of sparkle, especially when light is directed at them.The post is just slightly offset on the backs so they will drop below my earlobe in one position.  I have short lobes though and everyone may not have this happen.  The other issue is that they are heavy and tend to fall forward.  I replaced the backs with a silver bullet clutch with pad and this holds them more upright and tightly and improves the positioning immensely.  I recommend this for anyone that purchases these and have used the padded bullet clutches with other "crown-type" set earrings.  You can find them here, on Amazon, or in most department stores for only a few dollars.These earrings appear to be sturdily made and the platinum plated sterling silver setting is super shiny and won't tarnish.. I like them a lot!  Four and a half stars with a half star off for the puny backs.Time to shop for some other Asscher cut pieces to go with these!10-27-15-  I added a couple pictures to compare to the size of a dime and with the backs I suggested.

Nature's Truth Eucalyptus essential oil is the first product I've had from this company so I decided to do a little research and visited their website. I found that their company has been in business for over 40 years and that their focus has been on high quality vitamins and supplements, until they recently expanded into a line of premium essential oils for aromatherapy. They state that they collect materials from around the world for their products and they are located in Ronkonkoma, NY..I've only begun to use essential oils in the past year so I have been reading lots of information about their production, product qualities, and uses. This oil is stated to be 100% pure and for external use only. It should be diluted prior to use on the skin, 5 drops oil to 10 ml base oil for massage. It has a wonderful aroma that clears my sinuses and invigorates me.I mixed it with lavender oil and a base oil to make an insect repellent that smells amazing to us but keeps the little pests at bay. Eucalyptus oil has so many wonderful uses as an antiseptic and respiratory aid as well!l am impressed with Natures Truth eucalyptus oil and look forward to trying some of their other oils when they are available. The company website states that they stand behind their products and guarantee customer satisfaction 100 percent. The information on the box states that it is gluten and paraben free.

Lee Women's Relaxed Fit Original All Day Pants are very comfortable and have classic style.  They fit at the waist and are a bit roomier through the thigh.  This is not the most flattering cut for me but may be for many women.  The material has a little stretch to it as well so they do remain comfortable all day, as the name states.They washed well and come out of the dryer wearable, though I would prefer to iron them for best looks.  The length was perfect for medium and the size possibly tending toward slightly small, though they do stretch out with movement.  I feel that they would be great casual to dressy casual pants depending on what you pair them with and ironing.If they had a little tummy control they would rate another star.

I have been using these 3M filters for 3-4 years now in our Lennox unit. They work well and last a long time. I usually change them around 6 months as we run our fan for circulation nearly 24/7. Our house is 5 years old so hasn't built up dust in the vents like an older home.

These are quite pretty, shiny,10k gold hoop earrings.  Mine are a generous 3/4 inch hoop and about 2mm wide (about 1/16 inch).  They are quite a narrow hoop, but they do make the most of their size with a lot of light-catching surfaces from the many diamond cuts.  They are very lightweight, so much so that you'll easily forget you're wearing them, but they appear to be made well and the post fastens firmly into the notch.  Because I've lost a few precious hoop earrings in the past, I still like to put a clear plastic ear back on behind the ear as extra security in case I accidentally catch one on something.The only reason I'm subtracting a half star is my personal preference for a more substantial gold hoop.  I find no fault with these earrings but can't say that I'd choose them over a wider surfaced one.  The diameter of these small hoops is fine at 3/4+ inch but I would like a more noticeable body, either in width or depth, something more visible.They were delivered in a bubble pack mailing bag with the cotton-padded cardboard presentation box taped shut. The earrings were in a plastic bag inside a little blue "velvet" pouch inside the taped box.  Even if they'd been smashed in transport, I think they would have come through okay, though it wasn't really an impressive box if giving as a gift.I could find no marks on these other than 10k stamp on the posts.If a delicate, lightweight, gold hoop with lots of sparkle is what you're looking for, I can recommend these.  Four and a half stars.

I purchased this for my 9 ear old granddaughter's 10 inch tablet for her birthday.  It was quickly shipped and arrived promptly, as expected.The artwork is bright and beautiful and the seams appear well done.  The softly padded case zips across the top where the handles meet.  There is plenty of room for her to put in her tablet comfortably with maybe 1/2 to an inch of space to spare around it.  The little pocket on the front is handy for ear-buds, a stylus, or her charger, though a bit shallow for anything too "fat".  She's attached the shoulder strap and carries it that way.  She loves it and I hope it will keep her tablet safe for a long time.It did have a rubbery scent on arrival but it wasn't horribly strong.  I believe it will air out over time.

I just received these today and I am so pleased with them!  I ordered the 18k gold plated, 2 cttw earrings and they truly do sparkle and shine!  At the current price of less than ten dollars, they have to be the steal of the day!  I would have been thrilled if I'd paid twice as much, and they've even gone down a bit since I ordered them.  The pictures don't do them justice.  The CZ stones are perfectly clear and the gold plating lovely.They are delicately made with the wire wrapping around the CZ stone to form the basket setting that holds it but seem solidly mounted just the same.  The posts are long enough and, though not the sturdiest I've ever had, seem strong enough if you use common care.  The 18k gold plating looks lovely.  I hope it lasts.Again, at under ten dollars, they are a steal!  They would make great little gifts that look like you paid much more!  They come in a lovely box as well, ready to wrap.I will update as to their longevity.  So far, I love them!

These 100% cotton dish towels by DII are attractive and decorative with extra attention given to cloth detail.  The design is quite elegant, the colors are rich, and they are finished nicely with a rolled hem.  The designs are all woven into the fabric rather than printed on so they will remain permanently.They come with "special care" instruction, however, which may make them impractical for daily use to many.  They are to be washed in cold water-gentle cycle, and may be tumble dried on low.  A low iron may be used as well, to remove the inevitable wrinkles of this type of cotton material.  I doubt many will take the time to use special care to clean their dish towels, and most would not care to iron them either.  I iron a lot, as my husband's work shirts usually require it and, as a rule, don't look for more things to iron.  I did iron these though, as I wanted to see how they responded after washing.  The few wrinkles remaining after drying came out well and the towels look beautiful, but they have shrunk to 26" z 17 1/2" even after ironing.  They certainly aren't the most absorbent towels you can find, either, but I would place at around average absorbency for this type of woven cotton fabric.  I hope the statement is true that they become more absorbent with additional washings.  The wrinkling often diminishes with more washings as well but time will tell.My determination is that these are lovely towels that you might likely use for special occasions or simply as decoration in your kitchen.  They are also absorbent but the special care instructions may discourage regular use.  They are currently reasonably priced at around four-plus dollars each so are quite affordable.I like them a lot, in spite of the extra-care effort required, and hope they hold up with continued use.

This Maidenform bra is very comfortable and attractive.  I love the black lace overlay over the beige cups.  The material for the back strap is soft and silky feeling and it gives a luxurious, sensual component to this supportive undergarment.  The only concern I have is that my ring nearly caught on the lace fabric when I was putting it on once and I was afraid I'd damaged it but, fortunately, I didn't.This washed well per directions and came out like new.  I will consider purchasing more of this bra when I need them.

This is a very comfortable bra, especially when wearing it with the straps straight.  It's almost feels like you don't have a bra on, which is also a problem in the support and discretion areas. With the straps crossed, it provides a little more support up front, but it is less comfortable and also causes back fat bulging.  What a choice to have to make!When I first put this bra on, I noticed that the sheer area caused yet another bulge where I didn't want it.  After washing and trying it again, it was less obvious but still is noticeable at times. A bra called, "One Smooth U" should be expected to give you a smooth look, but this falls short in that area as well as the more obvious one.  EVERYTHING shows!  Without adding petals or some kind of nipple covers, everyone will see you coming in all but the thickest of tops.This bra is made well, with three fastening hooks and three adjustments for fit.  I feel that it's generous in size for a 36.  The straps, though not padded, are very comfortable and the slides have stayed put for me so far.  It offers good overall coverage and the underwire comes up quite high on the sides which helps to hold you in, though it has poked me in certain positions.  I've never experienced that with my other underwired bras.To summarize, I love the comfort of this bra, even with the rare poke from the side underwire.  I need greater support, however, to feel that I look my best in public and in sheerer tops.  This is listed as "ultra light" so it gets a pass from me on that and delivers many great features in comfort and smoothing coverage when the straps are straight.  Just be aware that you'll need additional efforts to remain "discrete" unless you want that type of attention.

This Cuddlekins Red Eyed Tree Frog is even prettier and more colorful than the picture!  He is a perfect size for your child (or you) to hug and as soft as can be.  His legs are a little firmer because of the "beans" used to partially fill them and help him sit up, and there are a few more in his bottom as well. Otherwise, he's all huggable-cuddly soft.  He is about 12 inches long from nose to tail/bottom.I saw this little guy on sale and couldn't resist!  My boys (now grown) would have loved him so I'm sure the next generation will as well. He'll be at this Grandma's house waiting for someone to play with.If his picture strikes your fancy, you won't be disappointed if you order him.  I love the little, green guy!

My husband is quite happy with these shoes.  They fit well and were comfortable right out of the box.  So far, they are wearing well, although it's only been a week or so.I really like the look of them, casual yet with a bit of style.I will update if I have any problems.

These are large, bright-colored, all-cotton napkins that washed well and didn't shrink or fade for me in cold water.  They did require ironing to remove wrinkles, as expected with cotton fabrics.Although I don't often use cloth napkins, these will definitely brighten our table when we have guests or be used decoratively in bread baskets.I love the soft touch and rich colors in these so a bit of extra care is worth it!

I've been using microfiber cloths for cleaning for probably a decade now and love them for their special characteristics of absorbancy and being lint and streak free.  They work great for dusting and are easily cleaned in the washer, ready to go again.  I've never used them for drying dishes, however, or for regular kitchen use.  These pretty, colorfully printed DII towels have broadened my scope of thinking as to their many more practical uses.I got the "wine lattice" 16 x 24 inch towels and love them.  At the risk of sounding like a commercial, they are so pretty that they make cleaning a little more fun.  They came through the wash without fading or shrinking and were put right to use drying dishes.  I've used mostly cotton towels up until now and didn't think anything could be better.  These towel suck up water and clean our granite counters fast, and dry quickly as well.  Remember not to use fabric softener to retain their absorbancy and, if possible, wash them with less-linty loads as they pick that up too.Currently, at about two dollars a towel, these are a deal.  With twelve in a package, you'll have enough to keep handy wherever you need them around the house.

I've had the Fellowes 49C Cross Cut Paper Shredder now for about 2 weeks and have used it numerous times in our home office.  We've been without a shredder for a couple of years since our last one died.  Perhaps we needed to oil it more, as directed in the user instructions included with this unit, with each waste paper removal using a non-aerosol vegetable oil.  This helps to keep it running reliably, smoothly, and more quietly.  All appliances need proper maintenance to keep running at peak performance.  Live and learn. . .(sigh).This is a nice, compact, little unit that fits easily under a desk, table, or counter and, so far, has gobbled up everything I've thrown at it, quickly and with ease.  I've intentionally put numerous sheets of paper, multiple envelopes of junk mail, full and empty, plastic credit cards, and various thicknesses of paper through it without any slowing or jamming.  It's capabilities are listed as "paper, credit cards, staples, and paper clips".  "It will not shred continuous forms, CD/DVDs, adhesive labels, transparencies, newspaper, cardboard, laminates, X-rays, or plastic other than as noted earlier".  It is rated for "medium" use, suitable for home offices and a max of 8 sheets of paper at once.  The waste bin holds 4 gallons.This is a heavy-headed unit.  It may be difficult for weaker people to empty or move.  I wish that it had better handles or latches on the waste bin as it comes apart quite easily when lifting or moving.  This is good when you want to empty it but bad if you didn't intend to!  Other than that, I have no complaints about it yet.  I don't think the noise when operating is that bad.  It sounds like a shredder to me and doesn't last that long if you're not shredding a lot of stuff.  It's stated to shred for five minutes before shutting off to cool down.I like the feature of a safety lock as we do occasionally have children in our home, though not on a daily basis.  We just need to remember to lock it when we do!There is a on year warranty on this product with a three year warranty on the cutter.So far, I'm pleased with it's performance but will update my review if I have problems or more to add.

I ordered these for my aging mother that has had some issues with incontinence.  She likes them a lot and says that they are quite comfortable.  They give her a feeling of security while not being bulky or difficult to deal with like some other products that use tape or glues to position.  She is a petite woman, about 5 foot tall and 118 pounds, so the small/mediums fit her well.  I am a size 12, (five foot five, 160 pounds), and they fit me but weren't comfortable.  They are low cut and didn't seem to fit right around the legs or crotch.  I think someone my size would need the larger size.My mother mentioned that she wished that they were a little higher in the back for when she wears them at night.  Possibly, the maximum protection would be better for nighttime use.  Otherwise, they are a welcome addition to her quality of life in dealing with this issue.

Though I can't speak of speed (my card reader is USB2.0 speed), it is an excellent buy.As of this writing (nov 2015), 128GB flash memory is the standard to go by, as it makes no sense buying smaller cards for more money ($$/GB).It offers a great expansion to my laptop, for storing favorite movies and files.
The smallest socket fits my scooter and motorcycle spark plugs, while the larger ones are for the car.Good deal!

What is there to say about this pouch?It's neoprene, that means durable, soft, lightweight, stretchy, and fits my Asus Zen laptop perfectly.Has an amazon logo on it, and most of the stuff that receives an Amazon logo is well made!

Though I purchased this unit by accident, I always needed a smaller set!Seems to be made affordable, with the Chinese quality of today, not of 10 years ago.Chinese products are excellent mid-range products, for the average home user.

Although the inch measurements are in fractions (1/10th and 1/100th of an inch), it's still a very nice caliper!The beaks are very fine cut, unlike some user posted in pictures.I'm extremely satisfied with it!

The good:You can do a lot with it!From flickering (strobo), to cycling, to smooth transitioning colors.The colors that you like even!Like with every LED, it's hard to get a nice and warm tone.You can select between 16 million colors (256^3), as there are 256 color intensities per led. That should be good enough for displaying just about any color you want!The Android app  (can't speak of apple), can even turn on and off the light at a cerain time of the week (programmable).It's probably the best mood light I've ever bought!The cons:The LED is 7W peak, and gets very hot at these settings. Killawat measured. At 4W, or about half it's intensity, it gets slightly warmer than handwarm. At minimum, it uses just under 1 watt of light, great for a night light. Red is darker in intensity than blue, and blue is darker than green. Green is considerably brighter than red, and uses also 20% more power.Great as a mood light, cycling colors between various shades of orange could be considered romantic, but you still know it's a LED, and not an incandescent bulb.I wished they would invent omnidirectional leds, for lampshades, because only 50% of my lampshade is lighted up.

I have other brain products with Ginko Bilboa, and thoigh I would say the pills help, they're not that effective.The other pills are about twice as effective as these ones.But then again, you could take these pills almost every day, without fearing for overdosing.I wished they had made the pill more effective and concentrated.

Both the flutophone, and the songflute are very close brothers.They share the same volume body, same fingerholds, and same materials, and both are tuned to the key of C, and both are about as loud as the other volume wise.Both have extrusions on where the fingerholes for easier playing, and the same distance of the fingerholes from the soundhole.Both have 7 top holes and one bottom hole, although the flutophone has an eight hole right next to the low C, to play the C#.The differences are minute.While Selmer's songflute is more basic and cheaper made, it has better finger positions, curved with the hand. The Flutophone's holes are more straight (in line), like on a recorder flute.To play a low C# on the songflute, one has to halfway remove the pinky from the tonehole, which can be tricky, while the Flutophone has an extra hole there for the C#. This does not affect playability in any way, as it's just as hard to play the C# on either one of the flutes, and the extra hole isn't felt anyway.The Flutophone has a wider, but more narrow mouthpiece by a millimeter or two, resulting in slightly less airflow, but a more defined tone (like a recorder, bright, clear tone), while the Songflute has a higher airflow, resulting in more wind noises and more body, a bit more sounding like an occarina.The flutophone is longer, partly because the mouthpiece is longer, but also because it has an added bell on the bottom for projection of sound. I'm quite sure without this bell, the songflute would have been the louder flute.The Flutophone, though clearly the higher quality made instrument, surprisingly was off on the low D by as much as 25ct or more! The songflute pretty much was tuned correctly. This is a bit of a bummer for this more beautiful instrument to be off tonewise, although only on one note.Overall, I would say that the cheaper Songflute from Selmer is an easier instrument to play, and is correct tonal wise.The Flutophone is the nicer looking instrument, being dualtone color.Either one are great flutes to learn on, but the tonal error on the flutophone, and it's slightly higher price are reason for me to give one star off.

Not too fond of this spot light!1- it's actually only 3W. Not 5W at 110V. Perhaps at 220V it could come close to 5W, but they should mention that. Even at its brightest setting white, it's 3W.On the positive side, this nightlight can get really dim. At 0.5W, as measured by my killawatt meter, it's perfect even for light sensitive individuals as a nightlight!2- the colors aren't evenly distributed. White doesn't look white, but a mix of red, green and blue and turquoise on the ceiling/floor, depending on how you aim it.Overall it appears to be white, but when you look at it, it is just a mix of colors.The spot light has a very narrow beam, and isn't meant to be hung in a lampshade, since the lampshade won't light up.It just points a 1ft radius light over 5ft length roughly measured.I much would recommend the slightly more expensive bulb 'B007V1VOI8' (search amazon without the brackets), or, go for the standard/3W frosted bulb.

For the money it's a great buy!It uses between 0.9W on the darkest setting of red, to 1.1W on the darkest setting of green.When dialed up, it uses about 3W when mixing 2 colors, and 4W at its brightest white setting, all measured with a killawatt meter.I believe the 5W power rating is only for 220V settings.At it's lowest setting, it is a great night light for a bedroom.2 to 3 settings brighter, is great as ambiance light, to change the mood (aka for more romantic settings).4 of these evenly distributed in a master bedroom are amazing!At its brightest setting it might be good for a teenager/youth's basement or camp or so, as it is pretty bright to look at.Also excellent as camping light for trailers or tents with access to ac power!

Pros:Does not distort,True low power usage, needs less than 500mAh peak.Great sounding,Accepts most 12v adapters (12v external harddrive adapters)Cons:Low volume,The tone knob on mine was in reverse,Not a lot of tonal control.The amp makes your electric bass about as loud as an accoustic bass.It doesn't provide much brights, but most basses with new strings have a good bright sound anyway.It also functions as a headphone amp.Looks nice, gets decent tone (160Hz - 4kHz?), but is not very loud.Should last more than 6 hours on battery, but haven't tested that claim.I would have wanted a bit more punchyness, more volume, and more tonal variety for the money. I find a good price for this amp would be $40-$45.

I've noticed, when taking this in combination with vitamin e  (e-400), my urine looks neon yellow.According to the web, a side effect of too much vitamin B.Strangely enough, when taking it by itself, I don't notice any strange color.

Low sugar count, and high chocolate flavor!Though meant as a topping on tiramisu or coffe with whipcream, you can use this product to make or improve your own  chocolate milk.Tired of all the excessive sugars in drinks and foods?Tired of the bland and sugary tasting liquid you buy in the stores, called "chocolate milk"?Add this for extra chocolate flavor and bite, or create your own "dark chocolate milk" from regular, or almond milk.It mixes with cold (15 min) or hot (1min) milk.Great to also improve on flavor of protein drinks, by just adding it to the protein powder in your shake, or just add 50/50 to your overly sweet nesquick powder, and save your children from growing up becoming borderline obese from what our society puts in the racks of our supermarket!
I got a 32gb, because the 64gb wasn't recognized by my Microsoft Surface 2 RT tablet.

Bought 2, and will buy 2 more.Charges the Nokia Lumia 920 without heating up the battery like 1 amp chargers do,Also slow charges the Samsung Galaxy Mega. The minimum the mega needs is a 750mAh, this 850mAh is just perfect!Charges my mega in one to thee hours, depending on how empty it was.Fast chargers can charge my mega in 10 to 90 minutes, but sometimes damage or overheat the batteries.Works also great with 5v USB flashlights, and table fans.I will be buying 2 more!

My size is 34/34. I bought a 38, from the reviews I went 4 sizes up, just to be sure.The pants fit, but are a tad too wide.A 36 to 37 would have fitted me better.The 38 has about a 32 inseam. Too small to wear without boots for me (pants won't reach my ankles).Thick pants, look sturdy and like they can handle a fall.Great rain pants too, keep you dry.Great for weather below 78 degrees, which will be our FL winters!Knee protection is about 3 to 5 in too low, and hanging mid-shinbone.

I have the A1s ABS, just like on the picture.Didn't order from Amazon.Sounds like a sax, just a little harsher, and more plasticky. Meaning, less bright or high frequencies, more high mid and mid frequencies, and less lows.Great for accoustic band play or orchestra. But this sax is less loud than most metal saxes I own (does not have resonators in the valves).I presume the silicone caps absorb some of the volume (about 20%).It's very lightweight, could be played without strap (thumb would get as tired as neck does with a strapped metal sax).Though you see romantic images of sax players in the ocean, this sax has metal springs and screws/bolts that could corrode, so no salty ocean water playing.Sounds great amplified in a band.The plastic mouthpiece is playable, but can be improved upon.I suggest your mouthpiece of choice.I also not suggest using a plastic reed on this when playing by yourself, as plastic reed on a plastic sax sounds too much of the high mid frequencies adding up on each other. It may actually sound better in some band play situations, but doesn't sound good by itself.Higher regions sound a bit flat, a quarter of a note, so you'd have to squeeze the reed hard, to get the tone right in the upper register.One star off for this.Great for beginners, and intermediates.I don't see pros using this live or in a studio, but it might be a great backup sax to own, or as travel instrument, or for the small gigs.Quality wise, $300-500 is a great price for this instrument!

It does hop around when blowing air in a lower than 10 degrees angle upward from ground level.about 10ft of windflow, nice and quiet, around 2.5W of power.Great desktop fan. If they had this in 5 W, and about double the fan diameter, it would do well for bedroom air circulation.But as is, it's great as a desktop fan for offices that are just too hot, to about 4 degrees above comfort level.It helps putting a cellphone on the feet, to keep it from vibrating around on the desk.

Week 2 and the camera light stopped working.Also, within the first 2 weeks the device was constantly overheating.After the overheating stopped (installed programs, and restarted it), the unit ran ok.Too much background activity when too many apps are installed at once, making the battery life pretty poor.Pro:Windows 10 is becoming available for this device soon!The camera does take good pictures in the dark.The call quality is excellent.

Tastes very acidic, like lemons, or limes.Tastes a little like plums, like when they're still very green,Supposedly with about a teaspoon a day, you'll get a 150% of the daily recommended Vitamin C count.So far lemons work better for me, but it's probably a good syrup to add in tea, as a variation of lemon or lime.

The music of this game is undoubtably amazing and inspirational!Created by Stephane Pick, who retired to Madagascar in the late 2000's, this game is probably more known for the spell-binding music than for the gameplay itself.The gameplay is quite easy, and the story line is phenomenal!Too bad it does no longer work on Windows 8 or up, since it needs DOS to run, but Windows 7 32 bit plays it back quite fine.You'll need a P3, 333Mhz to play this game fluently in full detail, or a P4 2Ghz, to run it emulated.The graphics eat a lot of the emulation of DOSBOX away.Runs with 32MB RAM under DOS, 1GB RAM recommended for WinXP, 2GB for Windows 7 emulated.

It's a good fan, somewhat loud on setting two.It gives a nice breeze upto about 9ft on setting one, and uses 1.2W of power on speed setting 1, and 2.1W of power on speed setting 2.It appears to have 2 blades, but I think they're both running in the same direction (so only one motor, with 2 blades).It's good as a desktop fan.In the bedroom it works well too, facing you when sleeping. On setting 2, the bedsheets move a bit though...Not recommended as bedroom fan.Edit: Fan broke after 1 month of using it a few hours a day.

It has a 1024x600 fixed resolution, incompatible with most older games that could run on 800x600 or 640x480 pix. The driver of mimo screens does not accept up or downscaling, a problem you won't have with some other HDMI monitors.Unfortunately, for me that means most of my apps won't work.Most programs in windows Vista or before, require you to have a 600pix screen. Windows 7 says to have a 960pix screen, and some programs do indeed not display everything under 786pixels.So this display is not a good gaming screen for older games, unfortunately.On the upside, it is small, thin, lightweight, needs only 1 mini to usb 2.0 cable, the image is clear, and comparable to cell phone screens, has an okay viewing angle,  and the buttons on the back allow it to be lit from dark to bright, like a cellphone's screen. Displays well in low lit to well lit indoor offices. Not for outside under bright sunshine..Also not too fond of the latch in the back behind which the usb plug is. It's a nice thing showing off the monitor, but once you plug it in, the cable sticking out looks ugly...My major gripe is the driver's incompatibility to display lower or higher resolution screens, resized. If it had that, it would get a 4.5 star from me

Works better than expected!It has quite the amount of throw! I place it on a corner of the room, about 15ft away, and feel it quite well, even on setting 1!On setting 3, it easily rotates the air around in a 10 by 15ft room.It consumes 22W on 1, 24W on 2, and 27w on setting 3.For what I would like, setting 3 works well in the bedroom, with the fan not pointing directly at me.Setting 1 is still a bit too intense for pointing at me at night, and makes more noise than I'd wished. I prefer whisper quiet rooms.I might want to buy an additional fan, that's lower power, and less noise.This is a well built, lightweight, long lasting fan, that thanks to its housing has more throw than you'd expect. The motor seems solid, and built to last years!It's simple made, not a whole lot that could break on this thing...For me personally, this fan is good for the office, but not my bedroom.
A little lightweight, and fragile, but it works!

If you plan on buying this game second hand, make sure you ask the seller if it comes with an access key, and online account data.Without this, the copy you get might not work.GuildWars doesn't offer or sell keys, and unless you own a copy of the game where the DVD got damaged, this game probably won't work if the access key has been used before, and you don't have access to the Guild Wars account associated with the key.

The keyboard is pretty small, equal to 7" tablet keyboards.The chiclet keys offer a good feel on what you're typing, and when a key is struck.They're a little noisy, because they're a bit loose on the inner mechanics, but not too much.My main reason for 2 star off, is because the keyboard is so light weight, and without rubber feet, it slides all over the desk as I'm trying to type my text.The second star off is for some characters are found in odd locations, like a much used ''' character must be typed by using the 'Fn' key,; while keys like <>| are accessible via shift.

One star off because it's a little confusing to set up without the user manual.To put it in discoverable mode, press and hold scroll wheel for a few seconds, until light flashes.It's a bit counterintuitive, since the other button below the scroll wheel is only for DPI setting.Other than that, it's a very nice portable mouse, with pg up/dn (ff/rew) buttons, optical, blue tooth.I love how the mouse buttons offer the click-feeling, without the sound of it. The damped (softened) click feeling feels like found only on luxury mouses of the past.So far no problems yet, Ill see how long the battery lasts.

I love these vintage shows.Don't let the $48 pricetag scare you,for the money you get almost 3 hours of episodes per dollar, that's a lot!Not to mention, english dubbed!Get your kids, or yourself this great set of Robotech, and spend a week or two, relaxing at home or with friends and some massive amounts of pop corn and pizza rolls!

Overall, I would give it a three and a half star. It has a small reflective sticker on the back, and reflective strips on the side.The boots fit great for people with wider feet, and still look like not overly big shoes.These boots are great for city riding, and urban riding, but I would not use them on the tracks.The boots are exactly as pictured, unlike another reviewer commented. On the picture there is a label in between both boots.Pros:About half the price of regular motorcycle bootsseem sturdyankle joint and shinbone protection, and the use of sturdy (tire-like) rubber soles and side fabrichas reflector strips on themWater (rain) proof (not ocean proof).In quality very similar to my $120 boots, but easier to get into.They have an extra leather patch where the gear shifter touches the boots.Aside from the shinbone fabric, I would give this a 4.5 star.The discomfort of the fabric brings it down 1 star.Cons:inside the boot there's a fabric pushing on my shinbone. It feels uncomfortable, and painful when on the longer (4+ hours) rides, see pictures attached).They seem sturdy, and protect your feet better than combat boots, but for some reason, I believe they're not top quality (what trackracers would wear).Edit:4 month review: one of the boots has the sole coming off, and both of them have a small (immitation leather) piece in the back that's wearing off from rubbing against the pants.I had to lower 4 star to 1 star for this.Don't buy, won't last.

It works. Doesn't magnify that much. I had expected a bigger magnification.It clicks on the screen, and is safely stored on the back of the SP, protected by a plastic cover.But you can't go wrong for the price.

If you really want just warm water for one showerhead at a time, or hot water for the dishes, without burning your hands, this water heater is about triple what you need.I have mine set at the lowest setting, but it draws too much power. Lights are flickering, and electronics see an early death, due to the feeder line to my house is rated at 100amps only.Together with the ac, it's pulling about 85 amps (50 for the heater, and 30 for the ac).Not a continuous 50 amps, but an interrupted. Every so many times a second it seems to suck the line empty.I'm considering downsizing to a 7kW heater instead.If you have a 150amp feeder line or greater, need 2 showers, and hot water for the dishes at the same time, this is good enough.

The good:- Very crisp detail- works well in portrait mode as secondary monitor of my main 13" 1280x800 monitor- Has brightness controls, that can set it to pretty dark, for dark places, and bright enough to read at full daylight (not in full sun)-Has a main stand that also acts as a screen protector when stowed away.- Plug and playable- Looks good, both the image quality, as the product.- Very portable, and looks good with a brix pc!Cons:- Too low resolution. Does not work well with modern operating systems as a primary monitor (Win Vista or beyond).- Driver doesn't have the option to increase display input resolution (eg: do 1024x600 on an 800x480pix screen, to make it useable under Windows.- I'm personally not too fond of the rubber flap on the back to insert the mini usb cable. It looks awkward.- The display only has 1 setting horizontal and vertical. It easily could have been given an extra angle in both landscape and portrait mode!Notes:When using it as a primary monitor, make sure the display setting is configured to output 800x480 pix, 16 or 32 bit, 60hz. Otherwise the display will show nothing.This monitor doesn't suffer from bad decoloration, like the comparable in price, 7" HDMI monitor from lilliput.It appears to have a wide viewing angle, and with brightness toned up or down, it displays movies and pictures just as good!
Great bowtie.Looks even, silky in texture (polyester), but no one will notice it's not real silk...Nice eggplant color, looks good in tuxedo!

Perfect gift for your groomsmen.They look not too thin, neither too wide.The price is just right, and the colors are very even.Great and economical, if you want to buy them in a pack (for a wedding party, or other classy event, and need everyone to dress up the same).

Looks very beautiful on darker skin, but for the White/red Caucasians it looks a little light on the skin.Also, the thread that goes in between the thumb and index finger, looks quite fragile.I would say it would be ok for a Sweet 15/16 event/photo shoot, but I would not recommend it for a wedding, nor for multi-use.

It's a little thin in height, not too much metal, but exactly what my fathers and those before wore as a marriage ring!I like it very much, comfort fit, the only thing I don't like is the inscriptions, lol!It would probably be a must-have for a LOTR couple getting married. Both size 9 and size 5 look very beautiful on fitting hands, not too wide, not too thin (in width), just perfect.
I really like the abalone inlay, but found the sides of the ring somewhat too wide.On my skin, gold looks better, so I decided on another ring.

Great game!The game is very similar as Mario Kart.Same handling, same graphics.Don't listen to the nay-sayers, the graphics and gameplay work out just fine if you know how to press buttons in the correct time!Compared to Mario Kart, this game is a little more violent.Cars have grinders next to their wheels, you can whack them off the road, and by combining turbo with jumping in the right time, you could double, or triple the turbo length!My favorite racer is the old man! His car turns into an airplane, and is probably the fastest on the track!Give this game a try! You'll not regret it!
Too small!I ordered a 9, figured out that I had gained a few pounds, and a 9 is small but still fits.What I received was an 8.5 or smaller. It doesn't fit at all!

It comes with a basic lite package of software, to play back samples.A bit expensive for what's in essence just a 'Midi-keyboard'.The buttons are sturdy, the device feels solid. The back is rubberized.Only cons, are the price, the fact that the buttons don't have aftertouch, nor dynamics, they are just on/off buttons (signal or no signal).Too bad this isn't a hardware sampling box, but needs a pc or mac to work.Provided software only works on MacOs, and Windows. Not Windows RT, or Android.
Good stuff!Trying it out on the outside windows.Non dripping, sticky, water repellent, and just what you expect from silicone!

Works really well!I tried a mix of baking soda and vinegar, to solve my drain clog, but it didn't work very well.That's when I found hair clog blaster!Though it didn't blast the hair out, I just poured a quart of the gooey mixture in the drain and left it over night, and flushed with hot water, and it opened up like a camel lighting a fart!Best hair clog remover!Only con is that I don't really know how much I should pour in the drain. I just did 1/4th-1/3rd a bottle.

Easy to take oil samples from the engine.Also to remove any oil when overfilling.Another good use for this is to drain some dirty oil, and add some fresh oil, in case you don't have the time, or don't want to do a full oil change, but need a quick way to add some good oil in the crankcase.One star off, because the rubber friction is very high. Sometimes is hard to get it to suck up oil, or eject the oil from the tube..

Didn't came in a bag, but just in a box.Seems like a solid brass tap,The plastic fitting fits very tight around the metal nipple.Personally, I think the Chinese could make something similar like this for half or a quarter the price. It's a little overpriced. But at least knowing that, you'll know that the valve, and spring system won't corrode easily (seeing they are located at the bottom of the car, out in the elements).Not a good idea if the roads are very dirty, or you go offroading; could clog the nipple.It's well built, but just too expensive!

Price per dollar this definitely is a good buy!I'm by no means an expert on sound quality, but I can assure you, it sounds way better than the plastic mouthpieces that came with the Plastic trumpet I bought!This mouthpiece makes it easier to blow the upper registers of the trumpet (about an octave higher than a 7c mouthpiece, which is easier for the lower register of the instrument).The price is right,It feels solid, and I have the impression it won't corrode very quickly, but I'll write more about that later...

It gets 2 stars, because I'm all for newer technology, newer materials, newer products and stuff, but it doesn't have to come with the con I experienced on this.First of all, the trumpet sounds really like a trumpet. A little more mellow, and a bit more mid tones, but that's perfectly fine with me.It can produce plenty of brights if you want it to!The plastic mouthpiece does give it more of a 'plasticky tone', easily remedied by replacing it with your mouthpiece of choice.Amazon sells sub $10 mouthpieces that will improve the sound a bit from the plastic ones, and sound really good.Lots of people mentioned the trumpet had sticking valves, I did not immediately experience it, but from time to time, the valve wouldn't go up completely. Allora guarantees that with use, this will go away, and looking at the instrument, I think I can trust them on that.The weight is very light weight.You can play it in icy cold, or scorching hot summer heat, with the instrument pretty much feeling and sounding the same.Allora has been upgrading their trumpets, and I have to say, unlike the Vibrato Sax, or the Pbone, this instrument can sound very close to the real thing!So why only 2 stars then?Well, upon investigation, I found that the valve caps and lids where very weak.Initially I was afraid for those who clean their instruments regularly, that they will wear out the valve cap seal, and that the plastic would get loose.practice however showed that one of the pins, holding the valvecaps in their place, broke off.And I think it's an engineering design error with this product!The valve caps aren't meant to be opened and closed frequently, or if it's up to me, not opened at all!The valve caps really needed to be made out of metal as well, or screwed on, with threads like a nut and bolt.Once a valve cap breaks off, the instrument is basically to be thrown away.Anything could be a cause, like the rubber gasket could get stuck there, too much force can easily be applied there, a small bump with an object, and the valve cap can break, and you can throw away the instrument, because it is non-replaceable (valves housing and valve cap holders are glued to the main body of the trumpet).If a valve cap breaks itself, I guess it's possible to get a replacement, but not for the lids that hold the valvecap.

Unfortunately, it's a bit on the small side.I'm 6'4", 166LBS, tall and skinny, and the XL felt a little skinny on me.I felt like being peeled like a pop-corn, ready to pop out.Fits me well all over, except the privates.A little squeezing my almonds there for a tall guy!

For the price, I was expecting way less.The gloves are really blue,are stretching,and are almost as thick as the rubber of a balloon.I successfully used them for dishes, and siliconing windows.My hands are XL, but I could still fit in the L

Extremely happy!Looks like it's made for a bigger bike!Mounts on the front fork.It comes with a sturdy shield with chrome bar, 2 extension bars, 2 clamps, screws, 2x rubber strips in 5 levels of thickness.The provided fork clamps are too big to mount on the Rebel's forks, and I had to use 3 layers of rubber.The thickest one,The second to thickest one,The fourth (one up from the thinnest one).The mounting was a bit of a pain, because the rebel's brake and throttle cables run at that corner.Feels really sturdy, like it'll survive 120MPH rides.Looks like quality chrome (only time will tell).Make sure you tighten the windshield nuts (that mount the Plexiglass to the metal). I lost one nut already for forgetting to mount it!Looks great, seemless, and perfect on a Honda Rebel 250!

Picked one of these up for my six year old yesterday and I was pretty impressed with the overall quality of this gun. It's small, for one. Sort of like a Derringer but not quite so tiny. You have to cock the mechanism (just a pull lever that clicks in to place at the bottom of the handle) for each of the three shots but this thing has got some serious range on it! I'm not talking one end of a football field to another but enough that you can get into some intense firefights from 40-50 feet away from each other. If you're looking for a simple dart gun that can get the job done, I cannot recommend this one enough.NOTE:-You may want to get the protective glasses for yourself or for any younger kids using this. Not only does this thing have range but the darts could probably cause some damage to someone if they take a dart to the eye at close range. Might not be necessary but I already had my kid put one into the side of my head from about five feet away after I expressly told him not to aim above the neck.

Gimmicky in that it looks snazzy but doesn't necessarily perform the task of a wine stopper any better than a regular classic model does. I tried this on several different wine bottles and while I did get a seal after pumping the air out, it felt like it was able to be pulled off with no force needed. I don't know, I guess this just didn't create as much of a seal as I was expecting it to and this was true across all the bottles I tried.

Adorable game for younger players that focuses on memory retention and color matching development. Good way to introduce your children to board games and have them learn something invaluable at the same time, which is always preferable.

These Bento styled lunch boxes are pretty great and completely recommended for packing your lunches. They're strong enough and not as flimsy as other similar style lunch boxes. Coupled with the EasyLunchboxes Mini Dippers Small Dip, Condiment, or Sauce Containers, Leak-Resistant, Set of 8, the two make for a good pairing. Be mindful if you're packing something overly saucy or liquidy as you might get some leakage but as long as you're careful with it, these lunch boxes should fit your needs.

These mini dippers are great for use with the larger EasyLunchboxes if you desire to pack salad dressing, steak sauce or ketchup, etc. They're essentially leak proof and clean very easily either by hand or dishwasher. Completely recommended, especially if you like packing your lunches nice and neat.

There's very, very little I can say about this product other than it's a dependable baby/kid wash as it has always been. The stuff smells great and leaves your children feeling and smelling clean and fresh after a warm bath or shower. It's essentially a soap form of the classic pink lotion, so the smell of it will be familiar to you if you're already familiar with the lotion. All in all, a tried and true classic that's never let anyone down. At least no one I know, anyway.

Smells great and makes your skin feel soft and cleansed after use. Two pumps gives you enough lather for washing and it rinses off easily. There's not much else to say here but chances are you'll be satisfied with this product after use.

I am completely geeking out over this thing. This Needler gun, a staple of the Halo games on Xbox since the very first release, is a scale model dart gun that's pretty spot on in terms of looks. It comes packaged with sixteen darts, eight of which get loaded on the top (and thanks to the built in lights on the gun itself, they actually glow) and the other eight get loaded into the cylinder where they fire from. It also comes with a sticky target for target practice.The gun doesn't work exactly like it does in the game where you hold the trigger down and out comes this steady stream of needles that stick to your target and then explode but I mean, that's pretty much a logistical impossibility. Still, the gun itself is pretty awesome and these darts have a decent range of flight once you start firing them. They also fire with enough force that you should definitely think twice before letting small children play with it.I think any Halo fan would appreciate this gun and the attention to detail that was applied to it. Truly impressive!

No complaints here whatsoever. Both films look spectacular and the DTS-HD MA 5.1 audio tracks are even better. Bad Boys 2 especially looks really good, finally making its long awaited debut on Blu. The audio is ridiculous, giving your surround sound system a proper workout. This is definitely one of the more active sound mixes I've heard for a film and with the amount of action these films have, you're sure to be pleased. Most of the extras are carry overs from the DVDs but there's a lot of stuff to pore through with the Bad Boys 2 disc having the more interesting selection. The discs come in their own individual cases housed in a flimsy slip cover but also come included with Ultraviolet codes for each film. Fans of the boys should be very happy with this presentation.

Fans of Paw Patrol will undoubtedly love this Chase themed hooded towel which is soft and absorbent and also well made. This is a perfect item for young admirers of the show and makes bath time more exciting for them.

Thin and light but manages to keep you warm. The sleeves are long enough for those with long limbs (my wife is one of those) and the general style of it is both cute and eye catching without being too gaudy. The Molo Hybrid jacket is stylish and sensible and a great addition to any girl's closet.

It makes your coffee with no muss and no fuss. It's under $20 and if you're looking for a no nonsense coffee maker, look no further. My advice is to get a Medelco 4-Cup Permanent Basket Coffee Filter to go along with it, that way you don't have to spend money buying filters.

UBISoft delivers with accurate recreations of four of Hasbro's most popular board games: Monopoly, Risk, Trivial Pursuit and Scrabble. The graphics and sound are terrific across the board and the animations employed across the four games make the boards seem almost like living environments. There's online functionality across all the games and customization options are pretty robust. All in all, this one makes for a great family friendly multiplayer game, especially in a gaming household. Only requires one controller in case that's all you have, which is a nice touch. Recommended!

DC Trip is an interesting book. It reads like a young adult novel intended for adults, with moments and dialogue that seem to be a perfect fit for a Mean Girls type of film and then all of a sudden, switches gears at intervals to make way for moments of explicit sexual details that make the read a bit jarring at times. It's kind of like Otherwise Known as Sheila the Great with sex and frank discussions about the subject thrown into it.Now don't get me wrong, I'm not some kind of prude and I love that kind of stuff but it almost feels out of place in the book due to the way the book reads for the majority of it. I'd be a fool to say that today's teens don't talk the way that the teens in this tale do (and even worse, I'm sure... I mean, I WAS a teen myself way back when) but if you're easily horrified at the idea of teens eating pot cookies or talking about sex in any way, shape or form, you may want to rethink this one.Now while I wouldn't necessarily say that the general subject matter of this book is the kind of thing that I gravitate towards, I found Ms. Benincasa's writing to be refreshing and above all, very honest. You get the feeling that a lot of what you're reading is coming direct from the author's heart and soul and as corny as that sounds, it made me feel more involved with what was happening and the characters themselves, who are all endearing in their own individual ways. I put this book down feeling like I had a good sense of what the author must be like in real life and judging from her Twitter account, I don't think I'm off the mark on that observation at all.If it sounds like I'm confused, I'll be honest with you and say that I am. I can truly say that I've never read a book quite like this one. It's quite frankly the most adult young adult novel I've ever read but again, Sara Benincasa's writing and the lighthearted, honest nature of the way the story flows made this a compelling book for me and one that kind of took me back to those days when things were a little more carefree and a class trip could lead to unexpected places and realizations. Give this one a shot, I think you might like it!

These are pretty decent work gloves that run maybe a little small in its large sized version. I have big hands and I was able to put them on but they fit pretty snug, more so than I was expecting. That being said, the gloves still suffice in the toughness department and are pretty much perfect for any task that requires a little ruggedness and protection. Gardening, moving, etc.

The Epson Home Cinema 1040 delivers with stunning color and brightness wrapped up in a crystal clear 1080p picture. Two HDMI ports comes as a welcome addition, allowing you to hook up just about any device you can think of to it. I currently have this projector connected to my Denon receiver, which outputs a bunch of HD sources to it such as my Xbox One, PS3, cable and video cameras and every single one of them look fantastic up on the screen. Unfortunately, while this projector does have the capability to go wireless, you have to pick up a separate piece to do that so I was not able to test out this facet of the projector. In terms of size and weight, it's a little smaller than other projectors I've used and doesn't weigh as much. It's also very easy to mount up on a ceiling mount and gives you plenty of room in positioning the picture. It's actually pretty impressive how much leeway you have in getting the picture to where you want it.All in all, while not as impressive as the much higher end projectors I've used, this one is still worth every penny and comes with enough features and provides enough functionality where you'll be hard pressed to find any fault with it. And again, that picture is just phenomenal. Recommended!

Tastes okay but kind of suffers from an overall taste of artificial sweeteners due to the inclusion of Stevia in it. Those who suffer adverse effects (like stomach aches) due to the artificial sweeteners may want to avoid this but for those who aren't, you may find this flavored water to float your boat.

My experience with third party controllers usually winds up with me being thoroughly disgusted with them, specifically the sub-par quality they tend to possess. They never seem to match the quality of their first party made counterparts and wind up breaking fairly easily. This Afterglow controller for the Xbox One is leaps and bounds beyond any other third party console controller I've ever used and transcends its somewhat gimmicky nature with a build that is at least the same quality of the controllers that come packaged with the console itself.For starters, the controller itself feels great and comfy in my hands. The sticks feel just as good as the regular first party controllers do and the various bumpers and buttons all feel well placed and responsive. This controller also has an additional two wheel buttons but I'll get into those in a moment.I prefer my controllers to be wireless but I understand why this particular controller has to be wired as the LED lighting would drain a regular set of batteries in minutes I'd presume. The cable is detachable and is pretty long, checking in at ten feet in length. The LED light setup is admittedly cool and is very easy to adjust to your preferences, with the left stick adjusting brightness and the right stick adjusting the color. You can also set up whether you want the controller to light up when it vibrates. The controller comes equipped with a 3.5mm headphone jack which is appreciated but what really makes this inclusion even better is the ability to set the volume levels, not to mention the chat mixer levels, via the controller's D-pad, which is now making me wonder why the standard Xbox One controllers can't do this as well. Negating the need to go to the Xbox One guide to adjust the volume is a pretty impressive little feat.The most interesting aspect of this controller is the inclusion of two wheel buttons on the rear that can be mapped to any button you wish, including joystick clicks. Each wheel can be rolled in two different directions, giving you four settings you can customize to your liking. They're positioned so that the tips of your index fingers rest right on them. So, for example, for Halo 5, I have it set up so that when I roll the right wheel up, I can sprint. Rolling the same wheel down reloads. It's already changed my play style in an unexpected way and it just feels much more intuitive to me. These wheel buttons are pretty cool and caught me completely off guard in regards to how much I'd enjoy using them.All in all, I couldn't find anything wrong with this controller and it went far beyond what I was expecting. The LED light adds kitsch value while the controller design as a whole is both thoughtful and well made in general, with smart additions and great functionality. At the time of this writing, the official Xbox Store app isn't available yet and is supposed to allow you to store custom settings for yourself and other profiles via the Xbox One. As soon as I get some time with that, I'll return to add an addendum to this review but as it stands, you can take this review as a full five star review with my highest recommendations.

What's cool about this Hulk figure is that it can be turned into something completely different once you start mixing pieces with other Super Hero Mashers like Captain America and Spider-Man. I'm curious why this thing comes with additions like cheeseburgers and pizza but if it keeps my six year old entertained, I guess questioning it doesn't really amount to anything.

The original version of the game complete with the original pieces, spinner and board art. If you're gonna play Chutes and Ladders, play it the way it was originally released and not in the revamped style that was released afterward. Not that the re-release version is horrific or anything but the original just has an air of authenticity to it.

Great bubble making toy that only suffers from not bringing any soap of its own, which isn't a  You'll have to buy a large bottle of bubble soap to fill it up but once you do, your kids will have a blast with it because really now, what kid doesn't love bubbles? Easily recommended.

One of the most stressful yet enjoyable games ever, Operation is back the way you remember it and ready to give all players a stress induced coronary. The game itself is simple, try to remove the maladies inside Cavity Sam without touching the sides of the spaces where the maladies are.
