Once you touch a side, you're greeted by a loud buzz to inform you that you screwed up. Gives one the same feeling you get playing Jenga, where everyone gets quiet as you try to finesse your moves to get the job done. This one's a classic and rightfully so. Be mindful with younger players as the pieces are pretty small and can get lost without you even realizing it.

Interesting overnight drawers set that is basically a pair of undies (they look like undies but feel much more like a pair of swim diapers) that you can insert an absorbent pad into. I thought they worked fine but in a way, they make you wonder why you shouldn't just use a pair of regular overnight diapers instead, which Goodnites also makes a very good version of. These TruFit overnight undies work well though, so if you're interested and this seems like it may be effective for both you and your little one, give these a shot.

Here's what you need to know. Mad Max: Fury Road, one of the most insane films ever committed to film, comes home on a Blu-Ray that is probably one of the best, if not THE best presentations I've ever seen and this is coming from someone who has seen some gorgeous looking discs. The picture is pretty much flawless. There's a clarity to it that just needs to be seen to be believed. It's like looking at a beautiful hi-res desktop wallpaper that has motion. The sound is also fantastic. The disc comes in a 7.1 Dolby Atmos mix that unfortunately I wasn't able to try since I don't have an Atmos capable receiver. So, in the case of no Atmos capable receiver, the disc down mixes to a Dolby TrueHD lossless mix which is still a very active, thunderous sound mix that puts every speaker in your setup to work, especially your subwoofer. I'm not going to bother summing up the movie for you, other than to say that if you've seen it and you're eager to know how the Blu Ray sizes up, I can't imagine you'll be disappointed.The disc also contains an Ultraviolet (UV) code, a DVD copy and an assortment of production featurettes on the disc itself that are pretty informative. This is a stellar disc and again, I can't imagine anyone being disappointed with the quality of it. If ever a Blu Ray was worthy of being labeled as shiny and chrome, Mad Max: Fury Road is it. Highly. highly recommended.

Really surprised with the sound quality from this Bluetooth speaker considering its size, which really is about the size of a water bottle like the product details inform you. The size makes it perfect for transportation and the casing is made of a solid rubber which keeps it from sliding around and protects it from accidental falls. You can stand it up or lay it on its side. The dynamic light show and its various settings is an added bonus with enough variety to ensure that you'll find a particular display you'll like. Again, the sound on this thing is pretty impressive. There's enough bass that you can properly hear it, unlike many of these other wireless speakers on the market. Just don't expect anything room shattering, it's just enough to make its presence known. The Bluetooth functionality also allows you to answer phone calls from your cell with it, which is nice. Also included is a small tool to change the language setting for the speaker's voice prompts.Kind of disappointed that no AC adapter was included but it does get about ten hours of playtime after three hours of charging with the included USB cable. If you're looking for a portable Bluetooth speaker with decent sound and eye catching design, you'll be happy with this.

Really good product for removing make up, especially if you want to take it off in mere seconds. Doesn't dry your skin terribly the way some of the stronger Neutrogena brand products can and doesn't leave a greasy residue once you're done. I don't find the fragrance overpowering (it's actually quite pleasant) and I didn't experience any irritation after use.

I love the color of this watch (sort of like a wintergreen color that pops) and its simple functionality. What you get for the cost is pretty good in terms of value and it's a nice, stylish product. Includes your typical stopwatch/timer function and the ability to save several time zones if you're a jet setter of sorts.

No complaints here whatsoever. Easy connection via USB with no installation of drivers or programs necessary. The sound quality in terms of voice reproduction was crystal clear over Skype and after testing the headphone jack with a pair of high quality Munitio earbuds, I can say the exact same thing regarding the audio on my end. Comes with a mini tripod and USB cable. I'd recommend this with no reservation at all.

Gotta give it to Toshiba as this tablet is very nice. I had an issue or two with it but I'll get to that in a second. Also, please note that I received this tablet free for review purposes but rest assured that what you're reading is an honest, no bull review that I'm not being paid or compensated for. Take that as you will.First off, the display is absolutely gorgeous. Everything looks nice and sharp on it and if you really want to see how clear it is, download a nice hi-res photo/ background wallpaper and see for yourself. It's a good size tablet, not too big and not too small. It's a versatile piece of tech and the tablet pen is very responsive and intuitive. The TruNote app included works very well in tandem with it and makes note taking a fun, snazzy little way to stay organized. Battery life is fairly decent so long as you dim the screen brightness a bit and keep background processes running to a minimum. It really is a PC in tablet form so you can do just about anything with this that you can do with a regular PC in terms of performance. There is also a mini-USB port, mini-HDMI and Micro SD slot built in, with the mini USB acting as a charge port. An AC adapter is also included, as well as a wrist strap.The problems I noticed with the tablet were in two specific spots: wireless functionality and in updating to Windows 10. I found the Wi-Fi performance a little spotty. When it worked, it worked great but occasionally, the drivers would just crap out and render me without any internet. After doing a bit of research, this seems to be something of an issue with Toshiba's tablets. The Wi-Fi has been working fine now for the past few days as of this writing but again, I've seen it do some weird things here and again since first using this tablet. Even the IT guy here at my job was baffled by the behavior of it when I let him check it out but to be fair he was still pretty impressed with the tablet in general, so let's not make it seem like this thing is useless. The upgrade to Windows 10 also made the Wi-Fi network adapter drivers get a little wacky which made the transition process somewhat frustrating. Windows 10 is pretty nice (I'm a huge gamer and that Xbox app is very slick; I've been streaming my gameplay to the tablet and it's a really impressive feature) but like all new OS releases, this one seems to have some things it needs ironed out so be mindful of that when you agree to upgrade to 10 from the existing 8.1 setup.Even with its few quirks, I'd still recommend this tablet. It's a pretty cool piece of tech and packs a vast amount of functionality within.(UPDATE: 8/18/15- Turned on my tablet to find that the network adapter has gone all wonky again after a couple days of smooth sailing, rendering me without internet. It's the exact same scenario I had when I first started using the tablet and it's difficult to tell where the problem lies seeing as the drivers are fully up to date but this is starting to get a bit annoying.)

A very pretty and cute penguin design makes this pendant/necklace combo a nice gift. The dual gold and silver tone is a nice touch as well. A nice simple piece of jewelry bound to make the penguin lover in your life happy as a clam.

This marks the third Lonely Planet travel guide I've reviewed and this one is just as impressive as the other two in terms of scale, detail, presentation and general usefulness. This one lays out a series of recommended road trips along the Pacific Coast, complete with all the information you'd need to pull them off with little to no problems. The trips are broken down into four separate jaunts:-Pacific Coast Highways-Northern Redwood Coast-Big Sur-Disneyland & Orange County BeachesEach road trip specified is detailed succinctly and thoroughly, covering everything from favored sights to recommended eating spots. The paper stock is good quality and the print job is fantastic, with clear pictures of everything referenced and all the icons and text very easy to make out and read respectively. There's plenty of useful advice regarding what to do in case your car breaks down and who to contact and a handy map that can be detached or the preferred option of mine, which is to open it up while still attached to the book.This is a VERY handy guide and I can't imagine anyone using this out there on the West Coast on one of these recommended road trips and coming away disappointed with it. All the people involved with the creation and production of this book should pat themselves on the back, this is truly impressive and thoughtfully crafted stuff.

Well crafted and adorable, this Thomas the Tank Engine wooden railway crossing has a Christmas theme to it, making it a perfect Christmas gift for the little Thomas fan in your life. It's primarily red and green with little tinges of snow and working lights and signals. What you see in the product photo is pretty much what you get so if you're familiar with the Thomas track sections like this one, you'll know what to expect.

What rating other than a full five stars can you give a product like this when it brings so much happiness to a child? My kids are both pretty big Thomas the Tank Engine fans and this playset made them just as happy as any other of the countless Thomas themed sets that I've gotten for them over the years. This set connects to any of the other Fisher Price sets (these things become even cooler when you start piecing them together and making huge connected track lines with a different scenario at every quadrant) and enough action to keep your kids entertained. The zipline makes for the best part as a zipline usually tends to be. There's little other to say other than the track is well made and requires little construction on your end before it's ready to go. If your child is a Thomas the Tank Engine fan, this comes easily recommended.

My kids loved this film and I can't get enough of it either. The story is ridiculous but its the characters that make this a laugh riot from beginning to end. Great voice work by Benedict Cumberbatch and John Malkovich but naturally it's the titular penguins who are the stars of the show and they're both hilarious and adorable. Skipper's my personal favorite, in case you were wondering. There's a moment where they smack him in the butt during a round of 'high ones' that kills me every single time. Okay, I'm rambling a bit but seriously, Penguins of Madagascar is WAY better than its box office returns would have you believe. Even when it's corny it's still funny. The picture and sound are both crystal clear on this disc and overall, it's a movie that I think every family should have in their library. I can't even tell you how many times I've seen it with my boys by the time of this writing but you can put it on again for me right now and I'll have NO complaints whatsoever. HIGHLY recommended.

Very nice pants that fit my soon to be six year old just right and have (thank the powers that be for this) reinforced knees. Anyone with small children knows how quickly they can wear the knees out of their pants so it's nice to see this extra added detail. And really, a cell phone pocket? I don't know how many of you have a 5 or 6 year old with a cell phone but that's just plain silly. I'll let my kid use it to store his jellybeans or whatever else he feels the need to transport around before I purchase him a new iPhone.

They taste great with no bad aftertaste to speak of and probably best of all, they're enticing to the kiddies due to the Star Wars theme, Little more to say than that but it's admittedly nice to be able to give my kids these gummies and not get any fuss over them.

Easy to set up and maintain, this punching bag makes for a solid purchase. It comes with detailed instructions on how to fill it (you can use sand and/or old clothes, the latter of which being a great way to recycle them) and everything you need to hang it up. I've been beating this thing up for a couple of weeks now and it makes for great exercise. It's very well put together and is stitched together securely.Can also be used for kickboxing, probably not so much for any kind of weaponry. If you want an outlet to get some frustration out, here's a good option.

Nice pair of shorts for kids which are suitable for both regular everyday use or something a little more formal. The material feels durable and is stitched together well for a proper fit. Really nothing more to say here other than there is also an elastic button strap inside the waistline to tighten up the fit a little more, something which is always appreciated by this dad. Recommended.

It's a conditioner that does what conditioners tend to do, which is really all you can ask for. It smells nice and leaves your hair feeling soft after application. Tresemme always has great hair products and this one is no different.

I would have given this TV stand a full five stars if it weren't for the vagueness of the instructions, so consider this a four and a half star review. They're not the worst instructions I've ever seen and they will get you through the build process but my advice is to keep the expected end result at the forefront of your mind and as you're building the frame, pay very close attention to how you're putting the pieces together. There are several points in the instruction where they tell you what pieces go where but don't tell you which side to attach to which. This lack of specificity led to one moment where I had to unscrew a couple of pieces after attaching them and another close call where the same thing almost happened. I'm a big fan of concise, detailed instructions and this was an undeniable disappointment that made things take a little longer than necessary. Even with this minor negative, it still winds up being a very easy stand to put together and the end result you get is an eye catching piece of A/V furniture that has plenty of space for all your equipment. Everything you need is included. I didn't need any tools although the instructions said I'd need a screwdriver; everything was able to be screwed in using the included Allen key. The stand feels very sturdy and the tinted tempered glass adds a nice touch to the overall design. It does a great job at keeping wires wrangled with the cutout holes in the wood supports in the rear and once your components are on the glass shelves, it all looks great and presentation worthy. I was able to build this by myself but I should warn you that the glass shelves themselves are heavy and almost make this a two man job on their own. I currently have an audio receiver, three game consoles, a cable box, three satellite speakers and a couple of other things populating the shelves and I still have substantial room to work with if I need to add anything else.Again, this would have easily gotten a perfect rating from me if the instructions were just a touch more refined. I'm incredibly happy with the end result but I could have done with those brief moments of annoyance that could have easily been addressed by literally a sentence or two of extra detail.

I don't know, after charging this thing to 100% (which didn't take particularly long) and putting it to use, I felt like this Swiffer/vacuum hybrid was kind of a waste. The Swiffer portion worked well enough but the vacuum left nearly everything in its wake untouched. It's really not strong enough to pick up much which defeats the whole purpose of this hybrid. I really don't see much use for this unless you're doing an extremely light cleaning. Anything more than that and I can't guarantee the results you'd deserve.

It really doesn't get much better than this in terms of outdoor phone cases made for adventure and creative photography. You get four different lenses, an airtight/waterproof case (well, it only goes about 15ft or so, so let's not get too excited about taking this thing on a sunken ship expedition) and a generally cool look added to your iPhone 6. While too bulky for everyday use, it still retains some functionality and extra safety. The telephoto lens warps the photos somewhat but the effect is near unnoticeable. Recommended, especially if you're a fan of GoPros.

This is a perfect example of what you see being exactly what you get. It's a very simple tablecloth that comes in a pleasant shade of brown, being neither too dark or too light. In terms of size, coverage and color, this tablecloth happens to go perfectly with the table I recently purchased, which is a dark brown wood table that seats six. The fabric is soft and well woven but not too soft where it feels like you're feeling up someone's leg while they're wearing a pair of ill-advised silk pants. It's hard to describe other than to say that it's not burlap. All kidding aside, this is a more than serviceable table cloth that should definitely fit the bill for a six seater table.

Easy Grip™ feature or not, I'm just glad I can use these and not have to dirty glasses only for me to have to wash a ton of them later. Maybe these won't slip out of your hand so easily when compared to other grip-less disposable cups. Bottom line is, drink your beverages using these, have less to wash later, end of story.

This Blu Ray edition of Tarsem's visually magnificent "The Cell" is pretty much the same as the original DVD release with one notable omission, namely the isolated score of Howard Shore. The picture is pretty good for the most part with a granier, more film like presentation than more recent digitally shot films. The picture seems to jump in overall quality though, when the action moves into the mind of the killer, which I'm sure viewers will notice almost immediately. The DTS-HD MA audio track is absolutely spectacular. It's both loud and extremely active. Shore's score benefits greatly from the sound mix, which complements the events on screen perfectly. The aforementioned extras are all interesting in their own right with the mini documentary 'Style as Substance' giving a better idea of why Tarsem's more visually driven film making style is how he chooses to go about translating the scripts he makes."The Cell" may not be an absolute masterpiece but there's no denying the imagination and creativity at play here, not to mention the genuinely disturbing elements peppered throughout. In fact, I find the movie even more disturbing now than I did when I first saw the film, having noticed many more things about it that seem to worm their way under your skin and wriggle there. The movie receives a very nice treatment on Blu Ray, which it wholly deserves.
Better than average body wash which isn't overly fragrant and leaves your skin feeling fresh and hydrated after use. Comes off easy after rinsing and leaves no residue to speak of.

Nothing wrong with wanting to stay extra clean and these Purell hand sanitizers always do the trick. This box of 4 comes nicely packaged and the sanitizer itself works just as it always does. Not sticky like some other sanitizers I've used and leaves no residue or long lasting scent, evaporating pretty soon after application.

This Elmo doll talks and talks and doesn't stop talking, which will definitely make you insane while simultaneously entertaining your children. To its credit, he does say quite a bit before you hear him repeat himself. The game modes are actually impressive and will give preschoolers added entertainment. Soft and cuddly, this doll poses no harm to your youngsters and regardless of what you may or may not think of Elmo (some find him endearing, others find him grating, I'm somewhere in the middle with him), they will assuredly be quite pleased with him.

What you get here is a cute little night light that is soft and squishy plastic and shaped after Frozen's Olaf, the lovable snowman. It doesn't come with the required AAA batteries it needs to work properly but that's not a big deal, just know that you're going to need some when purchasing this. I think this night light works well for the most part as the light is just bright enough without blinding anyone, it turns off and on easy enough and is perfect for kids who want just a bit more security than the night light plugged into the wall on the other side of the room.

Rough and rugged, this weather resistant slipcover is perfect for keeping your outdoor furniture pretty safe and secure from the elements. Elastic loops ensure that this cover will not get blown away during windy days and it's waterproof, keeping rain and snow off. Machine washable and pretty durable, this slipcover comes recommended.

Bought this for my wife as a Mother's Day gift from our two sons and she loved it. Both festive and well crafted, this mug makes a perfect gift for any of the Moms in your life, whether she's your own or someone else's.

What you see in the product page is what you get. It's an adorable and festive little mug that celebrates the Grandma in your life. I bought this for my own mom as a Mother's Day gift from my own two children and she thought it was the best thing ever. The purchase was immediately deemed worth it when her face lit up and really, what more could you ask for? Whether a tea drinker or coffee drinker, this mug will be sure to make Grandmas everywhere happy.

Like their pants, these shorts from Dickie's are tough and durable and guarantee extended length of use due to this. They fit my child perfectly and he seems to find them pretty comfy. Recommended, especially for school use if shorts are allowed.
Pretty much removes nail polish the moment it makes contact. As it should! Works equally well on gloss and glitter based polishes also. Highly recommended.

If your child needs beige uniform pants, this offering from Dickie's is more than suitable. They fit my child as expected and with reinforced knees, guarantees a longer stretch of use. They are made from strong material and best of all, provide the toughness and durability needed for a young child's clothing.

Sensible while still being tasty, Milo is a great and nutritional beverage that tastes pretty good and provides children with a host of necessary nutrients to keep them going. We use this daily and my kid loves it. The kind of product that puts you at ease when you take its nutritional value into account.

Love the art style, love the characters, love the story and most importantly, my five year old LOVED it. This is a great little graphic novel with eye popping artwork and a great story that rarely pauses to catch its breath. Exciting and fun to read, this book should go over well with young readers who have a taste for action adventure.

A good basic nude palette that will fit the bill for most of your needs, especially in regards to the cost but if you're looking for something with a higher pigmentation to it, you may want to go with the Naked1 or Naked 2 from Urban Decay.

Oscar has become King of the Peep Peeps in our home, the Peep Peeps being a gaggle of stuffed Ty brand owls who keep my younger son company most days. In fact, we don't even call him Oscar, we call him Daddy Peep Peep due to the fact that he's like twice the size of the normal sized Ty animals. He's soft and plushy but holds stature due to his size and piercing bluish purple eyes. We love Daddy Peep Peep and so does our son. Chances are you and your children will as well.

Spicy Thai styled red curry sauce that gives you plenty of kick with every bite. It's a pretty good sauce and tastes authentic enough to use in Thai inspired dishes or just winging it. This is pretty much a restaurant sized bottle of the stuff, which you'd probably find in the pantry of a professional's kitchen, so that's all you need to be wary of as this isn't exactly something for a one person household, unless they absolutely love red curry sauce that much that they're using it three times a day.

This rack is well made, but it strikes out on several fronts.  First, the instructions are terrible.  As others have mentioned some of the hardware is referenced incorrectly.  Also, the instructions are sparse and there are no illustrations for each step.Second, it took a lot of customizing to get this rack to fit properly a 700 bike.  The seat braces are too short  even at their longest position, putting the rack a few inches under the seat (even with the seat full forward).  And even on the lowest setting, the axle brace sits too high, which makes the rack sit 3-4" above the tire and puts it out of level.  Shortening the brace doesn't solve the problem because the bottom mount is so wide that it interferes with the bike frame.Third, the hardware is sparse and doesn't quite work out of the box.  Some of the bolts are two narrow in diameter, while others ended up being a little short.Finally, mine was missing the reflector.In sum, a nice product with great potential if only they had paid more attention to the details.  Just making the braces slightly longer and providing a wider range of bolts would make it much easier to install and fit.
This basket uses plastic for the top bracket, which is a non starter for anyone looking for a durable basket that will hold more than a beach towel.
As many reviewers have noted, body fat and hydration readings fluctuate wildly even after subsequent readings taken minutes apart.  I've see body fat double and hydration change by 20-30%.

Amazon shipped this mat folded instead of flat, and as a result it was unusable.  This is a fairly thick plastic and once it is folded it retains the shape and is impossible to make flat again.  I'm actually amazed they were able to fold it given it's thickness.  It must have taken 2-3 people and a lot of effort to do this.
Awesome speakers, especially for the price.  Too bad they've been discontinued.

My expectation in buying this lock is that would provide at least equivalent security and greater convenience with features such as auto lock and unlock.  However, most of its features are unreliable, often resulting in an unsecured home.  This lock works like a development prototype, and is not suitable or convenient for safeguarding a home or business.  Among the major defects:* Sometimes the lock unlocks itself without any command from the user.  We ended up locking the door knob lock as a backup, but this negates the convenience of having this lock.* The lock sometimes powers off and will not appear in the August app on any device, requiring a key for entry.  Removing and reinserting the batteries restores power, but again this negates the convenience of a smart lock.* Auto-lock takes too long to engage (30 seconds minimum).  Given the lock's lack of reliability in other areas, I never felt secure enough to simply walk away and let the lock do its job.  Another problem with auto-lock is that this lock is not smart enough to know when the door is actually closed, resulting in the deadbolt slamming against the door frame several times a day.* It takes too long for the app to find and connect with the lock (minimum 10 seconds, but sometimes as long as 20-30 seconds).  Again this makes the lock less convenient that a traditional lock because one has to be proactive in firing up the app to get ready to leave.* The auto-unlock worked only 90% of the time, which is actually much better than other reviewers' experiences, which are as low as 25%.  However, auto-unlock uses position services in your phone and consumes a lot of battery.  My battery consumption was twice as high as without the August lock running in the background.* This is more of a manufacturer privacy issue, but August requires you to take pictures of your front door and yourself to use the app.
Toner is fine, hate the requests for feedback that follow every single purchase.
Great bulb, especially for use with a dimmer, but unfortunately very expensive.

0:28 Mins These LED lights are not appropriate for use with a dimmer despite what the manufacturer alleges.  As seen in the slow motion video, the Triangle LED bulbs flicker intensely when dimmed.  Compare with the second LED bulb, which is a much more expensive, but better performing, GE 66137.  The flickering is obvious when dimmed less than 50% of full brightness.

This mount is sturdy, but as other reviewers have noted, when the mount is adjusted to extend, tilt, or swivel the tv left or right, the tv will go out of level up to 2 degrees.  This is very noticeable, and unfortunately cannot be easily adjusted as leveling the tv requires loosening 4 screws in the back of the mount.  Because of this I have relegated this mount to being just a static mount.
Bulb is not dimmable.
Worked perfect to seal a leak in a 20 year old tub.  Note that this gasket is flat not beveled.
Great wallet, specially at this price point.  The thinnest wallets I've come across, yet it easily accommodates half a dozen credit card.
This dimmer flickers on low settings with LED bulbs, and sometimes at mid settings.
Awesome lights, easy to install.  Compatible with LED GU10 bulbs.  You will reed a 3 7/8" hole saw for the install.
Very cheaply made and uncomfortable.  Feels like bare plastic on your ears.

Compared to my old 2270DW, this printer has worse print quality, with pages often coming out much lighter.  Also, there are fewer configuration options on the control panel, and there is no way to adjust the print quality beyond the DPI setting.The only reason I upgraded was the AirPrint function, but it is so difficult to set up and finicky that I've ended up connecting a USB cable.  The one touch setup is a cruel joke as it does absolutely nothing, but give warnings that it was unable to connect to the network.
As other reviewers have noted, it does not automatically switch inputs when used with Apple TV.

Sound and comfort are ok, but it only lasted a year before the left earphone stopped working. The problem is that the wires to the earphones pass through the area where the headband bends.  Each time the headphones at folded, the wires are weakened until they eventually fail.

This keyboard is extremely cheap looking and flimsy, even at its price point.  The keys feel like they are loose.  Also, this keyboard lacks adjustable feet to adjust the incline, which is a big issue on this keyboard because it sits almost perfectly flat.  Another annoyance is the incredibly blue power LED that is constantly on.  I'm not sure why this is necessary (if the letters appear when I type then it must be "on").I am not exaggerating when I say that in 30 years of typing this is by far the worst keyboard I have ever used.  This one is going back to Amazon.

There is a terrible lag between a keyboard input and the character appearing on the screen, sometimes nothing happens at all.  Some reviews have indicated that this happens when using a USB 3.0 connection for the dongle, but switching to 2.0 hasn't made a difference, nor has leaving the keyboard out to charge in direct sunlight.  The issue is most noticeable after the keyboard hasn't been used overnight.
This does not work on a Mac, and for whatever reason H&R Block does not offer a Mac version of this.

As if it wasn't bad enough that intuit makes people buy the SAME exact software each year, now intuit has crippled the functionality of the basic version to force people to pay more money for the premium version by eliminating common schedules used by virtually every small business owner.  Two thirds of reviewers rated this release one star for a reason Bob.  Listen to your customers for a change.

Buyer beware.  Intuit's business model is based on selling upgrades.  After 4-5 years, QuickBooks will require you to upgrade to continue using core features such as creating PDF invoices, accessing bank account online, and even accessing company accounts created with older versions.  If you don't, the version you paid a few hundred dollars for will be rendered an expensive check register.Another issue is setting up bank accounts.  I spent hours trying to set up my online account at one of the largest banks in the world, and all I got was error messages blaming the issue on my bank.  When I tried to connect to my bank account using a different accounting package, it connected instantly without any hassles.In 1998, when i first bought QuickBooks it was the only game in town.  Today, there are a dozen better alternatives such as Wave Accounting, FreshBooks, and others, which are free or nearly free, work right the first time, have more user-friendly interfaces, and won't be rendered obsolete after a few years.
Fantastic little bag for the money!  Much larger than I expected.
Fantastic deal, high quality collar stays.

Great performance, and easy to install if you are familiar with networking.  Those who don't know what an IP address is will find it very frustrating because the instructions are terrible, and geared more towards IT people.  Some functions are not even documented in the manual, such as the repeater function.After a few days of internet research and fiddling with these units, I was able to extend a wireless network about 1,000' from the main router using two of them as WDS access points.  Note that the limitation in a wireless network is the client (smartphone, tablet, etc), which generally are limited in power due to FCC regs.  An iPhone will generally transmit up to 400' line of sight, and maybe 200' indoors, so while you may see full signal strength from the access point, the access point may not receive anything from the client.  Therefore, these work best if placed within 400' of each other so that the clients are never more than 200'.To install a WDS network using two or more of these units you will have to do the following for each unit:1. Disconnect your computer from your existing network2. Connect each Engenius unit to your computer and log in to the admin panel at 192.168.1.13. In IP Settings: (i) change the IP to one within your home network domain (if your router is 10.0.1.1, then pick 10.01.xxx), where xxx can't be the same as another device, and (ii) change the default gateway to the IP address of your router (usually ends in .1)4. In System Properties, set the mode to WDS > Access Point5. In Wireless Settings: (i) set the Channel HT Mode to 20 Mhz, (ii) set the Channel to a one that is not used or little used in your area (this channel must be the same on all access points).  The SSID does not have to be changed or be the same in both units.  I found it easier during testing to make them different to be able to tell which I was connecting to.6. In WDS Link Settings set the MAC Address to the WLAN MAC address written on the back of the OTHER unit7.  After you make all these changes, you have to click Save and Apply all changes in the Status menu, and wait for the unit to reboot.8. Repeat for the other Engenius unit(s)9. Connect your computer to your w-fi network, connect all Engenius units into your router, and try logging into each using the new IP addresses you assigned.10. If Step 9 works, disconnect one of the units from the router and attempt to connect to it using the SSID for that unit.11. If Step 9 or 10 don't work, do a hard reset on both units by pushing the rest button for at least 10 seconds, and try again.  These units are finicky and it took a few tries to get them to work.

Fantastic little bag for the money!  Much larger than I expected.

This is a very comfortable shirt.  Of course, there is no reason for it not to be.  It is very roomy.  It is a very nice weight fabric and looks good on.  I am 5'2'' and 95#.  The shoulder seams are dropped.  It hangs about 2'' below my waist.  The sleeves come 1'' above my elbow. The neck is loose but not dropped.  I like it so much I just ordered my second one.  The embroidery is very well done and the cat is Cute.

I Love this system, however the bucket is just a plastic bucket, the mop is just a mop.  BUT, the water extractor is ingenious.  The reason I say this is because you can extract as much--or as little--water as you want.  Here's how I do it.  Get the mop well saturated and plop it into the wringer cup.  Turn it a little clockwise and press down.  Turn it a little again and press.  Keep doing this until it is as dry as you want.  And, your hands Never touch water.The mop head picks up everything.  I have 3 cats and always have plenty of hair--and litter-around.  It magically disappears.  And the head unscrews very easily for washing.  And the bucket and mop are very easy to carry around.  The only thing I would add is wheels.  But I love this system.
These polka dots are great.  They stick--to a plastic ottoman that cats jump on, Very well.  And very easy to work with,  And stay in place.
As soap dishes go, this is a nice one.  I am not, however, using it for soap.  Just as a catch-all dish.  But it works.
Very tasty bars.

It is a nice shade of green, but certainly not blue, as I would think "sky" is.  I have had this same brand towel, in a different color, for several years and they have held up well for me.  I like the texture of the slub and think the look is interesting.  Just don't put them next to something blue and you might be happy with them.

So with the help of a can of Design Master flat black spray paint, I made it black.  It looks perfect  They look great as decorative pieces, holding wire balls.

The shams are ample size.  The toss pillows=====well I opted to use my own.  But it looks great in the room and just blends with grays or blacks or whites.  I am very happy with it.

I have used Shark vacuums for many years  and have loved every one.  However, this upright is my favorite.  It is so user friendly and glides over carpeting with ease.  The Only thing I do not like is--if you are in the middle of a room and want to turn it off and leave it unattended for a minute , because it is top heavy, you have to lay it down.  It does not stand alone.  The attachments are really great and the mini attachments fit in the tiniest places.  My dryer vent has never been so clean.  I would recommend this model to everyone.

So easy to work with.  Just peel and stick.  Mine went on the lid of the ottoman that my cats use to get on to the window seat.  These dots stick very well.  And they look great.  And ccut easily.  I am very pleased
