So there is something wrong the the circuit or LED, and I am returning it.I did not give this a 1-star even though it was defective, because at least it seemed to be of good quality.It came in a nice tin can (like Altoids). It also came with an attachment ring and a spare O-ring.Attachment ring hole sticks out the rear, so it cannot stay upright -- this is a big negative. Flat rear is better, especially the one with a magnet.

The idea of staking into the ground is good, but it sticks out too high and very noticeable.You have to twist the tab to break the seal so that ants can get in, but that action also often pops open the green outer packaging. The seal does not break off nicely.The package I received was leaking and it even came crawling with ants, presumably from the warehouse. The good news is that ants are attracted to it, but the bad news is that ants were not dead.

This is a highly visible clock with large digits (about 3cm tall). I really like it on a desk.As it typical for a digital clock it is a pain to set the alarm time.The time display can be switched from standard 24-hour to 12-hour am/pm format.The temperature scale can be switched from Celsius to Fahrenheit.

What I received was a different version. Not sure if I received the wrong item or if the description is for a different item.It was still a good item, so it did not matter to me, but here is what was different:1. No cigarette lighter plug. This item should be hard-wired, so no big deal.2. Instead of two push button switches, mine was capacitive touch in the front.3. It came with 2 thermistors, for inside and outside temperature.The clock display is in standard 24-hour clock. The brightness is adjustable. Temperature display is in Celsius.What is really nice about this unit is that voltage, temperature, and clock can be calibrated for accuracy.It did not come with English manual, so here it is:When not in setup mode, touching the right side of the display will scroll through the following display modes: Time, Date, Outside temperature, Inside temperature, VoltageTouch the left side of the display at any time to go into setup mode.While in setup mode, touch the right side of the display to optionally adjust the value.After adjusting the value, if any, touch the left side of the display to go to the next setting.minute:  00-59.hour: 00-23date: 1-31month: 1-12year: 2012-2050Ac: RT0 temperature correction (longer outside wire), -5 ~ 5 CAC: RT1 temperature correction (shorter inside wire), -5 ~ 5 CU: voltage correction, -0.5 ～ 0.5 VAd: time correction, in seconds per 24 hours, -9～9 seconddd：diplay cycle through the following 0: time, outside temperature, inside temperature, voltage 1: time, outside temperature, inside temperature 2: time, outside temperature, voltage 3: time, voltageLL:  brightness, 1(darkest) ~ 22(brightest)
I am an adult with small feet. This fits comfortably and easy to put on.

The transmitter is in a weatherproof case and is well made. 8 DIP switches control the security code, and 2 more switches control the chime sound selection. I am glad to see it using four CR123A batteries -- certainly better than regular alkaline batteries, yet standard enough to get easily and cheaply. It works on 433.92 MHz.The sensor coil is buried in the ground. It picks up magnetic field change, so only vehicles trigger it. You can move a hammer or a large metal can to test trigger. It should be installed far away from the main road to avoid triggering by large trucks.At first, the receiver did not work for me at 1000 feet. It started working reliably once it was moved high on the wall and mounted vertically.There is a LED for each of the 4 zones and the number of blinks can show the number of triggering. Each has separate relay for easy external control. The terminal block makes connection easy.Now the negative points (besides being much overpriced)...The receiver has 3 function buttons, simply labeled A, B, and C. They control LED, beep, and exit delay. They could have labeled them as such. There are 16 jumpers which are also tersely labeled. They do not even document them in sequence (example: they explain button C before button A). Not everyone will use these buttons or jumpers, but they could have made this unit so much more user friendly. Aaarg!For the price they charge, they could have provided an extra sensor probe so that alarm is only triggered on incoming vehicle and not the outgoing. They do provide this button to disable the sound for 5 minutes, but that is not the same thing. And you have to remember which button does that. :-(

Just the right size for occasional use. I use it to grease my riding lawn mower and tractor.People complaining of leaking should make sure to remove the foil cover from the cartridge completely. Any tiny particle going into the gun can cause a pump failure or leak.If it does not pump, you may have inserted the cartridge upside down. It will work either way eventually, but doing it properly makes it easier. The foil side goes to the top of the gun. The open side goes into the rubber plunger. The foil side is packed and has no air, so the suction works to pump immediately. Otherwise air has to bleed out for the pump to work, which is why some people suggest leaving the top loosened a bit at first.It can also suction load from a bulk grease container if you do not want to use a 3oz cartridge. Cheaper, but messier in my opinion.It becomes difficult to detach from a connector if you overfill. You need to stop pumping immediately once the pressure build-up is felt. This is how Zerk connector works. If it does not detach, unscrew the nozzle to relieve the pressure which will let it detach.Some grease fittings are difficult to reach. I would think most people would want to use a flexible hose with this grease gun.

It works for me. I use it like a pill at eating time instead of pre-treating milk. It is just easier for me to use liquid drops rather than pills. Only a drop is needed for me if I can use a blender, like for milk. Otherwise 2-3 drops are needed for me, like for ice cream.What I don't like is the high price. Not that it is expensive compared to others, but something like this costs so little to mass produce.

Worked fine as a XBMC/KODI box. If that is all you want, then it works well and at a great price.The IR remote was terrible... it would often double each keystroke, so it was impossible to enter the WiFi password. Workaround was to use a USB keyboard, though that defeats using it wireless. Get an AirMouse or something like it instead. I believe this remote was defective because it would work correctly from time to time, then start erratically again a while later. I have other Android TVs and they do not have this issue, so it is not a problem with stray IR in the room.Where it fails is as an Android device. It comes with a shell that might be easier for some people instead of a standard Android desktop. It is not well customizable and makes it more tedious to use. Many functions fail, such as setting the keyboard layout even though it keeps bugging you to set it. And OTA update function fails also.The item description claims you can download virtually any app from the playstore, but the store does not list many popular programs such as Candy Crush. SlingPlayer also could not be found. The problem may be that the box is set to Shanghai location and it cannot be changed, even though it correctly locates me in USA using WiFi. They provide an APK installer so looks like it is possible to copy from another box, though.Other than the bad IR remote and/or receiver, the box itself worked well. Perhaps a firmware update or a custom ROM would solve all the issues.

This is basically equivalent to Netgear GS108NA and even looks the same. This is much cheaper and performs the same.This is one of the best non-managed gigabit switches, and at a good price.The metal case is sturdy and well shielded.Both LEDs on each port shows activity by flicker duration. Green LED is for gigabit connection. Amber LED is for 10/100 mbs.There is no way to distinguish 10 and 100 mbs (as can be done in GS108NA).Mounting screw holes are cut in such a way that wall-mounting can only be done with RJ45 connectors facing up or to the right.Many devices are ceiling mounted in my house, so this was a big negative for me. Not all TP-Link models are this way, so the inconsistency is strange.The power supply is 9v 850ma. I would have preferred more standard 5v or 12v (which can be run off of a car battery).Its dimensions are tad too wide (32.5mm) to fit side-by-side with others in a crowded outlet strip.

This sure is better than using a separate vacuum pump because of one-hand operation.A good alternative to those expensive powered vacuum pump unit for occasional users.It takes several minutes to heat up and 30W is just enough for electronic components.Hard to beat it for the price.

These are good quality clips. The wires are 20AWG and sturdily attached.These are mini, not micro, size. They can attach to IC pins, but not when many legs are attached because the wire size and the weight.

Pros: It works well as a cultivator, similar to a Mantis. It is has a bit less power and a bit less effective, but there is a great benefit of not having the hassle of mixing oil/gasoline nor the maintenance issues. Overall, I prefer this over similar size gasoline models.Cons:The handle is too long and not adjustable. The handle could be flipped backwards, but it is still too long for me (5' 4").The wheels are good for moving it to a location, but it gets in the way while the machine is in use. I worked around the problem by installing the wheels upside down which allows for digging deeper and also acts as a carrying handle.I have several GreenWorks products and this is the first one I was disappointed.

Not good as a security bit because the hole is off-centered. Looks like someone just drilled the center hole manually after the bits were made. Seems there is no quality control... some bits may fit, others do not.The shanks are of quick-change type, but some are not made properly and do not lock in.Having said that, these are OK as a standard, non-locking, non-security, bits. The length is good and the price is right.
I lost the original cable for a USB external CD-RW drive and this was a good replacement.For the purchased 1-foot version, the signal-leg is black, and the power-leg connector is conveniently in red.

It is the only Z-Wave device that can handle digital and analog signal via Z-Wave parameters. The trigger point is flexible and has hysteresis-like range adjustments.I use it with Vera2 and Vera3 with CdS photo cell to monitor LED brightness on various devices to check for their status.Unfortunately they do not make it easy to program the parameter values. It shows the analog value in 4-digit decimal, yet it has to be converted to 2-byte hex and drop the low byte and use the high byte as the only byte. Not very user friendly.

It protects the iPad nicely with a good quality leather. It fits both Air1 and Air2.The pockets are nice to keep some notes.The bad part:The cover is thicker than most, though, which sort of defeats the thin design of iPad Air.The screen cut-out is the exact size, but the thickness of the leather prevents touching the very corners of the screen. So It is difficult to touch the often-used upper left corner. You will want to notch the corners a little bit using a hole-punch.

Works well to sharpen metal knife razor-sharp, but it takes time.You put in the stone, then find the blade angle, then hone. Flip the blade, and hone. .Then put in the finer grit stone, adjust the angle, then hone, flip the blade, and hone.Keep putting in the finer stone, and repeat.It may be OK if you have a lot of the same knives because then you can do all of them for each step as a batch.For my sharpening needs, Smith's 50185 Jiffy-Pro Handheld Sharpener works good enough and so much quicker.

The probe is good with sharp point and an indentation for a steady connection.The bad part is the plug that is too loose to make a good contact. Its soft insulation is not helping the situation because it deforms a little bit and preventing complete insertion into VOM. May be a quality issue, but what I received is not good for a regular use.

I use this with NuTone vx1000 central vacuum which does not have an electric power head.This air-powered turbine lets me clean carpet far better than their stock head.There is no way to turn off the power head, so it is probably not good for hardwood floor though.

Great replacement for florescent tube. It is not a direct replacement, but requires simple rewiring of removing existing ballast.It has such a long life that further replacement may never be needed.It takes a second to light up, regardless of temperature. So, in warm weather, this lights up a second later after the regular florescent tube.In the winter time, the florescent tube takes many seconds to light up, so this LED is quicker and safer.This tube is clear, so the individual LED bulbs can be seen and looks nice. Get the frosted ones if you prefer the florescent look.

All these plastic battery cases break after a while from cracks or contact corrosion. This is a good replacement for many devices and extend their life. I replaced quite a few of them with great success.

I use this with NuTone Vx1000 central vacuum which is air-only (no electric head). It works good on hard floor, but it does not do a good job on carpet even though it supposed to work on both. I would not recommend this for carpet use. For carpet only, Cen-Tec floor turbine works on air power and that works far better.

This review is for the 18-inch one. Marking is sharply engraved, but on the light side.It is about 0.02 inch thick and a bit too flexible for my needs.The scale does not start at the edge, so it is not good for measuring from inside corners.

I use it on laptop and desktop PC to provide a second monitor. Spec says 1920x1080, but I am using it 1920x1200 without any problems.I have other DisplayPort to VGA adapters as well, and they all seem to work well.

Works great on Lenovo ThinkCentre to provide a second monitor. I am using at 1920x1200 without any problems.Plug-and-play. It just works.Update: I did not notice this at first, but the display is not as sharp as another adapter (https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00K49SZTK/ref=oh_aui_search_detailpage?ie=UTF8&psc=1). The difference is only noticeable when reading text.

They are generic batteries, not the pictured UB1280 and they have the wider F2 connectors and not F1. They do not come with  F2->F1 adapters, so I had to buy them separately. Otherwise these batteries replace UB1280 perfectly at a good price.They are not rated for high drain use as in 1KW UPS using HR1234W, but they work fine for lower power.

Works well to convert larger F2 terminal to smaller F1.It would have been better a better design if there were holes on both ends of the connector for testing (with wire or probe).Minor irritation: It is overpriced because it is one of those items that cost more to package and ship and to produce. But they could provide more connectors for the same price.

It is OK for a daily paper, but not quite big enough for Sunday paper.This one attaches to the Liberty mailbox and not good for use by itself or to use with another brand because of its mounting mechanism and the opening at its back. If it was not for the big cut-outs in the back this box can be used for other projects.

The clear tubes and some other LED brands do not look close enough to florescent ones that they look funny when you just replace some of them, so these frosted ones are perfect when migrating to LED gradually.It is not economical to proactively migrate unless the lights are on long enough to justify the electrical savings, so I replace them as they burn out. One exception is in the garage where florescent tubes take too long to light up in cold weather. There, I put a couple of these LED tubes that come on in a second. The rest are still the old florescent tubes that come on later but I now have enough light for safety.A quick re-wiring (basically bypassing the old power-robbing ballast) is needed to install these tubes, but it is simple and they provide tombstone connectors to accomplish it. With longer life, I should not have to ever replace these tubes.

It is almost as powerful as an AC-powered unit and it is hard to believe that it is only powered by a battery.Works great on fresh snow up to about 6 inches high. Any deeper, it becomes impossible to push.It is not self-propelled, and the small wheels are not that effective, so use it before the snow gets too deep.The biggest weakness is that the blade is all plastic and does not work at all on ice.The lever at hand conveniently rotates the chute left-right with only a 180-degree twist. The height angle needs to be adjusted at the nozzle, but that does not need to be changed often.Battery lasts at least 30 minutes. It is good to have other G-MAX devices that can share the battery.I have high-end gasoline powered snow blower, but I prefer to use this because it is so light, quiet, and quick to use.One minor issue is the LED switch is too small to operate with a gloved hand. Even if you can, the gloved hand cannot feel the "toggle" and half-way turned-off switch can snap back on and drain the battery.

Good story and good music. You can really appreciate the story and how the songs came about.Go see the Broadway show, if you can. The live music is better, of course, but I thought the stage show told the story better.

Works amazingly well reducing calluses. Bottom of my feet is completely smooth after a couple of use. I used it dry instead of soaking the skin first because I wanted to feel where the rough skin was and can hear it work by the sound, too.I think it would work even better if the files were concave to conform to the heel rather than convex, but it works well enough.

Good chocolate. Better than other chocolate coins, but not a great Belgian one.The coins are Kennedy half-dollars and quarters.The tin is perforated in two corners so you can see through the can. However, that weakens the structure and easily deformed, so it really  does not work well as a coin bank which gets too heavy.It looks nice, though, for gift giving.

It is small, but kind of awkward to hold its short stubby body.It has 3 intensities. It is not much brighter than my other 100 lumen flashlight, so the claimed 250 lumen may be overstated.On the plus side, its magnetic base works well. Not too many LED lights have magnetic base, so this one of the few reason to get it.

Easy to install as it is a direct replacement of a regular florescent T8 tube. No re-wiring needed.Not necessarily bad, but there were a couple of things I did not care for.The color is a bit off, with purplish hue. The other is that the end pieces apparently contain electronics and are about 1.5 inches long, which reduces the lighting portion by 3 inches. Both issues are only noticeable when compared to other florescent tube, though.I prefer the Hyperikon tubes which require a one-time re-wiring but has lower cost and brighter.

Works great on all glass surfaces to repel water. Lasts longer than RainX.Reduces wiper usage and the blades last longer, though there is no final dollar savings due to cost of this treatment but I see better out of the windshield.I also use this in shower door and it prevents calcium water spots from forming. Indoors, it lasts about a year and it is a great time saver.

I use this to monitor a senior who needs assistance. The pad is installed under bed, chair, couch, and door mat so I can tell when he wants to eat or needs help. It comes with a male RJ-9 connector and it is basically a normally-open switch. I just connect it to a Z-Wave door/window switch and it works well.

It is comfortable to wear and the battery lasts at least 10 hours (spec says 12).The sound is very good.It works as an unpowered headphone, too.Over-the-ear design is great for outdoor use as it cuts down on noise.Some problems for my use:1. With some Bluetooth transmitters the sound was too loud and could not be made lower. Its lowest volume setting is "mute".2. There is no battery-level indication, so you cannot tell if it is charged enough for the day. I wish it would speak the remaining charge as with Plantronics. The battery is very easy to change. One would have to purchase an universal charger, though, to charge separately.3. You have to speak pretty loud for the microphone to activate when used as a headset.Update: The USB connector on the headset broke after a year. I have seen this happen on other charge ports from repeated insertion. I wish it had a wireless Q-charging capability.

Basically it is a thin white shelf-liner with adhesive. You can write on it with a dry marker and it erases easily.I got this instead of a regular whiteboard because I did not want to put a nail in the wall to mount.This sheet does not look as nice as a regular whiteboard, but this is removable.You can make any flat surface writable with this. I even put this on electrical panel so I can write notes about circuit breakers.The backing paper has square grids printed in centimeters and the sheet is easily cut with scissors to desired size.It comes with a dry marker. No eraser, but you can use anything to erase it -- tissue, finger, etc. No water needed.Unfortunately mine came with a wrong instruction -- "Window Film Installation", so I thought they sent the wrong item.It looked like the wrong item, too, until it was unrolled. Ignore it. It is just a peel-and-stick. No water sprayer or squeegee needed.

This Quad sensor is identical to the Trio version externally. Internally, the main difference is the addition of PIR and DIP switches.The magnetic door, light, and temperature sensors are the same.The device is compact and well made. It has many Z-Wave configuration parameters. The firmware needs work, however.Trio unit was good, but this Quad with PIR has false triggering issues and the firmware does not effectively address PIR and reed function in combination.The magnetic reed switch is located at both sides of the body and either one makes the contact, so it is convenient but the actuation can be defeated by placing a magnet on the unused side.The documentation has much details, but written in such a way that makes it a bit difficult to read and has errors -- not good in a technical paper.Main Pros: Lots of options, CR123A battery, relatively small size for multi-functionMain Cons: PIR has false triggering problem and does not always turn off. Difficult to open the case once it is mounted! Battery change is a challenge without removing the unit from the wall.It is a good unit for temperature and light-level reading, though there are other choices.For door-sensing only, Fibaro (with many options) or Ecolink/Schlage is better.

This Trio sensor is identical to the Quad version externally. Internally, the main difference is the lack of PIR and DIP switches on this unit.The magnetic door, light, and temperature sensors are the same.The device is compact and well made. It has many Z-Wave configuration parameters.The magnetic reed switch is located at both sides of the body and either one makes the contact, so it is convenient but the actuation can be defeated by placing a magnet on the unused side.The documentation has much details, but written in such a way that makes it a bit difficult to read and has errors -- not good in a technical paper.Main Pros: Lots of options, CR123A battery, relatively small size for multi-functionMain Cons: Difficult to open the case once it is mounted! Battery change is a challenge without removing the unit from the wall.It is a good unit for temperature and light-level reading, though there are other choices.For door-sensing only, Fibaro (with many options) or Ecolink/Schlage is better.
The mint pieces are large enough to give a good crunch, and the dark chocolate is tasty.Gift bag? Eh, it's just a plastic bag with a ribbon around it as can be seen in the photo.
It is only slightly cushioned, but better than plain ones.Good for the price.

I totally enjoyed these books - lots of sex, and that's okay for me sometimes.  I love all things New Zealand, so that is a big draw for me.  Each story is stand alone, but all friends - so you keep reading about the same people.  The writing was good, I totally enjoyed my little NZ getaway.

This is a fabulous thermometer, so happy to have a non-intrusive way to get temperature - it's great for my daughter with babies and young children!  Compared the reading from this to another thermometer and found it to be accurate.  Very happy with it.  I received this item free for review.

It is exactly what I expected, and I am very happy with it.  My husband has SO MANY hats around and it made me crazy.  Now I am crazy, but not because of the hats around the house!  I put these up on the back of our bedroom door in about 3 minutes.  Now all his hats are in one place, and can be seen so he can choose what he wants to wear.  Divine!

This is working for me!!! It collapses easily to hide, but holds lots of hanging clothes to dry when I need it. We also pack it to go to a relative's house where there is no place to hang our clothes in the room we stay in. Works great!

This is a nice product, it diffuses essential oils into the air. I was thrilled to be offered it in order to review. I had a couple of jars of essential oil that I wasn't using. The lights are cool too, they change colors and add a nice effect at night. The unit takes about a 1/2 cup of water and a few drops of oils, and goes for about 6 hours. It auto shuts off which is a great feature. There is a setting that allows you to control the amount of diffusion. The scent is not overwhelming, just adds a nice bit of fragrance to the air. Great product, I recommend.

I was offered this product in order to write a review, and jumped at the chance. I ordered this with my granddaughter in mind. Of course she has tons of bath toys and this works great. Nice strong suction cups keep it attached to the shower wall. The netting is nice and strong. So far I can say that this is a great product at a reasonable price. I like that it allows the toys to drain and dry so they don't get the nasty slimy feeling after sitting in water.  I recommend.

I bought these for travel since they squish down. We go on motorcycle trips and room is at a premium. These are great. I love the color too. It takes a bit of getting used to drinking out of these because you have to be careful not to squeeze hard or your wine erupts out! However, with great practice I am proud to say I have mastered it! I highly recommend and I expect I'll be buying more as stocking stuffers.I'm sure they'd be great for backpacking trips as well.
Good for my cat.  She was throwing up a lot so I switched to this food, and she does the throw up way less now, so I'll stick with this.

I love these sandals. I have 3 pairs of the Molokini and this is my first (but likely not last) pair of the Molokini II. They are seriously THE MOST comfortable flip flops. I have plantar fasciitis, and a very high arch. These fit so well that I can wear them for days on end and no pain. I don't take them off all summer.They aren't super fashionable but man they feel good. My daughter used mine on vacation for being in the kitchen for cooking and now wants to buy some.
These are beautiful earrings. Exactly what I wanted. I'll be buying more for Christmas gifts. Nothing cheap or flimsy about them.
I love this but it is a bit smaller than I expected.  Still very beautiful and I'll update the review once I wear it.

Gorgeous color.  I bought 3 Columbia shirts in one day in various shades of blue (can you tell it's my fav color?).  I love them all.  I really like the feel of this one, it feels a bit silkier than the others.  Nice fit, amazing color.  I'll enjoy this all year!

Cute bag, sturdy, nice plastic - easy to wipe down.  I used this to carry around my camera and lenses (inside of padded case), got compliments on it.  I love everything Blue Q.  It's always well made and cute.  This has a nice wide base and the zipper top is the same width, so easily closes when full.  Great bag.  Could use it for a carry on as well.  I love a zipper top for carry on so stuff doesn't fall out in the TSA xray machine, or under the seat, or in the overhead storage.  Highly recommended.

Great fit, great color, great product.  I bought this for light cover in the summer for traveling, hanging out in the sun all day, cover for the beach, really anytime.  I got exactly what I expected and am very happy with it.

I love Blue Q, can't get enough of it.  I bought this but then selflessly gave it to my Mom for a little treat, it reminded me of her when I first saw it.  The colors are beautiful, it's well made, great size - could fit a kindle in it.

This is really cute.  I originally bought it with by 11 year old granddaughter in mind, but my daughter thought she might not be ready to use it, and I really like it so I'm keeping it for myself!  So cute.  It'll hold cell phone, wallet, keys, lipstick, etc.  But not all the stuff I normally haul around.  So this will be great for times when I want to carry light.  Very cute pattern, exactly as pictured.

This was exactly what I expected, a cute little tote bag + a bonus small zipper pouch.  The small zipper pouch is a great size for holding license, cash, lip balm, etc.  The tote has a great pattern, with sand dollars on it (which I love), in cute bright color.  The tote bag is not huge, but certainly large enough to tote my essentials for a day trip, beach trip, or farmer's market.

Bought this for my husband.  He takes safety and survival seriously, so when he said this was the next survival gear piece he needed I was happy to buy it.  He goes out in the wilderness on his ATV and if he were lost or crashed, he could easily die.  So this gives me peace of mind.You test it, and register it with NOAA, and then hope you don't lose it.After 5 years, you send it back for a battery.If you use it, they replace it.I wanted to make sure that it really worked so I checked out the survivor club online.  Even found one for a motorcyclist that got stranded in my area (Sierra Foothills of CA), also found an ATV story.  So I'm satisfied that with this device we will avert many dangers.

I looked high and low for a crochet or lacy light jacket to wear over tanks for work.  I was so thrilled to find this, and now they are a dime a dozen - I see them everywhere.  But I am very happy with this.  Get compliments on it when I wear it, and it is a great, very light but cute cover for a sleeveless shell for work.  Very pretty daisy pattern.  Highly recommended!
Super cute, well made.  I love this dress.  Perfect length for me (5'4").  I liked it so much I just bought in blue and looking at the ivory one.  I highly recommend.

this is my absolute favorite color, so I was so thrilled to find it.Got it and so happy my Lenovo Yoga fits in it perfectly.  The zipper pockets outside hold the power cord, plug and dispay hub, and a cloth to wipe the monitor.At first I thought it was a bit weird to have the handles inside, but I don't mind a bit.  To use the handles, you just leave it unzipped for 4-5 inches.  Without handles it has a nice sleek look.This is a great little case, I'm so happy with it!

I bought this to carry my Canon T5i around in a tote bag without having it look obviously like a camera.  Will buy another one to hold lenses I think.  It serves its purpose for me quite well, and I appreciate that the top will fold down and give me great access to the container.  Then I can easily close it up - no difficult closures.Handy little padded container for my camera - exactly what I wanted.
My husband and I love bold coffee, and go through A LOT of it!  This coffee is really flavorful, and we love it.  Great price too.

This is really cool.  I had previously ordered a different model that I couldn't get to use with my computer AT ALL.  Had to send it back.  So I ordered this, and was attracted to the fact that it doesn't need any drivers.  It can scan to a card or just to its very small internal memory, then copied to the computer.I just use the internal memory.  Have years of 35 mm film negatives to scan, and I get about 24 pics (about one roll of film) before I run out of memory, and copy over to the computer.  It is fast and the scans are quite nice.  I'm very happy with this.I could use a card and not copy to computer as often, but frankly, I like this because I can put each roll into a folder by date/event.  I like that, so it doesn't bother me at all to stop and copy after each roll.I recommend this!
Nice bottles, I like the colors to keep track of what flavor you have in them.  Works well with the soda stream.

This is exactly what you'd expect, sturdy 5 gallon beverage dispenser, with a nice flat top that you can sit on.  Husband uses it outside in summer, and also for camping.  It is well made, keeps the beverages cold (nicely insulated), and the seat top is handy.  I recommend.

This is a big pillow, with some give but not lots.  I don't actually use it for sleeping on.  I'm a side sleeper and it is too tall for me.  I do love it for supporting my legs AND for leaning against when I am reclining or sitting in bed reading.  I can't comment on the 'stay cool' aspect, since I am not sleeping on it.  It does have a nice feel to it, and is pretty firm, so does what I want very nicely.

I read this not really sure what I would get, but thoroughly enjoyed it and it's sequel, Jack with a twist.  There's a fair amount of frustration with the heroine that doesn't 'get' that the true hero is right there, but I really liked her and the supporting characters.  An easy read, funny moments and nice characters that you care about.  I recommend!
Great story, I totally enjoyed.Some nice laugh out loud moments, clever dialogue, smart heroine and sweet hero.Brenda Janowitz goes on my fav author list.

So, I never really believed that radar detectors work.  I have a friend that is retired CHP (California Highway Patrol), and he told me that they don't work.  Then, in a conversation with a colleague she mentioned that she has a radar detector and that it works great.  So it was on my mind when the company asked me if I wanted to review this item.  I said yes, without cautious optimism, but no real expectation.So I drive a lot for work.  I have used this now for 4 weeks.  In that time I've covered the 80 miles between Santa Barbara and Santa Maria (highway 101) 6 times, and 300 miles between Sacramento and Paso Robles 2 times.  The detector has worked beautifully.  We've gotten a fair number of X and K signals, that I pretty much ignore.  However, each time we got a Ka signal, it was real.  And 2 times, on highway 41 and 46, we at first thought it was false because we looked around and saw no CHP.  But, in BOTH cases, there was a CHP and we were alerted so far in advance we couldn't see them for a bit.  It must have been picking up the signal they were sending to cars well ahead of us.  That is a 55 mile an hour road, and it's impossible to go that slow.  This really saved us.  I know that if there is no one ahead of you, and you get the radar pointed at you, it isn't going to save you, but in these 2 cases, it most definitely saved us by signaling when drivers well ahead of us were radared.I was very skeptical at first, but this has turned out to be a worthwhile little gadget.  Buying 2 for gifts now.

This is the best book you'll ever find if you want to write a White Paper. A truly amazing book that will take you through all the elements of a White Paper: structure, purpose, language, etc. Writing a White Paper is not as easy as one may think. I demands lots of rigor and a careful attention to style. This book will make that task a lot easier. Plus: it has many examples that make you understand every issue.RECOMMENDED.

I liked it very much.The only problem I see is that - as the title suggests - it needs better jokes. But above all, it needs a funnier protagonist. The ambitious kid that wants investment is too serious. He should be lighter and funnier in my point of view. A show about ventura capital in the tech biz is an amazing idea... but the bizz part only works if we care about those characters.

I liked this book because it makes an incredible case for something in which I've always believed: if you create an environment where it is the employee who has to make decisions - meaning that you share the responsibility of decision-making - you are creating an environment where those employees will thrive, bloom and excel.Obviously, in the real world, things are not so simple - that's why the approach is not so widespread in our corporate culture. However, this book takes a serious look at what it takes (risks and advantages - and how to address both) to build that environment.This book is valuable from beginning to end. Should be read by anyone with management and decision-making responsibilities.RECOMMENDED!

What can I say about this cover? It looks nice, it's nice to touch, seems to be well constructed and firm. Looks nice in my hands and when I take it out of my briefcase. The gridlock is good enough... and I liked the pattern and the shades of grey (laughs) and black. Another reviewer said it is expensive... it is true... but then again, all of those Kindle/iPad covers usually are expensive. I paid $70 for a leather cover for my iPad. This particular cover seems good enough considering the fact that I have seen Kindle covers (at Staples) that cost $10 less but appear to have only 1/5 of the quality.So I'd say I'm very satisfied.RECOMMENDED.

On the photo, it did not look so big. But then I saw another photo of a hand opening the door to the ink cartridges. And I said "OMG, this printer is a beast!". And I was right. It makes an A3 sheet of paper look like an A4. The box is huge enough to serve as a table and, boy, it is not light.But then you realize THIS IS NOT an average printer. This is the Rolls-Royce of printers. This is not the printer that a photographer will need... but one he/she will desire. This is a piece of hardware aimed at those who know what they are buying. The most amazing prints you'll ever see in a long time.Unboxing takes a lot of effort since the printer is big and heavy. You will have to have a table for it. It will not fit where normal printers usually are. But if you bought one, you already understood the central place it will take around your work. So I placed it is a nice spot, with a dedicated table where I keep the paper and other office material. I used the Ethernet cable to connect it to my router and the rest was not as hard as I thought.Installing the ink cartridges was easy enough. The printer comes with all the documentation you need and it is easy to follow. However, the printer will take some time to pump the ink through the tubes, test this, test that... and since I'm very slow, the whole process (from unboxing to printing the first photo) took me FOUR HOURS. But let me be clear... once I saw what it can do, well, it was north it!I would go as far as saying that there is nothing you cannot print with this printer.Every color, every finishing... glossy, more glossy, less glossy, more ink, less ink... everything that comes out of this printer is flawless... which can be good if you know exactly what you are doing or bad if you don't. I'm still getting used to what it can do... so I will take some time until I can truly take advantage of all the control this printer gives me. I do not use the Canon software. Like others, I print it directly from Photoshop.The printer is not fast. But at this level of quality you understand that four minutes to print one photo is exactly what you were looking for when you bought it. This printer knows what it is doing and makes no compromise.Needless to say, this printer will not replace my fast HP OfficeJet. The HP is a printer. The Canon Pixma Pro-1 is an Artist.I love this printer and couldn't be happier!NOTE: the printer takes a lot of ink on its FIRST use. But that's an illusion because the large amount of ink it takes from the cartridges is not used right away. Instead, it is feeding the tubes all the way to the print head. Meaning that long after you have replaced those cartridges, the ink arriving at the head will still be from the previous cartridges. They are expensive (and they are 12!) but with a fine piece of hardware like this one, I'd say it is stupid NOT to buy the Canon cartridges. Come on, you spent almost a thousand dollars on a printer and you are compromising its performance (and possibly its lifespan) by getting cheap on the ink?RECOMMENDED!!!!

A critical conversation can be many things: a customer who insists in complaining, a family member with a personal problem, an employee you must let go, a colleague who is damaging the group... all of these moments and many others are the subject of this book. And it is a great book because what is basically does, is to show you the common issues we all face when in those situations and what we can do in order to "have the conversation" and start solving the problem (whatever it may be). Typically, the book is aimed at the workplace... but you can easily learn enough here to use anywhere. That's why I liked this book so much.Those who are familiar to the "Dummies" series will not be disappointed with the tips, warnings and reminders that make the series so effective. In fact, this book also helps you to better prepare and conduct yourself for any conversation (more or less critical). So in a certain way, this book can be helpful to anyone even if one thinks "I never go into critical conversations". Well, we all do.RECOMMENDED.

This book is not about how to make friends (laughs). If it was, I'm sure Ms. Gale would make it a success. What this book does, however is to help you understand the power you have the moment you start building and using your network of friends, colleagues, family, acquaintances, employers, employees and all the different people that surround us.But more than that, this book teaches you to build and use a network efficiently, using the right tools at the right time, with the right people. In fact, I learned about things I thought were right, but turned out to be wrong - not to mention things I never thought about.Anybody who lives and work in a society could gain something from reading this book.RECOMMENDED!

This book will open your eyes to great customer care. In 39 simple chapters (built around his "rules"), Mr. Cockerell explain all there is to know about the subject. I confess some of those rules seem obvious. But it is only until the explanation that you discover that there is nothing obvious about anything regarding the way we deal with customers.And one more thing that makes this book so great is the apparently simple wisdom that seems to come from common sense. It looks like "just" common sense because Mr. Cockerell's language is so fluid, personal and friendly I felt nobody could explain those subjects better than him.This book should be read for anyone who handles customers and their managers. Plus, this book can do wonders if you are thinking about designing the policy regarding customer care on a company.RECOMMENDED!

The REAL content of this book would fit in 20 pages: all the possible definitions of strategy, its elements and what strategy is not. Then the author gives a few personal insights about how strategic thought works and that's it. 20 Pages at best.But of course this book is not just that. The idea is very nice: to create a duo of silly characters who keep on talking to each other about strategy. The problem is that those dialogues MUST be very funny and brilliantly comical - otherwise they are just a bore. Unfortunately, they are a bore. The fast dialogue exchanges were written by a specialist in strategy... BUT NOT by a specialist in BOTH strategy and comedy. So the whole concept of this book really disappointed me.Plus... pages and pages comparing BOEING and AIRBUS. Silly, pointless and superficial. At a certain point, I thought Boeing was a sponsor of this book since the author loves the Dreamliner (he looks like a kid in awe) while coming "this close" to say the A380 is as bad as a Ford Pinto. Really? Comparing the Dreamliner to the A380?All in all, I found this book irrelevant and out of focus - except for 20 pages of total content.

This book is roughly divided in two parts: the first (chapters 1 and 2) calls our attention to the importance of choosing the right verbs, the right words, the right posture and the right mindset BEFORE giving a speech or presentation. And it is the best part of the book. The second part is a list of the actual power verbs to be used.In my point of view, that list is short and the choice of verbs is left unexplained. Why are the verbs "mollycoddle" or "obnubilate" power verbs? Many of the verbs here are completely unknown. What's the power in a verb few people know what it means? There must be some explanation about why a certain verb is a power verb. But this book does not give it. In many cases, all we get is the verb, its meaning and one or two phrases where it is used.I was expecting something like: "Titivate" - this is a power verb because...... it has this meaning...... and you can use it like this...... and take more advantage of it like this.....But no.So from page 21 onwards I found this book a major disappointment.

I recently had the opportunity to choose 3 InstaNatural products to review for free in exchange for my honest review.  I chose Night Cream Moisturizer, Skin Brightening Serum & Retinol Moisturizer .  I thought this a nice mixture and selection to see if InstaNatural was worthwhile.  I chose the Night Cream Moisturizer for it's anti-aging & hydrating solution and to reduce as many fine lines and wrinkles as possible. I decided to use this product at night before bedtime.  I chose the Skin Brightening Serum to lighten any dark spots on my face and to also help even out my skin tone.  I also chose the Retinol Moisturizer as it is also an anti aging and fine line and wrinkle reducing moisturizer that repairs and restores and can be used day or night and helps even out your skin tone as well.  In the am, I would apply the Skin Brightening Serum and then top it off with the day or night Retinol Moisturizer.  I will add, if I was planning to go out into the sun - I would not use the Retinol Moisturizer for that outing - I would just use a moisturizer that does not contain Retinol.  Retinol itself does not make your skin more sensitive to the sun, but instead the ingredient Retinol itself is sensitive to sunlight.I used all 3 products for at least 3 weeks before bothering to write this review.  As with most beauty products, they are not miracle quick fixes. Did they wipe away 20 years of age?  NOPE.. However, from using these products it does appear my skin's look and feel overall is improved.  Do, I believe this enough to continue using the product?  YES, I will continue my regiment.  Of course, it's hard to go wrong as long as you use moisturizer period.  I wish I had of known that when I was 20.Worth Mentioning:  InstaNatural believes in their products - all of these have a lifetime 100% satisfaction guarantee or your full money back.  Marilyn

I couldn't resist a chance to review these labels.  I have miscellaneous things in my garage that immediately came to mind when I saw these.  Anything from gas containers,  gas containers with a certain oil mix, oil and certain other misc chemicals for cleaning purposes.  I have many times wished I had a way of labeling many of those containers.  It all seems simple when you are putting something in the container, but then as a little time goes by, it becomes a mystery container.  I have several of those currently.  Therefore, having labels that will stand up to whatever spills out from the container and remains readable is nothing short of miracle work and will do away with any future mystery containers.  I tried two sizes for different sized containers (2" x 4" & 3-1/2" x 5") and found both seem to work really well and appear to be durable.  These particular labels are for laser printers.  I'm guessing you could print from an inkjet, but doubt the ink would hold up to the chemical spills.  Also, worth mentioning is the fact that you can print these and many other label templates at avery.com - these particular ones are at avery.com/GHS.

I am not sure if the color difference symbolizes anything or not on these meters?  But, I ordered the blue and gray one that came with little case and lanyard.  The model is: 11-50D and it is the deluxe model.  I got it so that I could easily check on  my brother who resides in a nursing home.  He has COPD and his stats drop out easily.  It turned out that he went into the hospital right after I received it.  I actually, took it to the hospital with me and it is 100% accurate!  He was on a bipap machine and his oxygen and pulse were constantly being measured.  This little guy mimicked the expensive machines oxygen and pulse count without hesitation.  I was very impressed and happy that I purchased an accurate brand and type as their are so many brands and types out there these days.  What a great and reasonably priced product from Veridian Healthcare.

Garcinia Cambogia is very controversial.  Also, as with most supplements, it is very difficult to know exactly if they work or not as there is no true and accurate gauge for most.Per Webmd: "Garcinia is a small to medium-sized tree that grows in India and Southeast Asia. The fruit rind contains the chemical hydroxycitric acid (HCA) and is used to make medicine.  How does it work? Garcinia contains the chemical hydroxycitric acid (HCA). Developing research suggests that HCA might prevent fat storage, control appetite, and increase exercise endurance..."I've read that at least 60% needs to be HCA or it is ineffective.  Although wouldn't the mg of the pill factor into that equation?  As I stated earlier, it is a controversial supplement like many others.  I don't get too blogged down in the built up or hysteria of products.  If something interest me, I try it and if I "feel" or "think" it may be helping, then I may continue to use it.I am not really overweight and overall I do get some moderate exercise.  But, sometimes I get so busy I don't exercise and eat as well as I would like.  That is mostly why I take and try supplements in the first place.Overall Conclusion:  After trying this product I did feel that it did help control or suppress my appetite.  Which of course for me was the intended goal.  Therefore, I think it helps.  Is it the cure all for being overweight and should it be used for an exercise substitution?  NO

I have played with many photo editing software programs over the years.  This one is fairly straight forward and fairly easy to use.  I had to hunt and peck for awhile as I was new to it's layout.  But, overall after you see the breakdown, etc. it is not too hard to navigate.  It does have some powerful abilities, but in my opinion not as powerful as photoshop.  Although, it does allow layers to be built and merged which is similar to photoshop.  I did not see a quick way to control each layers transparency etc. as I am accustomed to in Photoshop.  I originally opened the program with a photo to edit and simply wanted to flip it horizontally.  I looked for a long time and only found a way to rotate it. Which is not the same at all.  While continuing to feel my way around in the program, I ended up importing another pic and then discovered that via layers, you could flip the pic. It will take a bit more exploring and learning the program's abilities to get the entire ease of it's use - but overall it does seem to be a strong and solid editing program for it's price range.

Overall, it is a well designed flexible and comfortable glove.  I tested this glove by using it to clean a piece of metal with steel wool. After a bit of work, I did notice that the end where my finger nail had given way and I did end up with dirt under my nail.  Other than that, it was great and kept my hands protected from the steel wool I was using to clean a piece of metal.  I was cleaning the insulation gasket from a metal part which contained fiberglass fibers.  The glove kept the insulation fibers from cutting into my hand.  They didn't make my hands sweat and had a lot of texture for gripping things which made them easier to use and more functional than the non textured slippery gloves.

Overall, it is a well designed flexible and comfortable glove.  I tested this glove by using it to clean a piece of metal with steel wool. It worked great until I did actually end up tearing it by catching it in a very sharp screw hole in the metal.  Although, up until I tore it - it was working great.  I was cleaning an insulation gasket from a metal part.  It kept the insulation fibers from cutting into my hand.  It didn't make my hands sweat and has just a touch of texture that make it easier to grip items when handled. Of course this glove is also latex free for those allergic.

This is actually very cool.  It needs to be assembled when you receive it, but it comes with nice pictured easy to follow instructions.  Once assembled it is very sturdy and it is also a self contained unit.  That means you can practically use it anywhere. You can place it in a filing cabinet or you can create a filing cabinet in a box or just set it on a desk or the floor somewhere.  This is a well thought out and well designed adjustable frame.  I highly recommend it!

Well the age old debate has always been Huggies vs Pampers.  I really think both brands have pros and cons.  However, these particular Huggies seem to work flawlessly with the leaklock design.  No side leaks and just enough middle area to hold the workload.  I can't say enough about how important that job is in the end.  The diapers are soft and flex to fit the babies form. The diapers are very absorbent and are great for night time with being able to keep the baby dry even though he had used the diaper. They are very soft on him and doesn't rub his skin red.  These are great - very soft and I love the Winnie Pooh graphics on them. I highly recommend these.

Bluedio Sports HeadsetThese buds fit very comfortably.  They come with various sized additional buds to ensure a good snug fit.  The sound quality sounds similar to the iphone ear buds.  The bass is pretty decent for this price range. They are not tinny either like other cheaper earbuds.  You can easily adjust the equalizer to more or less bass by pushing both volume adjustments at the same time. The sound controller buttons are good sized for quick access.  I actually can't say enough about that being a great feature as well. The fit and design are very good and should work well for most runners or other activities.  These buds were sent to me for my honest and fair review. 5 stars

Let me start with - the sound quality is excellent if your speakers are excellent as well.  However, the video receiver portion only functions via wired connections and even mirroring your device.  It does NOT work via any usb or home networking method.  All you get there is AUDIO or PHOTOS. I debated taking away a star for the lack of function there.  But, if you read the documentation carefully - it never actually says it can play movies, etc. thru the network - it only mentions sound quality, sound quality and sound quality.  Now personally, I think this is a shame as so many devices can use video in those methods.  Even my Samsung blu ray player can play movies via my network router media server, my shares via my tablet, phone & computer.  Also, of course being able to play a movie via a usb flash drive is again very common now and is doable on many non smart tv's as long as they are usb capable.  Therefore, I think this device missed some great features that just should be available for this price level of AV (audio/video) receiver.  If they had just announced this as an audio receiver, then perhaps I wouldn't be so disappointed in the lack of being able to play movies via a usb drive or networking drive.  That seems like a simple thing/function in this day and age - but yet this audio/video receiver device simply can't do it.Ok, so once I got past that expectation - the display interface isn't terrible as some suggested.  It's not beautiful, but functional.  It's a bit confusing at first, but doesn't take long to figure out some things.  Of course, reading the manual always helps a bit.  http://helpguide.sony.net/ha/strdn10686/v1/en/index.htmlI actually like how you can select watch, listen right from the remote and get to where you are going fairly fast.  Now granted if you are just interested in listening to some music and don't want to turn on the on screen display, you can use the songpal connected to your smart phone or tablet and it gives you almost the same options as the actual sony remote. Or if you are just interested in the radio - you can easily find that on the remote and not worry about the on screen display as well.  I have a projector setup instead of a tv - so this is an important feature to me.  I don't like wasting the bulb to just find some music etc. when it shouldn't be necessary.  I did install the songpal using the NFC function (bumping) and it paired flawlessly.HDMI ports:The video quality of the HDMI ports seem to do very well - even the mhl (Mobile High-Definition Link - smart phones, tablets etc.)  One more thing worth mentioning.  I did try the device mirroring and was actually able to play a movie without a lot of signal dropping and the audio and video was better than I expected.  Of course, it's not the same quality as connecting the device directly or even serving it to the media device via a media file server.Google Cast:It does cast AUDIO very nicely from almost anywhere back to the receiver within a google casting capable app.  Of course, if you want video, you will have to add your own Google Chromecast device to one of the hdmi ports.Overall - the sound and controls are excellent on this receiver.  I just wish it had more video receiving options as well as so many sound options.  If you do not care about all those other, extra ways to get video thru your network and instead just care about good quality sound and/or just connecting hdmi devices, then you can't go wrong with this receiver.

This is a great sound in some tiny earbuds.  The biggest pro was all the different sizes of buds, so no one is left behind.  I have small ears and that is usually always a deal breaker for me - finding anything small enough to be comfortable, etc.These buds are so classy they had to make a video of how to unpackage it. Seriously!  To be honest - yeh the unpackaging was a bit of a challenge - thank goodness I found that video in order to know how to open the package properly.Pros:-The sound from these buds is great-Bass is solid - exceptional actually if you have them in your ears properly-Fit is flexible-Battery life is good-Color options are very modern and niceCons:-The case is simply too big - make it smaller and you have a winner

This works great.  I've finished two full weeks of sessions now and feel I can see an improvement.Out of the box:You have to put the gel stickies on the pads to allow the electric impulses to work. This is a bit cumbersome to place them originally, but then it's no big deal to cover them up with the included plastic covers when you are not using them.  This is to ensure they stay clean, etc.  I've also read that you can use certain tricks (alcohol, etc) to keep them sticky longer.  Otherwise, when the pads stop being sticky and stop conducting the electric impulses they will have to be replaced.I charged the battery originally and so far I haven't had to recharge it, so I'm still on the same charge.  It is showing about a half charge now after 6 sessions.  Which is pretty good in my opinion.  I really figured after about 3 sessions it would be dead. So, I am very impressed with the battery life.The Slendertone Arms7 has 3 programs - with the program 1 basically being conditioning and program 3 being the one you want to get to in order to  tone your arms.  Each program also has 99 levels of intensity.  It's too soon for me to say, but 99 levels might be overkill.  I'm on level 44 now.  The only con I've found so far is the the size of the "one size fits all" cuffs.  I have small arms and feel they are a bit big for me - yes you can adjust the cuff via the Velcro, but since the one strap on the one side is non adjustable, it can only be adjusted down so much.  Therefore, an added adjustment on both sides might be more helpful for really small arms like mine.Overall - it seems to be working and the power is very impressive and I love the fact that you can just charge the battery and not change them constantly.  Also, the controller and cable is just long enough to use, but no so long it's constantly in the way.  The design overall and functionality overall is very good.  5 stars - Marilyn

Kiven 6Pack 3w LED Filament T10 Light Bulb Replacement to 40 Watt Incandescent Tube BulbI like the shape and look of these, but the long shape is also a downfall in regards to getting it to fit many fixture types.  It is too long to fit in my fan lights that also have an enclosed fixture.  I think these would be great in a lamp or a multi lighted item that could take 4 or so of these.  These are only 3w and are comparable to a 40 watt incandescent bulb - so by themselves they do not give you much light.  They do however create a nice warm atmospheric lighting and would be great when atmosphere is wanted or any other low lighted situation.  Of course as I said earlier you can use more than one to get more light in the right light fixtures.Pros: instant ON - unlike the old style of ledscons: long shape won't fit in all fixturesOverall, they work well and the look and design is great but will limit them to what they can fit into. I was sent a free sample in exchange for my review.

These are great.  I used them to lable my pantry containers as an experiment to see how well they worked. So far I was able to erase them nicely with a damp sponge and rewrite on them.  I was also able to remove the label (just as it states - removable labels) and reapply without any issues. I have added a pic so you can see the size in relation to the containers, etc.  I think you can get these in bigger sizes, just depends on your needs.Overall - they work well - no complaints here!

This is an awesome Gaming Headset, one of the best I've had so far.  It is comfortable enough that you can play for hours and the battery can last for many hours as well.  It doesn't feel heavy on my head and fits well.  I am sure most of the comfort is due to the fact that the ear pads are made of memory foam.  The mic is flexible and can be adjusted to get the right clear sound.  It includes Cue software so you can control your keyboard, mouse and headset.  This headset is wireless and the multi-channeled audio is Dolby 7.1 and sounds great.  It also has led indicators by the mic to show mute and battery level and led's on each ear cup that are changeable to show optional various colors and/or patterns you want to display.

This is an excellent assortment of selfie method mounts, etc.  This package is geared towards the Gopro Hero sports Camera, but will still work with many other cameras.  It does have various mounting options and contains a selfie stick with a clamping mounting method (which will work with just about any mobile phone).  It also has a tripod screw type setting that will work with certain cameras if they have the tripod mounting option. It of course also contains the mounting options to attach the Gopro Hero sports Camera and any other camera that mounts the same way.  If you examine the attachments carefully, you can figure out that you can actually switch some the mounting methods around to the other various attachment devices.  For example: there is a handlebar attachment for the gopro hero type mount - but you could use the handlebar attachment and add the tripod mount to it so that other cameras could be used in that situation as opposed to being limited to the Gopro Hero Camera.  I think with as many parts in this package and the fact that you can mix it up a bit and get just what you need for almost any camera mounting situation is a fantastic feature and makes this package very valuable and very useful.  This package was sent to me for free for an honest review.  5 stars

This is really a great invention.  This does exactly what my label maker can do, but with a lot more template options.  You go to avery.com/print to access the online templates.  There are a bunch of templates categorized by type (home, business, etc.). Once you choose your template, you can edit one or edit all labels on the page.  Although, I found it best to print all ten labels on a page when printing.  This is because after printing, in order to fully create the label, you have to crease the paper before removing the labels.  I think it is harder to go back and reprint a second label after having creased the paper.  For me, that is my biggest compliant - having to print all 10 at one time.  But, other than that, the concept is great and I can't wait to label everything in my garage.

If your child loves Mickey, this is for you.  Although, really if they just like to chase and romp, this is still for you.  This little guy plays music and does a few tricks as well.  He does seem to have balance issues.  If he hits the wall, he will fall over, if he is in carpet, he will get stuck and fall over.  He can navigate wide open areas with a flat surface fairly well and will do his best work in that type of area.  But, for the age group he is designed for - no biggie if he falls over while he is being chased etc.  The little ones won't mind and will simply pick him up and continue to play.  This is a great cheerful and uncomplicated toy for smaller children (2yrs - 5yrs old).

This is a nicely designed post.  It takes less than 5 minutes to put it together.  You just screw the top on to the post and the bottom has a screw that screws in from the bottom and includes an allen wrench to screw the bottom one in with.  My one declawed cat actually decided it was his and claimed it right after assembly.  But, I'm sure my other kitties that have claws will get more functional use out of it.  It is fairly tall, but could be taller for most adult cats as they like to stretch really good when they scratch the post.  I like the material on it as opposed to the common carpet type that leaves debris all over the floor from use.  It has a nice modern clean look to it and is very functional.

This is a great cover to protect your phone.  It's only a one piece unit, not bulky in any way.  I was accustomed to the 2 piece ones that entirely enclose your phone.  This one doesn't do that.  The phone easily snaps into it and the front edges of the case come up far enough to protect the phones edges from drops, etc.  I really like this otterbox as it is simple and clean looking.

These are really great.  I was pleasantly surprised at how well they sounded.  They come with extra ear loops and ear buds that include different sizes. Therefore, would be hard to find any ears that they don't fit.  The loop are used to fit the inside fold of your ear, which helps them stay in place while using the correctly sized ear bud to make listening an experience while making it possible to shut out other sounds around you. Since the bud does go directly into your ear, it helps make the sound absolutely crystal clear as well.  The strap goes around the back of your neck, therefore if you do need to remove one or both, the strap would just hang on your neck, not fall to the floor/ground, etc.  These are very nicely designed and the quality is outstanding for bluetooth earbuds.  I received these in exchange for my honest review.  5 stars

This is a nice little electric device that can help your state of mind via it's calming lights or by adding scented oils.It holds just a little under 5.5 ounces (160 ml) of water.  You can add drops of various scented oils or even alcohol to the water for whatever soothing effect you need. The device has an automatic shutoff when the water level gets low.  It also runs very quiet - I was surprised that I couldn't hear it even a tiny bit.  This can be a great device for meditation or just to add some calming effect to your environment, etc.  Works great - 5 stars.  This was sent to me for my fair and honest review.

My skin feels softer and more moist after using this serum. My deeper wrinkles have not vanished - but I do think it has helped the overall tone and definitely has acted as a moisturizer. It comes out of the bottle via pump, so is easy to use and apply without waste.  The product feels good on the skin and you immediately feel your skin is hydrated and it does not burn or have any unpleasant sensations while applying it.  Vitamin C is needed to make collagen, and as we age so does our collagen level. Collagen is needed to keep us young looking (no wrinkles, etc.). Therefore if Vitamin C is needed to make Collagen and we need Collagen -then this product is definitely worth a try.  I use it under my moisturizer - seems to give the best effect that way. It does have a mild smell when applied, can't put my finger on what the scent is, but it isn't unpleasant and vanishes fairly quickly. A free sample was provided for evaluation. Marilyn

When I first started to use this razor I noticed that the shave wasn’t all that great.  But as the weeks went by, it gradually started to do a better job.  I can accept that your body does adapt to a new razor, etc.  But yet even now, it doesn't do as good of a job as a simple razor blade would have done.  This razor comes with a cleaning system.  The cleaning system cleans the heads after each use and keeps the blades sharp for the next use - it also charges the razor at the same time while cleaning.  It also comes with an adjustable 5 setting trimmer, that works very well.  It has a travel case for the razor only.  This razor is for sensitive skin and I'm guessing that is maybe why it is so difficult to get a CLOSE shave, but as I would like a close shave and it not to leave stubble, I'm giving it a 4 star review - for the cost of this razor, I shouldn't have to complain that the shave is not Close enough.

Igearpro  8GB usb voice recorderThis little Deseret recorder works great and can be attached to your keyring.  It has an on/off button to turn recording on or off.  When turned on or off it flickers a red light a couple of times so you know the recorder is on or off.  But, then the light goes away and therefore no one would be the wiser if you were recording anything privately. It does not play anything back from the stick itself as it does not have a speaker, etc.  You can play the recordings back via inserting the device into your pc like a flash drive.  It will open as a storage drive, then you can select whatever file you want to play back.  The sound quality is shockingly good on this small device.  I recommend it for anyone that has a need to quickly create recordings.  I received this device at no expense in exchange for my honest review.

Out of the box - let me start with - you will have to put it together. But, it's not difficult - just assemble the pedestal tubes by screwing them together, then insert the pedestal feet into the base - it will click into place.  Add the tube assembly into the pedestal base, then put the grill base on top of the pedestal tube assembly, etc. Pretty much just follow the easy to understand included instructions.  Once you've followed them all (in 8 easy steps) and added the handle (8th step) - you are ready to grill.As long as you've put it together properly - then you can simply unclip the grill base from the pedestal in order to bring indoors, for indoor grilling if desired.  I have never really considered that I needed an electric grill outside.  However, this indoor/outdoor grill does make it easy to do.  Also, it is much faster than firing up the charcoal grill.  So, definitely when time is an issue and/or flare ups need to be avoided - this is a great healthy way to cook.  The cleanup is not that bad either - but could be made easier with a removable grill plate in addition to the existing removable drip tray. As with most all George Foreman electric grills - they do cook wonderfully and not much room to complain on the taste of the food.  This one is no exception.  I like that you can simply remove it from the stand and bring indoors to cook and/or to clean, etc.  Also, it is not designed to leave outdoors - it should be stored indoors or in a similar climate controlled environment.  Overall, this is a great and fairly versatile grill with a cooking controller that includes a warmer setting and has a light indicator.  This is a great sized grill which can be useful while entertaining as the grill plate is large enough to accommodate 15 portions.  This is a great indoor/outdoor grill.

I received a free watch for review. This is an interesting look for a watch and frankly I've never seen one like this before.  It has a black screen until you push the it's face to reveal the digital time.  It looks much like some of the fitness trackers.  To set the time, you touch the face with a long press, then it goes into "set" mode.  Literally, that one touch "button" does everything. It goes like this to set it:Press the button (screen)--> Hours/Minutes Shows* White it shows, long press on the screen until the hour blink--> Hour blink, minutes are steady. short push on the screen cycle through the hours* Long press on the screen again, Hours are steady, Minutes blink--> Short push on the screen cycle through the minutes* Long press on the screen again, Shows "y 13" for Year 2013.--> Short push on the screen cycle through the Years* Long press on the screen again, Shows Month:Day. Month is blinking, day is steady--> Short push on the screen cycle through the Months* Long press on the screen again, Shows Month:Day. Month is steady, day is blinking--> Short push on the screen cycle through the Days* Long Press and it goes back to normal displayIt may be a bit confusing at first, but once you get the hang of it, it's not as hard.  This is a cool watch for collectors and for those that just want something maybe a bit different or a bit more futuristic looking.  It is a unisex one, so it's really for anyone - especially those that are tired of the norm.

I received a free watch for review. This is a very nice and interesting watch.  It has that vintage antique look like your grandfather carried, but yet it's a much smaller version for women.  I will mention that it comes with no instructions and may be confusing at first as to how to open.  You push the top button and it releases the clasp and wa la the door pops open. You then just turn the knob to set the time. The display is big enough for most to read and thus far I can say the watch keeps time perfectly.  Overall, a cool vintage looking women's watch that comes with a gift box if you want to gift it.  It is priced so low it's hard to resist for yourself and/or as a gift as it's hard to go wrong with this one. Marilyn

Ok, this is an awesome charger and the extra special bonus is it's ability to jump start your car.  Or in this case my motorcycle.  This charger comes in a very nice portable case that can easily slip into my motorcycle's saddle bag.  That way when I need it, I will have it.  Of course, it will also charge just about any other type of battery on your phones, laptops, or tablets as well.  It comes with a digital display for jumping car/motorcycle batteries and it displays the % of power it has and if the battery is ok to charge.  It also has other cables that are to be used for the phone charging, etc.  Oh and did I mention it has a flashlight too. A hi tech flash light that also does strobing and sos distress signal.  For the cost of this unit, I think if nothing else it should be part of everyone's survival kit.  Especially those that live where hurricanes occur.  I have been there and something like this would have been wonderful at that time.  I remember scavenging for batteries and how expensive they were just to purchase when a hurricane was expected.  This little unit is worth it's weight in gold.  It has so many practical uses, I could go on and on.  It claims to hold a charge for 3 months - I haven't had it charged and left it alone long enough to testify to that or not, but hoping that to be true.  Of course you can always hook up the lcd accessory and check the battery level as well as get a quick indication of how charged it is by it's light bar indicator when you power it on.  You can charge the unit up either via it's included wall charger or it's included car charger.  I think this is a must have device and has many charging abilities.

This is a really nice set and very essential to any kitchen.  The fat separator has a screen at the top to strain bits and pieces before it goes into the container.  Then after going into the container, you can push the red button on the handle and it will release the natural goody juice from the opening in the bottom of the fat separator.  This is very nice and very functional as opposed to the ones that separate from the top or even worse having to manually use a spoon to dip your juice.  So, this is nice and works well.  Also, worth mentioning the container is HUGE - holds 4 cups - that's big enough to do large cooking projects as well as smaller ones.The baster gadget is nothing to be ignored either.  It is also HUGE - big enough to take on a turkey, etc. easily.  But, it can also be used for smaller things.  It comes with two attachments.  One is a brush which gives you a lot of control while basting.  The other attachment has holes in the end - more like a strainer.  Depending on your needs, both can be very useful attachments and are nice to have as options on the single large basting tube.This is a nice set and should be useful in any kitchen.

This is a niffy little recorder that I was provided free in exchange for my honest review.  Much more sophisticated than it appears. The first thing I did was put it on it's usb charger and let it charge so I could play with it adequately.  After the charging process, I began the drilling process of putting it thru it's paces.  It takes a while to get the hang of how it actually works.  For example: to raise the volume, you have to hit play/pause, then hit volume (you will see the speaker display), then use the up or down adjustments to actually adjust it..  Also things to consider - it doesn't actually have a stop button.  Therefore, you have to hit the record button again to actually stop recording and save it or hit pause when you are finished listening to something. Other wise regarding playback - it will play continuously. The only options I found were to either only repeat the current file or repeat all files. It does separate your voice recordings on the dvr from the actual music files though - which is a nice feature, especially during playback.  It also has a dvr or music status display on the screen.  But, after mastering the not so obvious controls, it then becomes fairly easy to use.
